author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2016
review_content: “In the future . . . if by some miracle you ever find yourself in the position to fall in love again . . . fall in love with me.”I'm going to start this review off with this statement: I didn't cry while I was reading this book, but I did cry several days later when I was looking back on Lily's story. That shows how emotionally charged this story is, along with the true power behind Colleen's writing. I'm not going to give away any spoilers because you need to go into the book blind. If you want to know what happens, there are definitely some reviews out there that tell you the big twists and turns. But take my advice and don't spoil this book for yourself. It will lose a lot if you go in knowing exactly what to expect. So seriously, don't do it to yourself. Just let the beauty of Colleen's writing sweep over you and sink in.“All humans make mistakes. What determines a person's character aren't the mistakes we make. It's how we take those mistakes and turn them into lessons rather than excuses.”This is honestly not only one of the best reads of 2016, but also one of the most (if not the most) empowering. I want to give this book to every man, woman, and even teenager (it's definitely a NA/adult read) and tell them... READ THIS NOW! Do you want to know why? Because this book carries with it a very strong message, one that shows strength and courage that many people might not have at the time, but after reading will understand and gain. I honestly don't know if there has ever been a time when I was prouder to be reading the heroine's story due to her choices. Ultimately though, Colleen Hoover wrote a book that everyone can take something away from. Colleen always writes such unique stories, and this one is certainly no exception. But the one thing I will say is that this is truly her best book yet.“Just because someone hurts you doesn't mean you can simply stop loving them. It's not a person's actions that hurt the most. It's the love. If there was no love attached to the action, the pain would be a little easier to bear.”Lily's story is one that I never wanted to stop reading. If I know that I'm going to need to read a book in multiple sittings (which was the case with this book), I usually try to find a good place to stop. One in which, nothing major is happening and nobody is facing some drastic/perilous moment. Well you see the problem with this book is the fact that there is literally NO. GOOD. STOPPING. POINT! None! There was never a part where I felt safe in letting this book sit overnight because I knew that the story and the what if's would play endlessly in my mind. So I stayed up and read it all in one sitting because I simply couldn't stop. Lily was someone that I connected to right from the get go. I knew as soon as the book started that I would like her, and that never once stopped while I was reading. However, I didn't realize how much her character would affect me while I was reading. As I said before, after I was finished reading, I couldn't have been prouder of her decisions. The strength she had throughout the story to go through what she did, but also her resolve and conviction just made me constantly cheer her on. Lily is truly one of the most admirable characters that I have ever had the pleasure of reading about, and that admiration goes extraordinarily deep.“Life is a funny thing. We only get so many years to live it, so we have to do everything we can to make sure those years are as full as they can be. We shouldn't waste time on things that might happen someday, or maybe even never.”I mentioned it briefly above, but this book has a very powerful message, and this message is actually carefully woven into the story from page 1. You obviously don't realize it when you start reading the novel, but it's there when you look back after finishing. And this is also why I'm going to reiterate the importance of going into the story blind, because just as unexpected and emotional it is for the reader to read and witness what Lily goes through, it is even more unexpected and emotional for Lily. This is where this book truly shines, because you as a reader feel like part of the story. There's a very slow burn while reading, one in which we get to know characters and see the develop in the ways that we as humans get to know each other...but then Colleen rips that metaphorical rug out from under all of us, and shocks us with one revelation after another. But you know what? That's exactly how life is sometimes...sometimes you never see things coming in a million years and you have to figure out how to deal with these radical changes you never thought would happen.“It stops here. With me and you. It ends with us.”Where this book really got me though was the meaning of the title. Throughout the entire time I was reading, I kept wondering what the title meant. Because come on...this is Colleen Hoover and literally EVERYTHING has some significance (no matter how small). And when I got to the part of the story where the title finally made sense, guys let me tell you...this had an impact on me like no other. I just sat there with my book in my hands staring at the page for a solid 5 minutes. It is the perfect title for the perfect book.“Fifteen seconds. That’s all it takes to completely change everything about a person. Fifteen seconds that we'll never get back.”I connected with this book in my own way, and for that I am extraordinarily thankful to Colleen Hoover for even writing this book. The author's note at the end was just as powerful and amazing as the rest of the story, but it shows just how personal this story was for her to write. I applaud Colleen for writing this book and not "making things easy" for the main character or glossing over the "bad parts." This is an incredibly realistic book that makes you realize many things and leaves an imprint on your soul. It's important to remember that everyone must make extraordinarily difficult decisions in their life, and not everyone will agree with them. If this book even empowers one woman to take steps in making an important decision, the Colleen Hoover did her job. And I count myself lucky to have had the honor of reading this story because I am a changed person because of it!Happy reading :)
title: Everyone Needs to Read This Now!

author: C. Boyce
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: I bought this because of the reviews. I have not read any of Ms. Hoover’s books, so I didn’t know what to expect.  However, 100 pages in and I’m not going to finish.  This is a bodice ripper “romance” novel.  Not even a well written one, frankly.  It’s baffling that books like this still sell in 2020!  Nothing empowering.  Women swoon over handsome doctors and sleep with them even when they “aren’t that kind of girl” because the doc is handsome and rich so...”let me go pretty myself up so he can have his way” blah, blah.  What rubbish!  I seriously don’t understand the reviews, but then again I never read any of that “50 Shades”garbage so I guess there is a market, it just isn’t me.Anyway, don’t expect great literature with this one.  In fact, set expectations really low and maybe you can get through it.  Me? Life is too short to waste any of it on crappy books.
title: Bodice Ripper nonsense

author: Heather K (Dentist in my Spare Time)
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2016
review_content: *Spoiler-free review*I have a confession to make here, folks:I dismissed Colleen Hoover years ago and I haven't read anything from her since.It's true. Three or four years ago I went through a string of so-so to bad Colleen Hoover books, and I decided to just put her out of my mind. I ignored her new releases, and I lumped her into my mental pile for authors who are "not for me."Recently, one of my friends wanted to buddy read this book. I thought, "Gah, pay full price for a book I'm not going to like?" However, I sucked it up and sort of grumbled about it, but I decided to give it a go.And this book blew me away.The Colleen Hoover I last read wasn't writing books at this caliber. This was a whole different level.For one, there are none, and I mean NONE, of the tired romance tropes presents in this book. In fact, this book was a little more woman's fiction than romance, if I'm being honest. While I guess it can still be classified, genre-rules-style, as romance, it is more about Lily's life experiences and the lessons that she learns about herself than anything else. There is a romance present, but I don't think it is the main focus of the story. While I'm not typically a women's fiction fan, I think that if this book took any other trajectory, it wouldn't have been as powerful.I typically don't read reviews before starting a book. In fact, I didn't even read the blurb for this one, or if I did, I forgot it before starting to read. I liked that. I think going in blind with an open mind and minimal expectations is the way to go. Though the twists and turns aren't 100% unexpected, the author very much succeeded in pulling the rug out from under me on more than one occasion.I'm usually not a fan of books where people say, "Wow, that made me think. This book is a thinker." I usually just roll my eyes internally because I assumed that the readers are being played like emotional pawns. I know, I'm judgy. But in this case, yeah, I was thinking a whole hell of a lot. It made me reevaluate how I perceive others and their relationships, and it made me rethink my biases. People are always know-it-alls until they are in the situation themselves, and then it doesn't seem quite as simple.The author made one right decision after another with this story. I think that is the key to its success. The author made a relatable, human character in Lily, and gave each supporting character their positives and negatives. There are no villains here. No easy answers. Colleen Hoover also made an insanely smart decision to have only Lily narrate the story. There was no other choice, really, but it gave readers a laser-focus on her, which is where our focus deserves to be.While this book has a positive ending, it is also a story that can be described as gritty, difficult, hopeful, powerful, and crushing, all at the same time. It is a long story, but it has a fast-pace with plot elements thrown in at the right times to keep interest engaged. I couldn't put the book down from the moment I got into the groove, and I read this story all night until the last page. The dedication is also important to read, but make sure you do it after you've finished the story and not before.Colleen Hoover impressed me so much with this story. It made me rethink a lot of things, but most of all, it made me rethink how I judged Colleen Hoover years ago. I won't dismiss her so easily again.
title: NOT a Colleen Hoover fan-girl but this was GORGEOUS! **Spoiler-free**

author: Anne Z.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2018
review_content: The reality of this book has left me speechless. I have been staring at this computer screen for a good hour now trying to find the right words. And that is after I spent a good 6 hours in my couch reading it. This is not the kind of book that can easily be put down to be read later, there are no good spots to stop. Once you start it becomes incredibly difficult to take a break.The story is complex. It is raw. It is honest. It is sad. It is painful.It shows the reality of human nature. The reality that we are not black and white, simply good or bad. The vast majority of us fall somewhere in the middle- people that make mistakes.It Ends with Us is told through Lilly's eyes. It is told in the present tense but we also get glimpses into her past as she reads journal entries from when she was a teen.Lilly is brave and strong. But also as vulnerable as any other woman out there. I was rather impressed with her character, with her sense of self and her ability to prioritize. She had many hard choices to make and she made them well. They were hard, very hard... and there will be a small part of you, as there was a small part of her, who will wish different, but you will know that she did the right thing in the end.Riley is amazing! I absolutely loved him. And he is the perfect example of how things are not always as they seem. But most importantly, of how often there is so much more to someone's story than we know. Everyone has a past and everyone is -for better or worse- defined by that past. I believe with all my heart that Colleen Hoover chose the right ending for both Lilly and Riley, but I do not believe someone like Riley should be treated with hatred. I felt his pain, specially in the end.Atlas was pure perfection. There are so many kids out there in the world like him. How wonderful would it be if there were more Lillys?!All in all this was a fantastic read. Super emotional. Heart wrenching.When the book was over though something did not feel right. The last 3-4 pages felt rushed. Lilly 'jumped ship' too fast.And all that being said, I feel I should mention something I did not see mentioned anywhere and I was certainly not told myself: if you have been in a abusive situation (parents/partners/other) and still have hard days, don't read unless you are having a good day. I will be honest and say that had I know what the book was about before reading it I would not have read it. I felt in the end of this book similarly to how I felt when I finished reading The Problem with Forever two months ago (another book I started without knowing what it was going to be about)- reliving memories better forgotten. It was far to real, and if you, like me, can relate to the main female character in either of those books, you also know you need to be in the right frame of mind while reading it...
title: I have been staring at this computer screen for a good hour now trying to find the right words

author: Krista
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2016
review_content: I don't know how to write a review with tears running down my cheeks and pain, constricting, sorrowful pain taking over my chest.I waited a little while to read Lily and Ryle's story. I was really scared because of all the things I'd been hearing. But I overcame that fear and dove in with my eyes wide and heart open. I regret waiting.As hard as it was, I'm so glad Colleen Hoover wrote this amazing story. And it was really painful to read so I can't imagine what it was like writing it.I refuse to give spoilers in my reviews, just reactions.And my reaction is this.Being brave and bold...it takes a whole new meaning with this story. I'm so glad that Colleen is the embodiment of this new phrase that I cherish. Because she's doing just that.
title: It ends with us...

author: Diane L
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2016
review_content: I felt almost voyeuristic reading this book. I could tell it came from deep inside the authors soul. From a place of reflection and courage. And, an understanding of what makes a human break and what makes them heal.I feel privileged to have read a compassionate portrayal of something I knew little about. It gave me an understanding of a situation I found hard to relate to before I read this book. I like how Hoover showed compassion and understanding to the abuser and the abused...yet, did not justify or excuse the toleration of it. I also felt that Hoover showed that true freedom came from forgiving and from making hard changes to end generational cycles of violence and codependency.My only Criticism is I ached to know more about the burgeoning second chance relationship between Atlas and Lilly. So please consider some kind of follow up. Maybe from Atlas's POV and picking up where they began again.As always, keep writing CoHo.
title: Gah!

author: Macie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: I feel like I should preface this with I'm a very opinionated person. There is very seldom a time in my life where I am speechless.It Ends With Us made me speechless.It made me feel. It made so many different emotions swirl through my mind, shoot through my heart, and lodge into the very depths of my dark soul. Giving a review of this book without spoilers is nearly impossible, but I'll try my best. It's the least I can do because CoHo has just given us her best work to date, and I don't say that lightly.The way Colleen made you feel every single emotion--from empathy to anger, from sadness to happiness, from understanding to confusion--in the span of 373 pages is unparalleled. As someone who has lived the same trials that Lily has, I understood the struggle between loving someone else while needing to love your self worth more.Hoover has obliterated every single pedestal she's placed herself on thus far. She's crushed them with It Ends With Us. She's given us not only a book, but a story. A story so many people have lived in silence. A story that so many don't understand. She gave a voice to the voiceless. She gave those who feel like everything is hopeless... Hope.If I could, I would give this book 100 stars. It's worth so much more than 5 measly stars, but this will have to do.
title: 5 Stars Isn't Enough

author: Leslie Register
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2018
review_content: I don’t think I have words to do this book justice. Not only was it a good book but it totally had made me think on such a deeper level. Without spoiling, I must say I fell in love with one character feeling heartbroken like you do watching a movie that you want so badly to end a different way. Then the strength of Lily exemplified the strength of women in these situations. I guess without realizing it I’ve categorized these women as somewhat weak but that is so so so wrong. Seriously so well written that I will check out more of Hoover’s work.
title: Speechless

author: Lauren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2019
review_content: I cannot tell you how angry this book made me feel. I’m not sure if I’m the only one, but considering all the five star reviews it seems I’m one of a few that flat out didn’t care for this book. I gave it two starts because 1) I still love Colleen and will continue to read her work. 2) I do love the way she writes, her style is still one of my favorites.Starting out this book moved way too fast for my liking. The middle got extremely slow. Then the end spread up again to the point where I almost stopped reading it. She stayed in the apartment her husband beat her up and tried to rape her in? And then you let him be a part of your s and the child’s life!? I can’t even with this book. This guy never gets in trouble for his actions, and is free to do what he did to lily to anyone else who comes along. Yes they loved each other, and the result of that love was heartbreaking. But I can’t say the end result didn’t make me anything but mad. I loved atlas and if the story had started with him, broken off with him leaving and her attending college, and then them accidentally meeting up again at his restaurant, THAT would have been a great storyline. I know this book was personal to Colleen and I give her mad props for sharing pieces of her and her moms life. And I’m abuse needs to be talked about more, I have nothing wrong with that. I just don’t The the story wrapped around it, and the choices she made for the characters.Words just cannot describe how irritated I was when I finished this book.As I said in the beginning, I still love Colleen Hoover and the way she creates a story, I just can’t stand this one. *All personal opinion*
title: Heartbreaking and frustrating

author: Oakley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2017
review_content: As I started to read this novel, which I had loaded onto my Kindle some weeks earlier, I was thinking "Why in the heck did I get this? I HATE romance novels!" And it surely seemed like a modern romance novel, replete with a red-haired heroine (Why are the heroines always red-headed or have "burnished curls"? What about the occasional limp beigy-gray tendrils? Oh, OK ... I digress ...) who is gorgeous and spunky and smart and determined; a serious chiseled-jaw male with a perfect physique and a successful career (a neurosurgeon!); an unbelievably supportive (and rich) best friend; the requisite gay male friend who can be called upon for last minute dates ... i.e. the usual cast of characters. Then, of course, the "meet cute", which happens several times to build tension; the unadulterated lust of the guy (who actually falls to his knees to beg for sex at one point); the obvious attraction, but cautiousness of the gal; the holy-crap-big seduction scene. All so predictable, all so typical, contrived Romance Novel. (Is it only me or does everyone kinda wish the heroine would fall in a vat of acid to shake things up?) The writing is typical of that genre, also, with its amazing coincidences and excessive hyperbole: she cries harder than she has ever cried before, then a few pages later, she cries harder than ever once again; they are the best cookies she has ever tasted, this is the best restaurant she has ever eaten in; she is sadder than she ever been in her life. Etc. Every other page has a new benchmark, by gosh. I almost gave up on the book at least three times in the first 40% of it, but well, I was comfy, two cats were asleep on my lap, I was sipping wine, soft music, things could be worse. I persevered. But then things started changing subtly, then less subtly. I stopped gagging and paid more attention. The characters were still beautiful, each of several relationships still had its own cutesy, private vocabulary and references, all the good guys were still giving to charity, but suddenly we weren't in Kansas anymore. I don't want to go further because I am really glad that I didn't know how the plot was going to turn. There are a lot of reviews here that can give you that information if you want it. The writing is still a little pat. This isn't great literature. It is an easy enough read, but there is an important kernel of Truth revealed. I am really glad I didn't knock the cats off my lap and find something else to read.
title: Not What It First Appears To Be

author: Jeani Rector
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2019
review_content: This book makes an important issue of spousal abuse seem insignificant. A VERY SHALLOW take on this matter. Don't buy this book. You will see what I mean if you do. Oh, and let's not forget how the main character instantly jumps into another man's arms. Like she has to have a man in her life no matter what. No healing, no therapy, no nothing...she just needs another man as her solution. Disgusting.
title: Treats the abuse issue as shallow and insignificant

author: Patty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2019
review_content: This book went from enjoyment to frustration. Terrible ending and direction where she took characters. Not realistic when dealing with abuse--- it's not always black or white. Did not like her making Ryle the villain. How s character wasn't congruent with that of an abusive man. A big let down.
title: Terrible ending-- not what I expected

author: Sue Tint
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover is one of my top 5 favorite authors, ever. Her writing is beautiful. The way she can weave a story into your heart is like no other. Because the reader should go into this book blind, I'm not going to say anything specifically about the story, the plot or anything that might give it away. I do want to share, though, that I was just so, so about this book until about the halfway point. Again, the writing was beautiful, and it seemed we were getting a sweet romance, but I was waiting for something.... And at the halfway point, we all got it! And it was not a disappointment.Colleen Hoover knows how to write intense stories that make you love characters, and even hate characters. And sometimes you both love AND hate the same character. You just never know what you are in for. While Hoover tackled a controversial subject in It Ends With Us, and it was very personal to her, she did so with respect and beauty. Thank you for that.
title: Another beautiful, brilliant, and intense story from Ms. Hoover

author: Dani
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: I have been patiently...okay, impatiently, waiting for this book to release. I love this author and her unique stories. This is hands down her BEST book. I will not give away ANYTHING from this book. When everyone says, go in blind, do exactly that. Do not skip ahead. Just sit back, relax, and read every single word. This book will make you laugh. But it will mostly make you cry. But it is so SO worth the tears. You will feel everything this book has to offer. I will say I have NEVER been more proud of a heroine. And I have never been proud of an author who delivered this incredible story. I'm already ready for more. I need more, Colleen. Those of you who have read the story you know exactly what I'm talking about.  I need MORE. I promise you haven't read this book before. It is honest and unique. There needs to be a 10 stars option. READ IT. LOVE IT.For those who are unsure about this book, I promise it will be a great read. It actually bothers me a little that some people didn't get the message the author was trying to deliver in this book. If you open your mind and heart you'll understand. In a way, you'll become the main character. One of the best and unique reading experiences I've ever had.
title: Go in blind. Trust Colleen.

author: Shwillia58
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020
review_content: I didn't exactly know what the premise of this book was when I read it but I think it was very well written. Not a topic I know a lot about but it did make me think and brought a good viewpoint to why woman stay in a bad situation. I would recommend this book.
title: Good Read

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2017
review_content: Please have tissues when you read this book!  I will say it again Colleen Hoover did it again!! This book is so hard at times because a such as you know what is right you just want to justify the wrong. I am so proud of Lily because she really defeats the odds that most people could and would never be able to do!! As for Atlas well he is just the most amazing, selfless, strong, one of a kind human being that we wish to be!!! Ryle, I don't even know what to say he is hot, sexy, amazing until ... well until he is not and then really when said and done you have to have a heart and feel for him!! When I finished this book last night I actually feel asleep with tears in my eyes for the whole story! All I can say is sometimes we have to just keep swimming!! I will have a big book hangover from this one for a while!!
title: Wow

author: Amy Daws
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
review_content: Holy cow, what did I just read?This was not your standard Colleen Hoover romance novel. I struggle to call this a true romance novel because of the weight of the issues the main couple went through. I wasn't rooting for them to succeed. I was rooting for them to fail...which is a weird feeling to have.But ultimately it's a beautifully-written, eye-opening story that sheds so much light on a tough subject. And we could all use more compassion and understanding in our lives.I'm giving it 4 stars because the writing is exquisite and the story is sound...but this is not the kind of CoHo read that I'll ever pick back up again.But I respect that important messages need to be told.My head hurts.My heart is heavy.And my soul is changed."Preventing your heart from forgiving someone you love is actually a hell of a lot harder than simply forgiving them."
title: Not a Re-Reader

author: Hammer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019
review_content: After reading this, I can now understand better why my strong daughter, who I NEVER would have believed would have put up with anything, stayed in an abusive relationship. She got out, went on to become a court advocate for domestic violence victims and has moved on to being an advocate for elderly abuse victims. Not all abusive relationships end as well as this book did. But this book lets you see the how, the why, the hidden.
title: Beautiful writing and pulls you in all different directions.

author: Feeding My Addiction Book Reviews
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: ❝ Be that girl, Lily.Be brave and bold.❞When there is the amount of hype surrounding a book, such as that which surrounded ‘It Ends With Us’, there is always a fear that when I read it, the book will not live up to the hype.‘It Ends With Us’ not only lived up to it, it surpassed it.This book was brutally honest, painful and heartbreaking. But, ‘It Ends With Us’ was also heartwarming, hopeful and inspirational.To represent two sides of a coin and make you fall in love with these characters despite or in spite of them, was no easy feat. Ms. Hoover tackled difficult subjects with grace and honesty. She didn’t take sides. She lets the reader do that. And by not assigning blame, you realize things rarely are what they seem.❝There’s no such thing as bad people. We’re all just people who sometimes do bad things.❞Stellar, sincere writing, with unforgettable characters and a solid plot that rocked my foundation, ‘It Ends With us’ is a top favorite of the year and will stay with me for years to come! 6 Stars!
title: TOP FAVE OF THE YEAR

author: GingerSnap
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2017
review_content: When my bookclub announced this was the book we were reading for August, I groaned about having to read a second "young adult romance". I was badly on need of a good page turner where I could get lost inside the pages, forget about my troubles and most importantly: learn something meaningful about life and gain deeper understanding of life. ..I  am so glad i gave it a shot after several ladies ranted and raved about.The first half is well written and keeps you engaged, but it's the second that really drives the book home. It breaks your heart, puts it back together, breaks it again and then knocks your socks off with the deep emotional gravity of the ending. It couldn't have ended better and it was completely unexpected and perfectly beautiful.Read it.
title: Dont judge a book by its cover. There's so much more inside

author: Miki - I A-M a Bookaholic
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2016
review_content: 5 Blossom stars!This is my hoover first and I didn't expect this.When Lily saw her first love again, the new thing the spark she is building with Ryle is start breaking, and she is about to face some serious problems.Everything isn't white or black, it's not simple and definitely not easy but it's life.It's an unforgettable tale of love that comes at the ultimate price.This book is the reason I love books- this book.I love it when I read a book "between the red and green trafficlights" thats means that the book is so freaking good that I can't leave it even for a second.I love it when its the kind of book that you can't stop thinking about it.I just L-O-V-E it.This is exactly it.It ends with us is a love story that isn't a love story but it is.It's about something way more..Its about women and men , about family, about some serious stuff that is part of our daily lives, it has values - important ones that you learn between the lines.It about a girl who learning about life and seem to understand better about her things she had believed once.Its about compassion and friendship.Once you read it, you get it all - epic love, friendship, family, joy, ugly cry, laugh,  anger, sadness and a beautiful closure.The characters are vivid, realistic, humans and lovable.I can say that I inlove with Atlas and Ryle, I love Issa and I LOVE Lily.Lily is strong and beautiful, she is a role model."Imagine all the people you meet in your life. There are so many. They come in like waves, trickling in and out with the tide. Some waves are much bigger and make more of an impact than others. Sometimes the waves bring with them things from deep in the bottom of the sea and they leave those things tossed onto the shore. Imprints against the grains of sand that prove the waves had once been there, long after the tide recedes."
title: Must read - 5 blossom stars

author: RachelReads
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2016
review_content: What do I say that hasn't already been said? This book left me lying on the floor staring at the ceiling, contemplating everything in life. Such a powerful book, so much so that it doesn't matter if you've ever been in an abusive relationship or not, you'll FEEL it. Lily is the most incredible heroine I've ever encountered. I felt her pain, her uncertainty. I honestly wasn't sure what would happen at the end. I hurt for every single one of the characters. "I think about how sometimes, no matter how convinced you are that your life will turn out a certain way, all that certainty can be washed away with a simple change in tide" It is SO easy, as humans, to make judgments about situations we've never lived through. Thankfully, I've never been physically abused, but this book spoke to me on so many levels. It Ends With Us is a book that will stay with me forever.
title: Be Brave. Be Bold.

author: Alexa330
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: As many of you have seen this book gets amazing reviews.  The hype was already there before the book was even released, and to be honest sometimes that makes me fearful that the book just won't live up to expectations, but then you read this and you realize that expectations can go out the window and you are just so floored by what you just experience you don't even truly comprehend what just happened and how it affected you.  Collen Hoover really knows how to tell a story, if you have ever read any of her books you know that.  But this book touched me in a way I can't even explain.  The subject matter is not something I can personally relate to, but reading it taught me about me.  About the judgments we are quick to make based on little information.  It taught me about stepping into my mother's shoes instead of judging her, and it taught me about being stronger to push through obstacles and break with habits and a life that even though you love, is not the best for you and your loved ones.  I am just in awe, and thankful that I actually read it. Its personal, dark, light, happy, and sad all at once.  Its realistic and raw, and I think I will forever remember this book in a sea of forgettable stories, either in real life or the written word this one will stay with me forever.
title: Amazing read-Life changing

author: OHDTMT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
review_content: I love anything Colleen writes. I've been waiting on this book for what seems like forever haha it took me a bit becuz I've just been a little busy at home. But I can only go 4 stars this time.Ugly Love is still my favorite. Period.I did love this but I think it's mainly becuz of her past she wrote about & Atlas. I liked Ryle ok but I loved Atlas. I can't connect with the "issue" in the book & I'm thankful for that & glad for how lily handled it. I was actually worried that I hadn't shed one tear reading one of Colleen's books haha but then it happened at the end with these 2 small words, "It's Dory." I was done there. Then the last line of the book set me up too.I'm glad it didn't end how I thought it would. Cuz I really had myself set up for forgiveness & I was kinda getting mad haha.I wonder if there will ever be a book she writes that I'm like ehhhhh, it was aight haha
title: 4.5 Stars

author: Elaine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020
review_content: TW: Rape, Domestic AbuseWow - This novel truly takes you on a heart-wrenching, but beautiful ride. It depicts domestic abuse in a way that I think everyone should read. The author did a lot of deep research and digging into her own family's experiences to really try and portray the feelings of someone in an abusive relationship. I recommend this book to anyone!! It is romance read at its core, but it's also about hopes, dreams, family, and growth. SUCH an amazing read!! YOU WILL NEED TISSUES!!!!
title: One of the best books I've read in awhile

author: Jackie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2018
review_content: Going into the book i thought it was going to be a sweet little tringle love story. Its not. I love atlas thats about it. I hate all the other charaters and i just feel like REALLY with lilly, the main charater, some parts are not believeable which gets me to think do i like this book? This is so dumb! And then other parts make me read fast and want to know everything. So all in all im on the fence about this book. Would i recomend it? No.
title: Three stars

author: Samantha
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2016
review_content: This was the first book I've read by Colleen Hoover, and can I just say it blew me away.I choose this book due to all the positive reviews, and was not disappointed. At first, I thought it was going to be a lovey mush-mush book, which is not really my cup of tea. Boy, was I wrong! Once I got a little further involved in the story, I couldn't put it down. I practically read it in one sitting. I smiled, I cried, and by the end... my stomach hurt. I love it when an author can do that to me! Make me forget about everything, and just be in their world. It was simply incredible. Also, the note from the author was raw and beautiful. Thank you for letting a little air out my my heart Mrs. Hoover. This was a book that made me rethink some of my viewpoints, and I appreciate that.I feel exceptionally lucky to have read this, because it's so rare to find a book that leaves this sort of impact on me. I actually read this pretty soon after finishing All the Ugly and Wonderful Things by Bryn Greenwood, and thought I wouldn't find another book that could evoke such strong emotions in me again this year, but I did. Both of these are books that make you mad after they're over, because you know whatever you read next, won't even begin to compare to it.
title: Wow. That was a good book!

author: My Best Book Life
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2018
review_content: This book is like a rollercoaster...in the best possible way! It sucked me in and then spit me out. One minute I was giddy and laughing feeling the promise of all consuming new love. The next minute I’m horrified not wanting Ryle to not be who he was morphing into. Then I’m shouting at the book when Atlas reappears. Then I’m gutted for Lily and what she’s going through. The emotional seesaw leaves you unsure yet somehow satisfied. I really loved this book...reallllly loved it. In the end I was most torn about Ryle...Colleen Hoover perfectly proved her point with him. He was the epitome of love...how it can cover your eyes so tightly with both hands blocking out all rhyme or reason causing you to fly so high or fall so far. I wanted a little more at the end, but this book was a hell of a ride!
title: All.The.Feels

author: Susan Luna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2019
review_content: The feelings I'm feeling after reading this book are all over the place, I'm happy, sad, upset but mostly I don't know how I feel. This book was amazing. The journey, the story just sucked me in from the first chapter. I literally didn't put it down until it was finished. Now that it's finished, I'm sad again because it was just that good. I'm a huge Colleen Hoover fan because her stories just suck you in and they come to life in your head (is that weird to say?) because,she is such an amazing author.
title: Just wow!

author: Kristin B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2016
review_content: ***I would give this more than 5 stars if I could.***I finished this book late last night but didn't think it would be fair for me to try to write a review on this extremely moving and complex novel before I gave it some thought. Typically I write book reviews shortly after finishing books since they are fresh in my mind but this one required some processing before I could find the appropriate words. First, let me backtrack and state that this is my first novel by Colleen Hoover and I loved it so much that I've already bought a couple of her other books! I had just started reading a different book when I saw this book advertised on social media and thought I'd see what it was about. I immediately purchased It Ends with Us and stopped reading my other novel, which is something I very rarely do. Though there isn't a book description listed on the product page, I was intrigued because of the high percentage of 5 star reviews and most of the reviews I read were very enigmatic.  After having read the book, I can see why many reviewers chose to review It Ends with Us in that way."Imagine all the people you meet in your life. There are so many. They come in like waves, trickling in and out with the tide. Some waves are much bigger and make more of an impact than others. Sometimes the waves bring with them things from deep in the bottom of the sea and they leave those things tossed onto the shore. Imprints against the grains of sand that prove the waves had once been there, long after the tide recedes."Normally in a book review, I will introduce the protagonists and give my own summary without giving spoilers, however I feel this review needs to be different because, as other reviewers have stated, I feel it's best to go into reading this book blind, or at least mostly blind. There are three main characters, one female and two males but it is not a love triangle. Besides these three, there are also some friends and family members who play important parts in the development of the story. Without them, the story would not turn out the way it does. All of these characters have admirable qualities as well as faults and that's what makes them human. Throughout the novel, we see especially the main female protagonist grow and learn from her life experiences."Just because we didn't end up on the same wave, doesn't mean we aren't still a part of the same ocean."It's hard to decide which genre this book fits into because there are elements of many genres within this novel. There is romance but not so much that it takes away from the storyline. There is also some humor, not in a I-laughed-so-much-my-abs-hurt-and-I-can't-breathe way. For me, I snickered every now and then. I find it safe to say this novel fits in the contemporary fiction genre the best, in my opinion.I feel a good amount of the novel is light and fun but there is also some sadness and complicated situations. When I hit the 60% mark in this book, I spent the rest of the time with my hand either covering my mouth or over my chest. I also bit off most of my nails because I was so anxious to read what would happen next. As I finished the novel, I had some tears because it was so moving and beautiful. I definitely recommend reading the Author's Note at the end which explains how the author found her inspiration for this novel. I cried while reading that too.In summary, I'm so happy I decided to read It Ends with Us because I loved it! This was my first Colleen Hoover novel and I'm already planning on reading some of her other novels. I just can't believe it took me this long to discover her but now that I have, I will look forward to her new releases. Whether you've read books by Colleen Hoover or not, I highly recommend reading this novel. It Ends with Us has made me a new fan and I can't wait to read another one of her books!
title: Colleen Hoover Has Gained a New Fan!

author: Amanda Brackett
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: I've been sitting here since yesterday trying to come up with words to review this book.  I'm still trying to come to terms with it.  This is proabbly the best book that Colleen has written.  I don't say that lightly either.  I have loved all of her books, but this story is one that will resonate with you and even change how you view things.  I don't want to give anything away because this is a book you should go in blind with.  I always go in blind with Colleen's books, but this one specifically made me glad that I do so.  I feel like this book will really change some peoples lives and give them new insight.  I finished it in one sitting and I still, 24 hours later, can't stop thinking about it.  Read this book.  You won't be disappointed.  If this is your first Colleen Hoover book, well happy reading.  I know you won't be able to resist the rest of her books after you have read this one.
title: Thought Provoking

author: Christina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: It Ends With Us by Colleen Hoover6 heart-wrenching stars!All hail the Queen! I cannot fathom how Colleen can move me so much time and time again. Her words are food to my soul. I preordered this book without even checking the blurb and kept it that way until I begun reading.This one started a little slower than most of Colleen's books, but it was very fitting for this novel. It allowed to to develop strong feelings for each character, only to have my heart shattered at the first twist. A long string of curse words flew out of my mouth and I felt all the same things Lily did in that moment. The feeling of confusion will haunt me for a long time.I'm still torn how I wanted this story to end but felt the path Colleen chose was brave. When you finish this story, share it with a friend. You never know when a book can come in to someone's life at exactly the right moment.
title: It Ends With Us by Colleen Hoover 6 heart-wrenching stars ...

author: Kristi Reads
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2018
review_content: I've followed Colleen Hoover since the beginning, like many of her dedicated readers. It Ends with Us is NOT like any Colleen Hoover book I have read.... yes, she has broken my heart in the past. Yes, I have cried in public places reading "Hopeless" and "Slammed" and even "November 9"....... but It Ends with Us keeps me coming back over and over again, always needing some time and space to reflect on what the hell just happened.In many of her novels, Colleen does a fantastic job of showing all the ugly sides of love (see what I did there?). But It Ends with Us should be read and read and re-read by every woman you ever meet. Share it with your mom. With your sister. With your aunt and best friend and nieces. Because abuse doesn't have to stare you right in the face to be abuse... sometimes, it creeps up on you, even when you know the signs.
title: Give it to your mother. Your sister. Your cousin, niece, best friend, the lady that lives next door with 15 cats. Everyone.

author: christopher hernandez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
review_content: The first half of the book reads like a porno with fluffy filler conversation. It was embarrassing to take it out on the subway. Seems like it was written by a teenager who thinks sex is what love is. The lack of character development makes it impossible to gain any insight into the sensitive topics that the author attempts to address. Reading the one-star reviews has given me the first real feelings of emotion (anger, regret, joy, elation) since starting this book. DO NOT RECOMMEND.
title: A definite pass.

author: Brittany T
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2016
review_content: This book gutted me, devastated me. There were times I actually hated the author when reading this book because why would you make me fall in love with these characters and do this to them?!? This is an incredibly important book to read and please read the authors note at the end because it explains so much after you've read this book. I loved every single character in this book. You can't help but love them. Lily's strength and ability to love was breath taking. I wish every person in this world could read this book because it's truly that important. I don't want to give anything away but I promise you, you won't be sorry you read this book. You will laugh and cry and have a new perspective on the world. 'There aren't bad people, just people who do bad things.' Thank you CoHo for writing such an exceptional book. I'm a fan for life.
title: Be ready to cry

author: DawnInTX
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: This book y’all. It was like a hurricane of emotions! I was swept up in it right from the start. I went in blind, not knowing what the book was about. Just let me say that I experienced all the feels possible!It was real. Raw.It made me laugh. Cry. Gasp. Shutter.I fell in love and also had my heart hurt more than once.I had hope. Hope for what I wanted the outcome to be as a reader.It was just so much emotion for me. This story is definitely one that will make you think about life and the decisions we make and why. I feel like it will keep coming back to you long after you’ve read it.In my opinion the storyline is well written and I applaud Colleen Hoover for writing such inspiring and real characters. Their relationships were so well written that I could somehow relate/sympathize to what they were experiencing even though I haven’t experienced it myself.Lily is a very strong character.Ryle is just wow!Atlas is the epitome of a knight in shining armor.I seriously believe Hoover’s writing gets better with with each book.  .
title: Infinite stars for me!!!

author: LoveHateBookBlog- Sharee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2016
review_content: I had to take a little while to process this book. This won't be like my other reviews where I give you a summary and tell you what this book is about. I think if I tell you what this book is about then it will take away from the experience of the book. If you are a fan of Colleen Hoover then know for sure you will love this book. If you haven't ever read one of her books then know for sure that you will love this book.This was a brave book. Super brave. I didn't relate to it on a super personal level, but I have friends who would. Not being able to relate didn't take away from me experiencing all the feelings that this book brought. It was so realistic. So real it was scary. Go into this book blind. Trust me. You won't regret it.5 Stars
title: Brave is the word I would use to describe this book

author: Lorrel Palmer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2016
review_content: I've read and reviewed many Colleen Hoover books, but this one is different.  It's been a long time since I've been moved by a book quite like this. This is an absolutely fantastic novel, but it's more than that.  CoHo tackles some serious issues here--this is NOT a a fluffy love story or steamy romance. It has love and romance, but this book represents so much more than that on a deeper level. Several reviews I read said to go into this book "blind" and without knowing the details--which I did and totally agree with. So my review here is vague for that reason.Colleen Hoover has elevated herself to a new level as a writer. I always admired her writing for its intense passion and romance, but this goes above and beyond that. She tackles a serious issue with raw honesty and a brilliant ability to see a situation from multiple sides. I definitely suggest you read the author's note at the end--but read it AFTER you finish the book, as it contains spoilers.This book is a must read for everyone--if you read only one book this month, this year, this LIFETIME--read It Ends With Us.Check out this review on my blog at [...]
title: Absolutely Amazing Book!

author: booknerd0116
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: If you haven't already been won over by Colleen Hoover's generosity, her witty sense of humor, her sweet girl-next-door persona, or her multiple other New York Times best selling books, then It Ends With Us will do it.  Honestly!  Hoover hits every note precisely right with the depth of emotion displayed throughout this almost-lyrical novel.  She pulls her readers into the story in just the right way that allows them to feel as though they too are living the events of the story, which is something not many authors do well.  Hoover, however, does it masterfully.  She delves into  a very serious subject in this novel-- a subject very familiar to many-- and exposes it, not just the topic but also its affect on others.  Hoover pulled out everything from her arsenal with this book and it's so well written; I highly recommend it with the highest of praise.
title: her sweet girl-next-door persona

author: Hope
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover has given us another unforgettable story.  It Ends With Us is stunning, emotional, brave. This is not a typical love story.  I would call it a life story.  It follows Lily as she meets Ryle and they start a relationship.  She lives life, she makes good friends, she falls in love and she gets hurt.  Lily’s back-story is told via flashback letters she wrote to Ellen DeGeneres.  Yes, flashbacks but at least they are told in an original way.  And this is one of those novels that makes you think, it makes you see sides of a story, it gives true meaning to that thing called “the gray area”, and it makes you understand a little more.  I loved this book.  It has stuck with me for a week now.  And I hope it sticks even longer.  May I suggest not reading the book blurb?  I went in completely blind, unspoiled and I will never regret it – this coming from a somewhat spoiler whore!
title: A story that makes you think, understand and feel.

author: punchdrunklibrary
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: All the hype and the long anticipated wait for release date is BEYOND worth it! I was shock to find out a few of my book sisters have not read any of Colleen’s books, but let me be the first to say, if you haven’t and have them all waiting on your TBR, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE read this first. I am even toying with the idea of forcing the hubby to read it (he is not a reader by all means - HA). However, he did mention he wanted to give reading a try again and what better story than It Ends With Us. This book truly is for everyone.Personally, I think this is Colleen’s best work yet. I don’t want to go into the story any further. This book is best to go in blind. I even encourage you to not read the blurb if you haven’t already done so. Just trust me on this one. This story is truly something else. The first chapter hooked me, the second chapter starts chipping away at my heart and by the third chapter I found myself grinning and laughing like an idiot. Every page after that took my breath away through a range of emotions evoked within me. I even experienced a shock of a lifetime because never in my book world have I been blindsided the way I was with It Ends With Us. After reading the author’s note at the end, I realized that is exactly how the heroine felt herself. On that note, I have to say… I cried harder reading the author’s note than the book in its entirety. You will understand why when you get there.Everything in this book is just pinned down with the factor of WOW! Out of all the heroines I have ‘met’ along the way, I have to say Lily Bloom captured my heart from the first few pages and by the end of the book she is the most admirable woman and someone I truly look up to.Even at 3am after finishing this truly amazing story I could not fall asleep right away. This is the kind of story that NEEDS to be made into a movie to reach a broader audience since I know a lot of people choose not to read in general. The pictures in my head were crazy vivid as I absorbed each and every word. I cannot express how much this book has touched me in ways that I did not think possible.Truly you guys, everyone needs to read this. It quickly became one of my favorite reads of 2016. There is a really strong message in this book that I hope everyone can take from it no matter what position in the situation they find themselves in. I am still thinking about it all and find myself questioning everything. This story brings in a whole new perspective of everything I strongly believe I would or would not take action to in a specific way in a given situation, but in reality if it was my life would I still be as adamant and sure of what I always thought I knew or believed in? GAHHHH!!!Lastly, the title in itself IT ENDS WITH US… the moment it hit me of what the title truly means knocked the breath right out of me. By the end, the meaning of the title was confirmed let me tell you – it’s perfection!Most importantly – READ IT!!!! PLEASE READ IT!!!
title: READ IT!!!! PLEASE READ THIS BOOK!!!

author: Desirai
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: I heard about It Ends With Us shortly after following Colleen Hoover on Facebook back in June. I kept reading reviews from those with early copies. They were all calling it Colleen’s best work, her most personal story. Review after review, I pined for the book more and more. August could not come fast enough. Luckily for me I was able to score an ARC. However I still picked up the paperback. Have you seen the cover? It’s beautiful.It Ends With Us is a heavy and personal story about Lily Bloom that includes real life events and inspiration from the author’s life. If you are used to crying and having your heart broken while reading one of Colleen’s books, this is no different. It’s a powerful story that shows an uncommon perspective on a situation people often judge harshly. I’m being vague, I know. I’m trying really hard to say very little. I believe in order to get the full effect it’s best to go in blind. Check your expectations and biases at the door. Just listen (read) and take in the complicated and heart wrenching story that is It Ends With us.This book was a page turner for me, one I’m unlikely to forget anytime soon. The naked truth is that parents are having Colleen sign copies of this book to give to their children when they grow up. It’s that important. I somehow managed to keep it together while reading the book, but completely fell apart after reading the Author note. Don’t make the same mistake I did, be sure to have tissues handy.All that being said, I do believe this book deserves a trigger warning. If you are triggered by violence, and physical abuse you may not want to read this book.
title: They were all calling it Colleen’s best work, her most personal story

author: Savannah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2017
review_content: This has a few minor spoilers***This is such a lovely book, heartbreaking, scary at times and even worrisome.  It stars a young woman named Lily Bloom, she's spunky and fun and determined to open a flower shop. She meets Ryle, who is a neurosurgeon.  They fall in love and things progress quickly, too quickly. Things continue until we find Lily with a bruised face and a scared and lonely heart.  She watched her mother go through this with her father and she doesn't want the cycle to continue. She questions herself and the decisions she's made, we walk the road of doubt and pain and confusion with Lily.This beautiful book is unapologetically needed because abuse still happens in this country, every day, every minute.  Colleen Hoover never strays from writing about "real" life, she doesn't doctor it or mince words to make you feel better. She brought to light such a poignant matter in "It Ends With Us" and you never really know what's happening to those behind closed doors. Through the Lily's eyes we see struggle, loss, pain, forgiveness, truth, light and new love. Can Lily do this? Can she survive and break this vicious cycle? Yes, she can, with the help of friends. Give this to every woman you know!
title: Beautifully done Colleen Hoover! "It Ends With Us" is poignant and lovely.

author: Debbie Mastalski
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: I'll start by saying this book downloaded to my Kindle around 11:30 last night & I stayed up half the night reading it.  Could not put it down!I've read several CoHo books.  Always a love story but with many more elements.  This one went above and beyond though.  So many emotions!This is one of those books you can't "review" too much or it will give away the story.  However, we meet Lily Bloom on the roof of a building in Boston the night after her father's funeral.  You're going to fall in love with Lily, be warned.  She comes from a "good family" but her life hasn't been what most people think.  She has a good job, but it's not her passion and we will learn what that is soon enough.  We also meet Ryle (like Kyle with an R) Kincaid, a neurosurgeon, who also has some secrets to share.I won't give away more, but this one really gets you in the gut and makes you think ... you don't always know what is up with others.Worth staying up half the night for!
title: Always a love story but with many more elements

author: Shannon Smiles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: Naked Truth: This book made me a better person.I am going to gift it to all of my friends and family who will sit still long enough to read it.I'm not an author, so I will leave the pure amazing writing to Colleen, but I feel the serious need to let you know that YOU should read this book. I refuse to say much about it because I went in blind and I am so thankful that I did.  (If you are here reading reviews before you read the book...STOP before you read a spoiler. Just give it a try....I think you will get sucked in just like us.)What can I say?It was extremely well written. Almost too well written... I loved people I didn't want to love, and kept feeling the black and white lines of life get more and more blurry.  Mostly I found myself doing what I always say we should do more of....less judging more loving. I made decisions in my head about the rest of my life, I changed a voice in my head about my past and the past of those I love....BECAUSE of the words on the pages in this book. It's not hyperbole. It is a real cause and effect....because of a book. I Love this book and am super thankful that Colleen Hoover exists. Huge thanks to her for pouring herself onto the pages.I hope everyone reads this book.
title: Read It. You may hate me, but then you will thank me.

author: goodem
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2016
review_content: Everytime CoHo releases a book, I just buy it. I don't read a synopsis, listen daily for teasers, or listen to word of mouth. Nothing she writes could ever not be worth the money I pay. To say I went into It Ends With Us with extremely blinded eyes would be an understatement. This isn't your typical CoHo special. It isn't laced with humor, love and more humor. Its a raw undiluted truth about love. The Good, The Bad and the choices you make for those you love.This book brought out so many emotions as I read its pages. Sorrow, Pride, Love, Fear, Hope, were just a few of the emotions that fluttered across my heart. At times this book hurt to read, but it's message was so worth the raw emotions that are now embedded into my heart.Ryle, Lily and Atlas have wrung me out.There were so many times I wanted to flip to the back of this story to save my heart. I wanted her to fall for Ryle. I needed her to love Atlas. But not once could I bring myself to ruin the journey. I completely identified with this story in so many ways that it hurts. Lily's journey brought back so many memories for me. Some good, some bad but all completely identifiable and relateable to hers. Lily's  strength made me hopeful.  Her emotional indecisiveness made me feel human. But most of all her strength made me proud.There are so many things I could say about this book, but it'd never do it justice. The story is holds higher than any review could ever begin to describe it.
title: Its a raw undiluted truth about love

author: Susan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020
review_content: Well written book but I didn’t care for the lead character—too much of a smart-alec weirdo. (Partly conveyed by narrator perhaps.)  She saw the characteristics in the male at her first meeting. If she was so hyper aware of this type of man she would NOT have been attracted and hooked up with him. Common sense, people! I had trouble listening and finally skipped to the end only to hear the “lesson.”  Money back please.
title: Amazon prime: don’t let me buy books with lessons to be learned

author: BeeGee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2017
review_content: This book broke my heart. I can undoubtedly say that this is the best book I've read in a very very looong time!  I Suffered through so many emotions and in the end I was a total wreck. Bring out the Kleenex; you'll need it every step of the way, because the story is gritty and dark in some parts. I'm glad I went in blindly and didn't read any of the reviews, because I was amazed. I certainly was not prepared for the turn this story took but it opened my eyes and made me see things from a different point of view. My first read from this author and I was extremely impressed.Thank you Colleen Hoover for writing and sharing this amazing story.
title: Remarkable story

author: GinaRF
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: I have no idea why I am writing a review when I cannot find the right words to express how this book touched me. It was beautifully written, captivating, emotional and impossible to put down. That being said, it's Colleen Hoover so I didn't expect anything less. What I want to say, without giving anything away, is every woman should read this book. Every man should read this book. There are lessons in this book everyone will benefit from learning. I wish my 14 year old daughter could read this book, but as there are some steamy parts, I can't let her do that. It is, however, on a TBR list I have for her for when she is older. After reading "It Ends With Us" I feel enlightened. I am truly grateful for that. I feel like a better person for having read it because of the new perspective it gave me, from both Part 1 and Part 2. I fell in love with Atlas and rooted for him all the way. I loved Lily and was very proud of her. I also was able to empathize with Ryle to a degree. Colleen, you did it again but this time you did it tenfold. Thank you.
title: This book will make you a better person.

author: Katie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: What is a five star review for me? A five star review is book that engages me the entire time. A book that I never check to see where my percentage and then kind of shrug because I'm not as far as I thought I was. A five star book is the one where you check the percentage and think "Oh no, it's going to by too fast". A five star is the book you stop reading as soon as you feel your eyes get heavy becaus you don't want to risk dosing off for a second and missing anything. That is IEWU and it's a five star for me.I freely admit  I'm biased when it comes to Colleen hoover because she is hands down my favorite, what I love about her books is that you FEEL throughout her books, and this one is no different. There were times sitting in a doctors office lobby that I was he crazy lady giggling to my phone. There are also heartbreaking moments where you set the book down, take a deep breath and wait for the rush of emotions to somewhat lessen so you can continue on. What is different about this book is that, after you finish it, you will sit and insert yourself in this story as Lily. You will wonder how you would've felt and what you would've done.P.S. Read the author's note AFTER you finish it.
title: A five star read ??????????

author: Becky Cox
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: I didn't read any teasers or hype about this book. I wanted to go in blind, forming my own opinions.Honestly, the author notes at the end touched me as much or more than the story itself.Lily is an amazing heroine that I grew to love more as the story progressed and the last few chapters I beamed at her!! I cheered for her, pleaded with her and hurt for her.Ryle is gorgeous and ambitious and had such a sweet side to him. I loved him at times and hated him at times and then I think I kind of love/hated him all the time.Atlas. Well first off what an awesome name! Loved Atlas from the start and just grew to love him more. What a resilient amazing man.Colleen made me look inside a reality that I didn't really want to look at but so glad I did. It Ends With Us, is such a personal story and a learning experience. It showed me a side of life I am personally unfamiliar with but understand so much better through her words.Is this my favorite Colleen book, no probably not. But it is an amazing story that needed to be told and Colleen has expertly done that. Hats off lady, another great book.Reveiwed by Becky for Jo&IsaLoveBooks
title: We're all just people, who sometimes do bad things.

author: T. Johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: 5 million stars! I feel like I ran an emotional marathon...without training. This book made me experience extreme emotional highs, where I am so in love and just wrapped in this warm fuzzy hug and I'm soaring and never want to come down. And then we crash and I'm so low and hurt and confused and betrayed and sad and devastated. EMOTIONAL WRINGER! And it hurts so so good.This is a great read and deals with a topic that's important and relevant and it needs to end. Knowing your limits and realizing your self worth and a message that all young women (and young men too because abuse can go both ways) need to hear...we need to pound this into our brains; you are worthy of love, you deserve happiness,you deserve to be treated well. An all around great cast of characters round out the story and I liked them all, even when I didn't. CoHo is like a fine wine, she just keeps getting better. Definitely one of my favorites by her.
title: Her best yet!

author: Ashley D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016
review_content: I am really glad the description of this book doesn't give much away because it's really best to go into this story blind. Colleen Hoover is one of the authors who never disappoints, and personally she is my favorite author and the reason that I set the bar so high for books.All of the characters in this book are so relatable and real, you can see parts of them in yourself and others. This book is going to make you smile, laugh, cry, angry, hurt...basically it's going to make you feel. Personally, the best books for me are the ones that I can literally feel in my heart and this one did just that. Colleen is the best at building a reader up and making you feel so happy, then she completely decimates your heart before she puts it back together again...it's amazing.That being said there are heavy issues in the book and I thankfully have never had to deal with them in my own life. It made me think of how I was taught about self worth and how you treat others and how you are treated. I can remember a time when my cousin was being a jerk to his girlfriend and I looked at him and said, 'You do not talk to people that way, and if you want something do it yourself.'  I heard my dad proudly say to himself, 'That's my daughter.'The best books are the ones who make you think and question what you think or know.  They give you perspectives and insight. They challenge you to make tough choices. They stay with you long after you have read them and make you feel, it's a cliche for a reason, all the feels. This book does all that and so much more. I highly recommend it!
title: Colleen Hoover...I Want to be You When I Grow Up

author: StarLight
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: I am a huge fan of Colleen Hoover and have read her previous books many times (can one really get bored of Slammed?). I start with that statement because this book was my favorite by far and will stick with me forever.  I have never experienced (first hand or otherwise) the main issue that lily and Ryle face, and yet I have never felt more connected to a "fictional" story.  I was truly moved by the characters and the story.As a side note, to further prove my five star rating (which is not enough stars) my copy of the newest Harry Potter book was delivered today, so I had to chose which to read first. I find it important to note that I am a huge Harry Potter fan (I literally have at least 4 copies of each book) and have loved them to pieces.  Like seriously falling apart pieces. I chose to read this over Harry Potter. If that's not a compliment, and testament, to how amazing this book is, I'm not sure what is.
title: Best yet!

author: Jamie LaFave
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016
review_content: I do not even know where to begin..... Colleen Hoover just keeps getting better! I have never had an author make me feel the emotions of each character in the book like I do with CH. She is amazing!!! This book was out of this world amazing!!!!! I went in knowing nothing about the plot, other than the description on the back. I heard all the rave about it and saw all the reviews but refused to read unless it was spoiler free!!! I do not always like going into a book "blind" but I think for this book you needed it!!!! All of her books have epic plot twists.. but this one just has you torn and pulled in so many different directions. I literally devoured this booK!! But also had to stop and regroup a few times ! I cant even come up with the right words to review it!!! Literally just phenomenal , amazing, pure gold on paper (or kindle)!!!! If you have not read... do.it.now!!!!
title: Devoured this book!!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: If you were to read any book this year, let it be It Ends With Us!I wish I was articulate enough to write a review that would do this book justice. I'm just not that girl, but I am a girl who can read and tell you that I LOVED this book so much and was not disappointed, well maybe a little because Colleen Hoover creates these amazing characters that make you feel like you're a part of their inner circle and their journeys.I found my new heroes, their name is Lily Bloom and Jenny Bloom. It makes my heart happy read a book with strong female leads. Not victims, but survivors.I don't know how it's possible, but I both loved and rooted for both Atlas and Ryle. I found myself wanting her to choose both, to choose herself. I felt every emotion and was slayed! Like a perfect emo-storm of ugly, happy, angry cry.Dear Colleen Hoover,Why are your books like Poison and for Wine? How do you have the knack of slaying my soul and healing it with your words?I am so thankful that you were able to write this book about a topic that is deeply troubling and seldom talked about, until most times it is too late, and how unfortunate that it was new and dear to your heart- but how fortunate that you were able to be both Brave and Bold and paint domestic abuse in a different light?Also, you are one of my most favorite human beings ever! Humble and kind with a loving and charitable heart. I suspect you give Ellen DeGeneres a run for her money!Thank you.  - Sharron
title: Poison and Wine

author: gaga6789
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
review_content: It’s hard to review without giving away the plot, but this is one of the best books I’ve ever had the pleasure of reading. The subject matter is handled in a way you’ve never read before. It’s a totally different prospective of an age old subject matter. I laughed. I cried. I tried to hold off on getting to the end because I didn’t want to let it go. I loved it so much I’m hoping for a sequel.Buy this book. It is so very good.
title: But this book

author: Amanda W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: 5++ Stars!What an emotional read!  I rode the rollercoaster of emotions on this one - from absolute happiness, devastation, sadness, understanding, and utter heartbreak.  I think this is her best work yet!  I love all of Colleen Hoovers books, but this was the first time that I felt completely in sync with the heroine.  Lily is such a real, relatable character and as a reader you feel every raw emotion and thought that she had as if it were your own.  I've never been in the situations that she's been in but I've had the judgmental thoughts and this book turned me upside down.I won't spoil it for the reader because some books are just meant to be read without knowing what's going to happen.  Go buy or borrow the book and read it.  You won't be disappointed!ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND!!
title: Heartbreakingly Beautiful and Raw - A Must Read!

author: Marsha Jo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2016
review_content: As with pretty much any Colleen Hoover book, this one has a serious and emotional/heartbreaking subject matter. There aren't many laughs in it, so if you are looking for a lighthearted read, you are in the wrong place. The writing is beautiful and the format is unique and fun. (Using diary entries from the younger years instead of flipping back and forth between past and present.) You probably don't want to be reading this in public, though you can most likely get away with it during the first half of the book. Or at least make sure you are wearing sunglasses to hide the tears. I will admit, I had high expectations of this book, and thought it was going to be her best book yet, and although it may be her favorite and hardest to write, it didn't live up to the hype as much as I anticipated. Still a great book, but not my favorite of hers. So if you are unfamiliar with Colleen's work, I might suggest starting with Maybe Someday, Hopeless or even Ugly Love. Ms Hoover has a way with words and I am a forever fan. :)
title: As with pretty much any Colleen Hoover book

author: Bre Land
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: I didn't want to put this book down, but when my husband woke up in the middle of the night to me crying, I felt bad for waking him and had to put it down.Let me start by saying I don't like to do reviews because I stink at them ha! So I will try not to give anything away but share my thoughts too.When a book evokes personal feelings and emotions, it is hard to read.This book was an emotional roller coaster, or at least it was for me.
