Grab your Kleenex and settle in.  I don't really ugly cry in books but I did with this one, and that's ok.I loved Lily and everything about her! Her choice to be bold and brave, many times. I really liked the strength and courage she has throughout the book. Even in moments of weakness, she is there facing things head on.Ryle!  He gets under your skin and you can't help but love him even when you don't want to. You can't help but have hope and faith.  It's natural instinct to want happily ever after. Even when deep down that isn't always possible.There is no such thing as bad people. We're all just people who sometimes do bad things. And bad things happen in this book.Just know that 'it stops here, with me and you, it ends with us.' As much as I love that line in the book it also breaks me.
title: Where to start?

author: JM4
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2016
review_content: Wow, just wow. This is a book that will always be at the very front of my bookshelf. I never want to lose it. As I was almost to the end my daughter asked what I was reading. I told her it was the best book I have ever read, that I wanted her to read it one day, and that it would teach her about how relationships should be. That was my "naked truth" to her. It was as much as I could tell her with my heart pounding, my brain in an upheaval, and her only being 9!  There is no way to explain what this book means to me and how it has and will continue to effect me for the rest of my life. I'm quite positive that I will read this book many many times over my life time. So many aspects were so close to my childhood and my relationship with my father. This book needs to reach young women everywhere!!  Thank you Colleen Hoover for exposing your truths, I flipping love you!!
title: Best book I have ever read....I'm never letting it go!

author: bookbabe1970
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2016
review_content: I came across this author and book by accident and boy am I ever glad that I did. I don't want to spoil anything by saying too much here but I love that the author made the characters both like able, real and flawed. I am glad that she didn't use the happy ever after ending that so many authors go for trying to tie everything up in a pretty little package by the books end to please a general audience. This book is one that will stick with you for a long time and make you think hard about your feelings about relationships, human experiences and real life outcomes. Life is messy and we all just hope to be good people at the end of the day, I thank the author for writing a novel that lives by that idea. I am now downloading all of her novels and following her on Amazon and I never do that. Great read by a great author. Thank you Colleen!!!
title: One of best books that I have ever read!!!

author: Theresa Alan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2017
review_content: This is definitely one of the better contemporary romances I’ve read in recent memory. What makes it good is that Hoover deals with some challenging topics, and I found myself wondering which love interest I was supposed to be rooting for. It was more complicated than other romances I’ve read, which I like. A lot.The main character Lily is young but already working hard to achieve her career goals. She’s haunted by challenges she’s faced in her childhood as well as by memories of her first love. She never seems desperate to fall in love, but then again, she’s twenty-three when the novel begins. In any case, I highly recommend this for people who like books with romantic elements.
title: Well done romance. Deals with challenging topics well

author: Liv Carroll
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: Wow.I really don't know where to start....I don't know how to write a review about what I read because all I can think about is what I feel.I feel so much.It's overwhelming.I know ALL of us Bookworms catch a case of the feels when we read a good book. But I don't have  the feels, yall.This is so much different. I feel like the story I just read, the characters I just spent 5 hours living and breathing with, like they crawled inside of me and stretched out my soul a little bit.Does that make any sense?I promise I'm usually better at words than this.Lily is my favorite female character ever. Point blank. Not up for discussion.She is by far the most realistic, true to nature, relatable girl I've ever been gifted with getting to know. I will miss her the most as I trudge through this book hangover. Atlas stole my heart from the beginning. Initially I was always waiting for her to stop talking about Ryle because frankly I didn't give a darn because I was already biased and I was waiting for my HEA...but somewhere along the way I stopped wanting to hear about Atlas because dang it if I didn't fall in love with Ryle. In deep, devastating, destructive love with Ryle.How the heck did Colleen pull that off?The last 10% of the book though...that's what stretched me out.Colleen put a message out there into the world. A message everyone needs to hear.She created a dialogue between the pages of a book and the beats of my broken heart that I will not soon forget.Bravo Colleen Hoover.This is your best work. I am so proud of you.
title: Colleen Hoover at her very best.

author: Ayelén from Lectura Colectiva Blog
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2016
review_content: This review is really hard to write because I don't really want to say anything that will give you the smallest hint of what this book is about. I was told to go in blind and it was the best advice I ever took.Hoover you nailed it again and best than ever, this is your most beautiful, heartbreaking, powerful and healing book. No one besides you could have told this story with the beauty and care that you did.This isn't a romance novel, this is a book about life. About many people's lives and it embraces them in a way that is as angsty as empathizing. This book is an eye opener. I'm not sure if Colleen has realized how much impact it will have, how many souls it will touch and change. This is one of those books that will completely impact on you. You will devour it and feel every single thing that the characters feel and then you will be thinking of it for days and days and days. It never stops, in the best way. IEWU is now a part of me and I will recommend it to as many people as I can.Colleen has a way of narrating that makes everything flow, so beyond being a powerful read it is also a piece of art. It's delicate and delightful. It's poetry.With any other book I would probably also talk about the plot and the characters but I won't do that here. The only thing I'll say will be about Lily and Alyssa, girls, I want to be you when I grow up, that's it.And now I want to thanks CoHo for being brave and bold and such a great writer and human being. Thank you for writing this book. Every human being needs to read this.
title: There's not enough stars to rate this powerful read

author: Wolfes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
review_content: I can not express how many feels like book gave me. This was the first one I read by the author. I think this is a must read!! Especially if you have any sort of trauma abuse from a child to parent relationship. I think it will help give you a different view, make you think, maybe even forgive. It ends with us was a beautiful story about a sensitive subject.I will agree with the other reviews that said I wanted more aspen! Gosh I did how do you not fall in love with his character. However for the story I see why the author choose the way she did to write his part!Still I must read and I may have found a new favorite author
title: A must read

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2016
review_content: This is an semi autobiographical book that is a tear jerker.  Colleen is one of my all time favorite writers.  This time the subject deals with domestic abuse.  The title says it all would you want your daughter to suffer like you have in an abusive relationship?  If not then you have to leave because it ends with us.  Lily meets an aspiring doctor Ryle who is damaged from childhood.  He turns abusive.  Waiting in the background is Atlas a homeless boy Lily helped in her hometown.  He was her first love and was forced out of her life.  Enter an unplanned pregnancy with Ryle which complicates and completes the story.  I love the message and am a sucker for the impact of that first love which colors Lily's life.  This is a heart melting, tear jerking story that leaves a strong message in its wake.
title: Would you allow your daughter to suffer the same abuse you did?  If not then the cycle of abuse must end with us.

author: Bearpa4
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover can "write" no wrong. This book gutted me. How can one author inject that much emotion in one book? A naked truth: I feel like I lived this woman's anguish, fear, love, and heartache, and finally hope. But I also felt I lived the protagonist's corresponding emotions. I so wanted another outcome, but I also understand WHY the main character could not overcome the issues that brought her to the point of making the decision she made. I still kind of wish for a different outcome, but I guess that's the hope in all of us for a HEA.  And, hey, maybe there will be. (I fell in love with the OTHER dude, too!) It would be interesting to get Ryle's unique perspective, including his journey to (hopefully) healing, understanding, acceptance, and (hopefully) eventual happiness, in a follow-up novel.  This was an excellent book. Great book title, too.
title: Wow

author: Annaleigh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2016
review_content: A must read!  I don't want to give any spoilers so I'll just say that if you are reading reviews wondering if you should buy this book, know that I would have paid $100 for it. I went in blind knowing only that Colleen Hoover knows how to write and she has never disappointed  me in any of her previous books.  I had heard that it could cause an ugly cry and i thought "I never cry when people say that" but let me tell you, I had tears streaming down my face at the end. My husband said "What is wrong?" and I said "It was just so good, not sad tears, not happy tears, just a bit overwhelmed by what I felt for all the characters" He laughed and said "um, ok" :) This was a very character driven book and  you love everyone in it, even when you are hating them a little at the same time. It was so well written that I don't know if many other authors could have done this story the justice Colleen Hoover did. She is an amazing author and I think this just may be her best yet. Buy it today, you will be happy you did and it will become a part of you.
title: Must Read!

author: FLR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
review_content: Wow, I powered through this book to try to get it over with, only to discover that my copy was missing 40 pages at the end. Thought it was odd that this book ended in the middle of a sentence, but I did some research and sounds like there were entire chapters missing from my book. So dumb.
title: Wow.

author: lyssa reyome
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2016
review_content: I started this book knowing nothing about it except that it was written by Colleen and that I've never been disappointed by any of her work. Now finished with it, I have still yet to be disappointed.  This is a book that is now one of my all time favorites, a re-read for sure. I see so much of myself in Lily. She was just much stronger than me. Although I'm no longer in that situation, it took me a lot longer to come to that decision than it did it Lily. I'm so proud of Lily, and I'm so proud of all the other women who have found the strength and courage to leave a situation like that. To better their own lives,  to protect their children, to give their children better lives, and to understand that your life is worth so much more than that, that you deserve so much better. People really don't understand how hard it is to leave a situation like that, and I love that this portrays the real struggle, the real pain.Colleen, I've read over and over how hard this book was for you to finish. But I'm so glad you did. I truly believe that this book, that you, will help so many women find the strength and courage to end the cycle, to realize that they need to get their limit back in sight, to become Brave and Bold.
title: Brave and Bold

author: Carole P. Roman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2017
review_content: "Cycles exist because they are excruciating to break."  Heart-wrenching story of domestic abuse, the victims and the cycle it creates. Lily Bloom is the daughter of a successful businessman with a secret. Her father was an abusive husband. Lily is conflicted, she recognizes that she loved her father but hated him for beating her mother. The night of her father's funeral, she meets  the perfect man. Handsome, rich, educated and despite the fact he doesn't want to marry- they end up falling in love and are wed. The bliss of marriage is short-lived, and Lily must decide how much she loves Ryle. She must wrestle with some harsh truths and make hard decisions. A good read.
title: she recognizes that she loved her father but hated him for beating her mother

author: prashanta
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
review_content: I loved every bit of this! I laughed, I cried, I got angry, I got sad and I loved every bit of it. I loved Ryle and I hated him and then I kinda liked him again just a bit. And Lily...wow...I rooted for and I was disappointed and then I loved her. And Atlas? I wished there was more of him but I understand why there wasn’t. This was a roller coaster and I’m a sucker for roller coasters.
title: There are no words...

author: Amber's Final Thoughts
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2016
review_content: I can’t put into words what this book has done to me.  I am so glad that I stayed away from spoilers and I urge you to do the same.The characters in this book are so real and they come to life right off of the page.  Every emotion they feel you will also feel in your heart. From the moment you open the book to page one to well after the last page this book will not let you go.When I opened this book it mimicked my own life growing up in so many ways, but I am thankful to Colleen Hoover for forcing me to see things in a different light.By the end of this book, you will have a new book boyfriend, I just pray that we get a novella based on him.I have read all 12 of Colleen Hoover’s books and I still do not know which one I love the most, but this is at the top of my life.Pick this book up it is beyond a six-star​ book.
title: Beyond a Six Star Book!!!! Coleen Hoover does it again!

author: Julia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020
review_content: This is the first time I have EVER written a review for a book, but I simply had to get my thoughts down. I just finished this book and I don't even know how to express what I'm feeling. The emotions I am feeling are so overwhelming. I bought this book AND finished it in less than 10 hours. This story was beautiful, heart-wrenching, raw, aggravating, but most of all real. Reading this book I felt like I was Lily, experiencing all of her emotions, the good and the bad, that is how into this book I was. Lily is strong and powerful and I loved that about her, but this was not some happy ending love story (the ending was beautiful though), it was a real story about love. I don't want to spoil anything, so I do not want to say too much, but as all the other 5-star reviews have said, READ. THIS. BOOK.This is my 3rd Collen Hoover book I have read and after this book, I will not stop reading her books.
title: I will NEVER forget this book

author: serenakbelieves
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2016
review_content: Lily Bloom.Ryle Kincaid.Atlas Corrigan.How the hell do I describe my feelings for this book?Number one, I tried to figure out the twist, me being an author myself. I tried to see the hidden things and I got some of them, but the twist halfway through the story… holy s***.I don’t even know how I could love the two guys the same time in similar and different ways. I didn’t think we’d see Atlas again, or maybe just a cameo, but boy was I wrong.Lily is a strong woman, raised with an abusive father. But not only do we see her strength, we see her weaknesses too.This is a story of abuse. A story of friendship. A story of kindness.A story of love that comes in different forms.Hoover tells her personal touch to this story and it’s heartbreaking and emotional. Makes me admire her that much more.This is one I definitely could not put down!!This gets 5 PIGGIES!
title: Turns, twists, and FEELS!

author: Crystal Phillipson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: I love this author and was surprised to find there was no description of the book's contents on the kindle version, but as I mentioned I love the author, so I just purchased the book and hoped for the best.It wasn't until I was half way through the book that I discovered this is not your typical book from this author and contains a subject that you don't typically find in a romance nove.  But, by that time I was hooked and had fallen in love with the characters.  I laughed, I cried and I just felt for the main characters.When it was done I felt like not only had a gone through an emotional roller-coaster ride, but I had found a profound new insight on a subject I hadn't really thought I needed to know more about.  Notice, I don't state the subject as it was really good I didn't know it going in, because I don't think I would have read the book and that would have been a mistake.You will love this book (when you are done) and you will want to ensure you read the Note from the author at the end.  It not only gives you insight on the reason the author wrote on this specific subject, but helps to give better understanding of the characters from the book.
title: Not your typical read from this author, but so worth it.

author: Hknirk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016
review_content: I'm a huge Colleen Hoover fan, this isn't a big secret. I keep waiting for a book to disappoint, especially as more books come out im waiting for the moment the hype doesn't match up. It doesn't happen. I've read a LOT of books and Hopeless has always been my favorite...until now. I used to unintentionally measure how great a book was by how quickly I could finish it. Then I started this book. There were so many times I had to turn my phone off and take a "chapter break." It was entirely too much to handle. It hit me personally as if I knew these characters. I wanted to reach through and hug Lily when she needed it. I wanted to reach through and slap both men and her too! What a ride. CoHo is going to have a hard time ever topping this one.
title: Blown away

author: blubbph
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2017
review_content: This is the third Colleen Hoover novel I've read, and going in I already expected myself to turn into water works since her other two novels (Hopeless and Ugly Love) made me cry. I turned into a liquid mess of tears reading this book as expected, but what I did not expect was how much this novel would touch my being. This is more than your average romance novel. It leaves an impact that reverberates your soul. While I love Hopeless and Ugly Love, Colleen Hoover has outdone herself with It Ends with Us. Her writing immerses readers to experience the moments lived by the characters seamlessly and takes readers on a journey along with the characters as they grow. Most importantly, it imparts a lesson that I personally agree and champion: don't be quick to judge other people's pains and decisions because you don't live their lives and can't possibly know their pain threshold. I'm incredibly proud that Colleen Hoover wove this message so skillfully in this beautifully rendered story.To Colleen Hoover: When I grow up, I want to be you.
title: While I love Hopeless and Ugly Love

author: Shelly Bowe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2017
review_content: Wow,what a poignant story!! This is my first book by this author, and I am hooked and cannot wait to explore her other work. This book was so what life is about, the joy, pain, anger, disappointments, sacrifices,  love, and then more joy, pain, anger,, disappointments, sacrifices, and love the greatest of them all. I laughed, cried, bit my nails, screamed, meditated,  but could not put this book down. I  could not figure out what would happen next. I encourage you please, please, read this book you will not be disappointed. In the end I truly understood,  respected and loved the outcome of such a poignant dilemma........sorry no spoilers here, read,read, read you will be enlightened.
title: What an emotional rollercoaster!

author: Booklover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2020
review_content: Another great book by Colleen Hoover, she is fast becoming one of my favorite writers.  She has such a flair for writing books that contain emotional situations that include Love, Heartbreak, Betrayal, Depression, etc.  She gets to the heart of things and  takes you on a fabulous ride.  I strongly recommend any of her novels for unbeatable entertainment.
title: Sometimes  The Heart Is Smarter Than We Are

author: Julie jewelz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: Without giving away too much about the book, I work in family law court and find myself wondering every day why people do the things they do and, my God, did you open my eyes! I completely fell in love with Ryle. I was completely floored the way this story was free falling and landing. This book was mind blowing to me and really did offer me a completely different perspective on how --and I know I shouldn't be one to judge because I'm not in their shoes but I'm still human, so yes, I silently judge-- love could engulf you and either take you down completely or lift you as high as your heart will allow. You made me open my eyes and now I see love at its finest and purest, and I also see it at its most vulnerable and destructible it could be. Thank you! Thank you for writing this because I was right there in the book with you. I now feel like my blindfold has been lifted and no longer will I pretend to understand what someone is going through and cast doubt or blame on them. Best. Writer. Ever.
title: Wow

author: rosalie13
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: Holy hell, this book. A friend introduced me to Colleen Hoover a little over a year ago, and I devoured everything she had written in a month or two. To say that I anticipated this book would be an understatement. But I was woefully unprepared.How beautiful, how exquisite. Colleen takes the reader to an ugly place in this book, but threads hope throughout. I cried, I laughed out loud, and most importantly, I felt the fire of hope in my belly being stoked as I read. I have lead a similar life to the main character in the book, yet I often wonder if Love will ever set me right again, or if it will just pass me by. This book is resoundingly impressive, and is a must-read for both males and females that have ever been in a situation with their significant others where they wonder "Did I just go too far? Did I cross that line? Did I just ruin everything?" I will feel the echoes of this story for a long time, yet.I am desperately hoping that there is a sequel to this book, because I am craving more hope. More light and love. This book has it, but I need to see the healing process walked out, even if it is a work of fiction. Because for those of us that swim between the lines of the authors we read, that take to heart the stories we invite into our spirits, healing penned at the hand of the writers we share our lives with can be Grace in her purest form.
title: How beautiful, how exquisite

author: Julie Lavalle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016
review_content: I don't know what to say at this moment other then I am completely and utterly drained and feel a bit lost from this book. It brought back many childhood memories of growing up in an abusive household. I am so torn with the turns that this took. There were so many times reading this book I was chanting silently in my head  "damn I hate Colleen Hoover - why am I reading this book?" I know why - I know what I am going to get reading a book by Colleen - it's going to be a rollercoaster ride of emotions like no other and that is why I continue to come back. You want a book that will touch you in every way possible this will definitely do that. We are not bad people we are people who do bad things. We all have a little bit of both in everyone of us and this book truly told that story!!!
title: You are going to need an entire box of tissues!!

author: Amber
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2021
review_content: Wow. I read this book in a day— I just simply could not put it down. It was an emotional rollercoaster. It made me laugh, it made me want to cry, it made me angry, and it made me rethink previous beliefs of mine and try to see things from a new perspective about serious and not too uncommon issues. I felt love for all of these characters. If you are debating reading this, I encourage you to do so. This was such a well written, riveting tale, and it will stay with me.
title: An absolute gem

author: J. Thigpen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2019
review_content: This book evokes so many powerful emotions. I could feel the pain,anguish, and love of these characters. While I hoped some of these things never happen to anyone, I can only imagine how frequently it occurs in reality. The author captured what I can only imagine the true emotions in the situations told in this story. It was a well written and developed story that I couldn’t put down. However once it was over, I found myself missing the characters and their development. This was more than 5 stars worthy.
title: Words can’t describe how good this book is

author: Pchamp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2016
review_content: I read this book super fast. Which is to say that I thought it was incredibly good; however this isn't necessarily what I would say. This book was OK. I found much of the story line to be incredibly cheesy, out of place, and not at all possible in the "real world" I had to remind myself numerous times that this is a work of fiction; so it's ok if these things would never play out like this in real life. Regardless the story line (especially in part one) was hard to relate to. Part two the book got tremendously better- however I was seriously disappointed at how rushed part two was. I needed more detail, more story, more Atlas, more everything- and then it was done. I finished the book feeling unsatisfied, frustrated etc., two days after finishing it I'm still imagining how much better that book should have been.
title: OK- not great

author: Kindle Cousins
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2016
review_content: CoHo is back with a bang. I’m not a die hard CoHo fan. I don’t love everything she writes, but I loved this. Yes, it had some cheesy moments but the plot shined through. This story reiterated life long lessons through authentic characters. I really enjoyed the writing and the effortless flow of the story. I loved it, but of course I have to complain. I NEED MORE ATLAS!!!!!!!!! Just a novella or extended epilogue. PLEASE?!!!!!!!!!!!!!!4 starsNatashaOk, Colleen has been a bit cheesy for my tastes lately, so I really didn’t know what to expect with this one. I was pleasantly surprised that this was deeper and surpassed my expectations. This has been the year of strong heroines and Lily definitely fits the bill. I really enjoyed this book, but need more ATLAS!!! I want to know what happens next!4 starsJasmine
title: CoHo is back

author: Amy Everetts
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2016
review_content: If I could give this book more than 5 stars, I would. This book may possibly be my favorite CoHo book and it's definitely one of the best books I've ever read. This book talked about some serious issues that a lot of people face. I appreciate that it was talked about in a real, true fashion. It wasn't glamorized, or hyped up for ratings.I could really feel for Lily and for Ryle. I felt I was right there, trying to make these difficult decisions. It gave me a completely different view and opened my eyes to the behind the door struggles people face. Things aren't always black and white. What may be a clear choice from the outside, tends to have a touch of gray when faced with difficult decisions.Thank you Colleen for writing this very important book. You took a very difficult, and personal subject and brought to life the real struggles people face every single day!
title: A Deeply Personal and Moving Story

author: Britney Wolfe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: One of the benefits of participating with the bookstagram hashtag on Instagram is learning about new books. A few weeks ago, I saw a post that was talking about this upcoming release, and though I can't remember whose account it was, I do remember what she said about It Ends With Us.This story is important.And after devouring and absorbing the story this morning, I full-heartedly agree. It's a story about love. It's a story about relationships. And most importantly it's a story about women who suffer from domestic abuse.The book begins with Lily meeting Ryle, a successful neurosurgeon, and the romance that sparks between them. Ryle is against long term relationships, but Lily finds herself falling for him anyway. Everything is perfect... for a while.It starts as nothing really. An accidental push, a hot temper. A few stitches and an apology later, all is forgiven. Lily is confident that this is nothing like how her dad treated her mother. Ryle is not her father. Ryle is sorry. This is different.When Atlas, the first boy she ever loved comes back into her life, Lily finds herself trying to defend Ryle, trying to justify his actions. But Atlas seems to know the situation even better than Lily herself. The story follow Lily as she eventually realizes her situation for what it is until she is able to admit it to herself, and can finally pick up the pieces.Lily's story is important. I won't pretend that I know a lot about domestic abuse, because I don't. However, I do know that exists, and now because of this book, I know that not every case of domestic violence is the same. Not every woman hates her abuser, in fact she may still love him so much that she sacrifices her own safety and mental health. This story makes the powerful statement that the cycle needs to stop somewhere, that violence is never okay, that sometimes love means letting go and leaving the situation. The vicious cycle of domestic violence? It ends with us.Note: This book does contain sexual content, though not a lot, as well as f-words and other language. Though I think the book would have been better without this content, especially the language, I believe the message of the story itself is more important and is worth the read.
title: An Important Story

author: JazePantz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
review_content: When I started this book I had a heart, it was complete and happy. By the time I finished this book my heart was broken because I could whole heartedly relate to this story and know how hard it can be to say "it ends with me".I am now on a Colleen Hoover binge...Verity blew my mind and It Ends With Us was a heart breaker. I don't know what to expect next from this author.
title: Oh the tears

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: I was so excited to read this book. But when I received it in the mail I thought, be patient. I saw a preview to a show or a movie the other day and a character said, "I can tell you but I can't untell you". That statement stuck with me but I use it for reading this book. I can read it but I can't unread it or read it for the first time again. Does any of that make sense?Hoover seems to know where to hit my emotions. Every one of her books have smacked my emotions but this one is squeezing me. This one was too close to a reality I was apart of. It was very emotional and I had to stop a few times, to have a breather. It wasn't what I thought it would be but it exceeded anything I thought it would be. I will always recommend this book, always.This book will always stick with me Colleen, thank you.CF
title: It will move you♡

author: georgina crino
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021
review_content: This is the first novel I read by Colleen Hoover and I will definitely be reading more of hers again. I am not a reader! I haven’t read a book in so long but I could not manage to put this book down. I read it in 3 days and was crushed when I finished it. Bittersweet and a great story. It’s very raw and makes you feel a lot throughout the whole story. I was always eager to see what happened next.Highly recommend.
title: Couldn’t put it down!

author: Brittany O
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2016
review_content: This book is amazing! You will be drawn in and want to read the book straight through. Without giving too much away there is some domestic violence that appears in the novel. However, as someone who has been personally affected I still recommend the book. It will be an emotional journey but in the end you will be glad you read it. This book has a terrific message for those who have judged women in abusive relationships, been in a relationship themselves, or watched a loved one be abused. Colleen Hoover is a phenomenal writer! Like the rest of her books, this book is completely unpredictable but not in the annoying drama just for the sake of drama (like a soap opera). Love, love, love! This is the type of book that will stay with you for years to come.
title: Powerful and beautiful!

author: theresa Sederholt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2016
review_content: Having never read a Colleen Hoover book, I had no idea what I was in for. I picked up her latest book, It Ends With Us and decided to jump right in. I held it together through the entire book. Trust me when I tell you this was not easy. I might have laughed out loud a little and even held back the urge to yell and cry. I have a newfound appreciation for all things Ellen DeGeneres. Anyway, back to the book. This is not a typical book; this is a journey through life. Ms. Hoover makes the reader feel every emotion from the viewpoint of a fifteen-year-old to a twenty-five-year-old. She also makes the reader think. What would I do if I were in that situation? Would I be so quick to judge? Would I be willing to help?It’s hard to say anything more without giving away the story. Like I said I held it together through the entire story. I finally lost it completely when I got to the Authors Note. This book is like an onion and when you peel back the layers, it makes you want to be more understanding of different situations and the people trying to make it through life. This story makes  you want to be a better person.
title: This story makes you want to be a better person.

author: Rachel RM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: *possible spoilerColleen, this is such a beautiful book in so many ways! I commend you for your courage to speak the "naked truth." As an author we can hide those naked truths in our work in hopes that others see them, but that they don't really know whether or not those things are true or are based in the fiction our works embody. I can only imagine how scary it was writing those truths knowing that people would eventually know for sure that they are based on a reality that you endured. Thank you for sharing yourself in this way. I know that there are people out there that you will help by sharing your naked truths. By showing women that there is another way. Thank you Colleen for another beautiful story, that's not based on a beautiful topic, but has a beautiful outcome.
title: Wow...just wow

author: Kara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2016
review_content: Okay so I know I say this a lot, but this is probably the best book I have read all year. Where do I start? I don't want to give anything away, but Lilly's story is just...amazing. You will find yourself laughing, crying, and laughing again. I went through so many emotions in this book. Atlas, poor Atlas, what a great relationship Lily and he had. Then he leaves, and she meets Ryle. Ryle, oh he's just the perfect man - or so it seemed. He didn't want anything but a one-night-stand with Lily, but it ended up being so much more. Then, Atlas is back..Gahh. This isn't a typical love story. It's a reality that happens more than we realize. Colleen is such an amazing writer and this book is by far my favorite of hers! Go! Read it now!!
title: Oh Colleen. My heart aches...

author: Crazy Book Lover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2016
review_content: Colleen you always manage to steal my heart with your books and one for sure got me right there where it hurts!  I don't mean that I hated the story, just the opposite I loved it.  I have never felt feelings like I had with this one, I mean I found myself sobbing NO, NO, Please NO.  Maybe it was because this one hit a little close to home.  You definitely wrote a wonderful, compelling heartbreaking story!!!  I couldn't help but fall in love with all the characters, some more than others, but isn't that true with all books!  I want to thank you and your Mother for sharing.  I really never understood how someone could keep loving someone that treated them so terrible but this story did help me understand somewhat what it's like to stay with someone who hurts you and your family.  I do hope that if someone finds themselves in this sort of disarray or chaos that they will seek out help for themselves and their families and no pun intended but end it there.  I only wish my own Mother would have had this story to read years ago!!!
title: Beautiful and Heart Wrenching but Well Worth It!!!!

author: Josh&bethany
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2017
review_content: "You can stop swimming now lily, we've finally reached the shore."CoHo did it again... each book I read I think this is my favorite book... this is it y'all. This is my favorite book she has written! I've never been disappointed in her writing it's always kept me interested and unable to put the book down when I should be cooking dinner or folding laundry.Lily is such a strong character, she loves with all she has and only wants the best for herself and her daughter.Ryle... oh Gosh I love Ryle... I wish so much that he wasn't the villain in this book. I wanted that first time to be the only time. But I know this story had to be told the way it was. And I love CoHo for it.Atlas... he is the high school sweetheart you don't marry but find later in life. He's the first and last love of your life. With so much between the with time distance and the past, they way he still over lily and never stopped is beautiful. And although we didn't see a whole lot of who he is now, we saw so much of who he was when he and Lily were first in love.A note for Colleen: Please, please, please, I need more! I want to know what happens with Lily and Atlas, I want their ending. What happens with Ryle? Does he change? I need more!
title: Favorite book by Colleen!

author: Pavlina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: "No one is exclusively bad, nor is anyone exclusively good. Some are just forced to work harder at suppressing the bad."This is by far the most emotional book I read so far by Colleen Hoover!!I gone blind in this story,didn't read the blurb and I didn't know what it was about.Once I start reading it , I find myself inside the story.Everything felt so real,raw,intense and emotional."It's not a person's actions that hurt the most. It's the love. If there was no love attached to the action, the pain would be a little easier to bear."This book was absolutely incredible and so different from the other books I have read from Colleen yet again it was original,unique and even though the story deals with very serious issues the way Colleen tells the story is so beautiful.The characters are likeable and realistic..I fell hard for them and I was anxious ,upset and nervous about how the story will end.For one more time Colleen delivers an unforgettable story like no other.This is one of these books that you must read!!!
title: 4,5 -5 EMOTIONAL STARS

author: Lisa Hickey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2019
review_content: That’s what this book was like. You don’t always feel like you’re walking on a tightrope in life, sometimes you’re on solid ground. This book, this book revealed the tightrope that everyone walks at some point in life. It may not be for the same reasons that Lilly experiences but we all walk it and experience that pit in our stomach. This book is everything and honestly the best book I’ve read. Over the last couple of years I’ve read a few of Colleen’s books but none that had this impact. Though they were close seconds and thirds this book is unbelievable. A must read. Thank you for writing it.
title: Walking a tightrope...

author: ADuffie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2016
review_content: Wow! Completely and utterly blown away! Colleen Hoover knows how to tell a story and really hit home. My emotions are all over the place right now and I'm still processing. This book touched on a very hard subject and it was done so perfectly.This is not a lighthearted read. It’s one that will break your heart and by the end put it back together. Colleen stepped out of her usual box and wrote an emotional story that will stay with me.I just loved Lily
title: she is such a strong heroine. To say she had an easy life would be an understatement. Her journey was one that she came out of stronger than she was before.This is one book you do not want to miss. It has all the feels and you wont be able to put it down. I will say make sure you have some tissues handy. This is a must READ!

author: GJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
review_content: A little background, I’m not a big reader and it usually takes me a month to finish a GOOD book. And 1/2 of the time I don’t finish. I couldn’t stop reading this book! I finished it in a week and now my house is a complete disaster! I laughed, I cried and even got a little frisky reading it. Such an emotional and thought provoking book! Makes you think about what you would do in that situation. This is my first time reading her books. I just bought two more. Great writing and great book!
title: Finished in a week! I’m not a reader!

author: booklover82
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2016
review_content: It's been hard for me to pick up a COHO book bc I know what she does to me... Build me up and then completely crush me!!! I can say I honestly haven't read Never Never or even November 9. But something kept pulling me into this book. I HAD to buy it on release day. I cried, I bawled, I sent pictures of my self to my friends completely in tears. I couldn't stop reading, I couldn't stop crying. I used so many tissues that I had to start using a roll of toilet paper(which is currently still sitting on my bed) to blow my nose. You, Colleen Hoover, are just simply amazing with your words and stories. I think MAYBE and that's a big maybe, lll finally start some of your other books. Every woman should read this book! Simply amazing.
title: This book SLAYED me!

author: M.M.B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: There aren't enough stars that will rate this book the justice it deserves. Hoover just keeps getting better and better. It Ends With Us is now my #1 CoHo book and it still surprises me to say that because Hopeless has held number #1 since it was released. Other than hitting way too close to home, IEWU gave me in the worst book hangover of my life. It was all I thought about, I re read it 3x, and I kept wondering why I couldn't just love Ryle. The moment he messed up, that was it for me. I LOVED Lily so much and I understood why she would make the choices she did. Everyone thinks they would know what they would do if it was them, and the truth is.....until it does happen to you, you can never say "if it was me, I would have....".  I don't think I can ever thank Colleen enough for writing a book on such a taboo subject.
title: 5 stars

author: Ashley Tidwell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2016
review_content: I went into this story completely blind to what it would be about. I have read several of Hoovers books before so I knew it would be a love story. I didn't know it would be what it was though. I don't want to spoil it for anybody in case they haven't already learned but it ripped my heart out. This book is the favorite book of the year for me. I got so emotionally involved, and the fact that the story is really very common made it even more real. I mean women have to fight this all the time and she did such a good job of turning true stories into fiction. I feel like it came through so well because it is a story that is so close to her heart. It is a new adult novel so there is sex, there is fighting and you will cry, it is still worth every minute I spent reading and crying.
title: My Heart Was Broken and Healed at the Same Time

author: Susan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2016
review_content: Loved the book.  Did not love how Ryle or Atlas seem to appear in doorways, stairways, entryways lol at unrealistic moments in order to create tension .  In fact, as the story progressed, during lighthearted moments in the story I would think "I bet Ryle is going to show up like magic" and whaddaya know ... he did!  Unrealistic. Otherwise the writing is very good, story is good but a little contrived, (I could have really done without the Dear Ellen diary ... could Lily not have just kept a normal diary?  And her language is a 15-year-old is no 15-year-olds language. )  when not analyzing, I really enjoyed the story and a very significant message the author clearly  conveyed.
title: Great story, unrealistic plot elements

author: Kathy (Adventures of a Bookworm)
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: If you're like me, when Colleen Hoover writes a novel, you expect to go on a roller coaster of emotions as you read. Experiencing so many feels as you go on your journey through the story, yet never wanting to get off.While reading It Ends With Us, my expectations were blown out of the water.  Did she write another emotional novel? Absolutely.  Will it be memorable like her other novels? Without a doubt.  Is it like anything she's ever written before? No. It's So. Much. BETTER.Leading up to this release, Ms. Hoover and everyone who has read this novel, has insisted that you go in blind.  So I did. And you should too. There is no need to mention anything about the plot.Just read it.It's not just another love story. The words in this book are important. They are powerful.  They are thought-provoking.  They. Are. REAL.This book demands to be read.  What are you waiting for?
title: Powerful, thought-provoking, REAL.

author: Anonymous
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover has really done an amazing job with this book. I managed to read this book in one day. I couldn't put it down. The story of Lily and Ryle and Altas is one that I will never forget. It's one of those books that constantly stays at the back of your mind when your see something and it reminds you of the book. I have already given my paperback to others to read with the note to get some extra tissues in place before reading. And I have to tell you the way Colleen Hoover was able to put my heart back together after I finished this book was equally amazing. I am in bed reading with tears flowing the entire time. This book takes your heart out but also the author is able to mend my heart in the end by giving her characters the ending they deserve. I won't give details because I won't ruin the story for anyone else. Just know these few things. Tissues, no sleep because you can't put the book down and make sure your don't have kids asking for something either I couldn't stop reading. No breaks for me till I finished.
title: Broken Heart mended in the end but broken all the same!!! Colleen Hoover you my friend are amazing!!!!!

author: Ashley Christensen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
review_content: I went in completely blind like many people recommended. I barely even skimmed over the synopsis on the back of the book. I cannot express in words how much of an effect this book had on me. The effect is plainly written all over my red, blotchy, tear stained face. I can't think of this book without breaking down into tears.I wish I could write a proper review like others have done and like this book deserves. I wish I could think straight right now, but I can't. The only thing I can think to say is that I hope everyone reads this book. Whether you go in blind or you choose to know what you're getting yourself into, read this book. Colleen deserves to have this story read and everyone needs to have the experience of reading it.
title: Best read of the year

author: Never Ending Love of Words
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2019
review_content: Ok this is my third book of Colleen Hoover that I've read. Hopeless was my first and I enjoyed it, but like this one the ending seemed rushed and unbelievable. Verity was my second and I think I enjoyed it the most. With all this I don’t see why her books should cost so much and have so much ratings. This story was had a great topic,but I don't think it was all that well done. The first half was great and I think the journal entries were my favorite. Than the second half just I don't know if just got ridiculous. The writing is pretty good but how the characters were written seemed kind of annoying in the second half, and the 'Naked Truth' was said way to much and used for ridiculous times. This is my opinion, I know many may not agree.
title: Not sure of all the hype!

author: Nikki M - Hot books & Sassy Girls
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020
review_content: It ends with Us by Colleen Hoover 5+++++++ Stars - wowLily has watched her mother suffer at the hands of her father for years. She never fully understands why her mother never leaves him, and why she makes excuses for him, but she knows that she will never let a man treat her as her father treated her mother. Lily has a kind soul and when she notices a boy who seemed to be homeless she befriends him. Atlas has a story of his own, but the one person he will always love will be Lily for her kind heart. Life moves on, and they lose contact but both land up in Boston. Lily meets a man, a gorgeous neurosurgeon named Ryle Kincaid, who seems perfect in every way, until he is not. The love story between Lily and Ryle will break you. You see the signs, you start making excuses for him, praying that it was an accident, but even you know it was not. Lily finds herself looking at her mother’s mirror. When she bumps into Atlas it opens a door that she is not sure if she wants to walk through. But Atlas knows Lilly better than anyone, and he knows when to step back. Will Lily become her mother, or will she be strong enough to walk away from a man that truly loves her. Will Atlas keep his promise? Ms. Hoover has written a story that was soul-destroying, but so skilfully written. I don’t know how she did it, that I fell in love with all the characters, that I found myself hoping for a miracle but deep down I knew it was never going to be. This book was so emotional and I have to give credit to this author because if you have never been in this situation, you can’t understand the excuses the abused will tell. This was gut-wrenching and so emotional and yet, between all this was the perfect love story. This was a brilliant story, get those tissues out.Hot Books and Sassy Girls
title: History repeates itself in the form of the abuser

author: TerriP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: WOW doesn’t even begin to describe this book; it’s neither an articulate enough nor descriptive enough word to describe all the emotions that this book evokes.  Colleen will break you, it won’t be pretty but I truly believe that this is a MUST read book of 2016.I HIGHLY recommend that you go into this story blind, I did as much as I hated that, it was well worth the tears. I would even consider buddy reading this book, you will need the support!I will admit that I was nervous about reading this book, based on the number of friends that had read it and were broken. Colleen broke some pretty tough hearts with this book.Colleen broke me at 96% that is when the tears fell in a steady stream. They were falling because I was sad to see someone loose something that they truly loved with all their heart. They were falling because I was so happy that someone was standing up for someone who needed more protection than the other. They were falling with the hope that they would all be able to achieve their happily ever after.Would I like to see a follow up to this?? Yes and No, I think she ending it at a good place, you know that there will be some drama to come. Do I want to witness it or live blindly that everything works out? I’m not sure how much more my heart can take.
title: MUST READ

author: Thomas Moody
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2019
review_content: At the risk of sounding sexist, I grabbed this seeming “chick book” at an airport bookstore as I was rushing to my flight, having totally spent my other reading material and then suddenly facing a four-plus hour airline experience. But I must say that upon completion, and after getting past the obligatory character BFF sequences (does anyone say BFF anymore?) and the hot sex episodes that just seemed to naturally occur (why didn’t these hookups ‘naturally’ occur back in my day??), this was a rather well written and deep experience that ultimately stayed with me for a surprisingly long time.Colleen Hoover revealed at the end of this novel that she’d undertaken a more personal and profound effort than she’d ever undertaken before and it certainly shows. “It Ends with Us” is a multi-layered love story with deep roots in important topical and social issues which Hoover brilliantly weaves into a compelling storyline. Again, once I got past the requisite pop culture aspects of this work, I found much meaningful discourse that held me and kept my rapt attention to the book’s completion.Admittedly I have not read any other works by Colleen Hoover and I suspect that their catalogue fall largely into this “chick” genre (yes I know, I’m being sexist again), but I do recommend this particular work for its importance with respect to woman’s violence issues and the very important stance it takes on women getting out of violent relationships and starting anew. With that, my hat is off to Colleen Hoover for helping to expose these atrocities and for attempting to help women escape these horrible relationships. And for the reader, you will understand this sentiment clearly when you finish this wonderful book.
title: A “Chick Book” with a message…

author: jlBostick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: A big part of me wants to give this book ONE SINGLE STAR for the unfinished hole it left in my heart but I cant. I cant because this book is an amazing novel, its well written as all of Hoovers novels are, its raw, its emotional and its real, for someone like me, too real. As a survivor of abuse, both as a child and an adult the rollercoaster I was taken on was just too much for me. As I knew it would be which is why it took me so long to read this book, ive read every other Hoover novel but this one scared me. Ive lived this life, I didnt want to relive this life but one night as I was all alone unable to sleep it called to me. After 4 hours of tears, pain and ANGER, I wish I could take it all BACK because the ending is so very bittersweet that it left me no closure. It made me fall in love with characters I shouldnt love and made me relive my own emotions during an abusive marriage. In the end I wanted to read a real happy ending and while yes it does have one, sort of, its not complete to me. I feel a bit hopeless, I feel let down, I feel like a book like this must have a better ending. And as Colleen has mentioned she will never write a sequal. But this book SO GREATLY needs one, it just breaks my heart to know I cant ever have that closure for these amazing characters. I want to see Ryle redeem himself and I want to see Lily live her happiness. I dont want it, I NEED it. I need this new hole in my heart to be filled because I feel a little betrayed by this book and because of it I honestly dont know if I can trust the author with my heart again.
title: SPOILER: An amazing book that feels incomplete.

author: Heather
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
review_content: ** spoiler alert ** I have to start by saying I grew up with an abusive stepfather, I wanted to start out saying this in order to give some validity to my opinion on this book. In Colleen Hoovers notes at the end of the book she does state there are different experiences when it comes to abusive relationships and situations and this book was based on hers. I'd say mine was a bit more severe in the sense that not only did I have to protect my mother, but myself and brother as well, since non of us were safe.SO - I actually thought the introduction and situation with Atlas from the beginning was cute, nice, and I figured he would have some major role to play in the story. But I honestly, in the beginning, completely skimmed the journal entry chapters (then later went back and reread realizing they were actually relevant to the plot), I just wasn't sold on him as a character. We get absolutely NO backstory on him. With that, Lily meeting Ryle and their interactions because all I wanted to read about. At least with Ryle we got more of a backstory, we got his sister becoming Lily's best friend, and we got to see more of his life and personality. I just fell in love with him as Lily did. Also as the story progresses you come to understand and relate to the way he is, with that kind of career it can be hard to dedicate the time and resources to a personal life. Plus you just have to make his a bit cocky and little ego for it to be an exciting romance :)OK - so the first "accident" - to me I honestly felt that was way overreacted on all fronts. Given my upbringing I don't think I would have even thought of this as an abusive moment, but again that's me. The 2nd and 3rd times - yes, I don't think Lily overreacted. I'm glad Atlas was there, but again I just wasn't connecting the two together to have any romantic connections. Also I was bit more scared for Lily even running to him knowing he was basically the ONLY cause for Riley's "moments".I truly wished they would have sought our some kind of counseling before just jumping to divorce. Again, I'm a product of multiple divorces, and yes I think I had a better relationship with my father later in life, but never want to see young kids experience this. This is a hard one to make a decision on, my mother thought a father with substance abuse (not physically abusive at all) was not a situation to have her daughter in, but then went to the physically abusive stepfather.... You just never know and so I can understand Lily making the decision she did, and the reader can assume closure in the end that Atlas would never be abusive toward her knowing her upbringing... I just don't necessarily think I would have made the same decision in the end and unfortunately for me, I guess I was a bit bummed she and Ryle parted ways.Don't get me wrong, I liked the story and the thoughts and perspective it made me see. Totally would recommend, especially for a Book Club. Definitely a conversation starter!
title: Everyone handles abuse differently....

author: JLH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2019
review_content: Everybody told me that there is one Colleen Hoover book that is their favorite and has resonated more with them than any other one, even though they loved the others too, and this book varies greatly among readers.  I am a fairly "new" Colleen reader and have been binging on her books since I finally started them (I think I was afraid I wouldn't enjoy them as much as everybody else was and I would be disappointed), which has not been the case at all!  I have enjoyed every single book and only have a few left, however, I think I have found the one that will stick with me the longest.  This book was everything..it made me feel so deeply that I cringed at times, teared up, laughed and smiled.  From the  first page to the last page and every single page in between...this is THE book I wish I could go back and reread for the first time so I can experience it all over again.  What an incredibly moving story of friendship, love, grief...grief over a lost relationship or two..as well as hope for the future.  If you only read one Colleen Hoover book in your life, make it this one.  Thank you Colleen for tackling a difficult subject and making it such a moving story and one of my top reads!
title: This is THE Book We All Need to Read

author: Maddison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2019
review_content: Listen, I can take dark. I have no problem reading about some sad times. However, this book was like 90% SAD. It was depressing. I am upset I continued reading. I DO NOT RECOMMEND.
title: Legit so depressing and not worth it

author: AmazonCustomer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2016
review_content: I don’t even know where to begin this review. Maybe I should just say how pretty this cover is and end there because I’m not sure I can talk about this. I’m seriously at a loss and so consumed by my feelings for this book. It was emotional, thought provoking, and beautiful! I haven't been able to stop thinking about it. I can't get over the emotions Colleen Hoover stirred inside me... sadness, anger, joy, love. This is what a book should be. It’s extremely powerful and a story that I think everyone should read. I've only read one other CoHo book so I'm not sure if it is her best book, but I'm going to say yes. Now, I want to share a full review with you, but like many others, I’m not sure how I can talk about this book without spoiling it for you. It really is something you just need to pick up and read. Go into it knowing as little as possible and just immerse yourself it all the feels!It Ends With Us is about a girl named Lily. She’s had a troubling childhood, but that’s not to say that there weren’t some good moments. As it goes though, it ends too quickly and she finds herself in her twenties, moving to Boston, and dreams of starting her own business. Needing a quite space Lily hunts for a quite rooftop and ends up meeting a guy named Ryle. Instantly there’s a connection. As introductions are made she finds out that he’s a neurosurgeon who’s dedicated to his job and at becoming the best in his field. She too reveals things about herself that she would never normally confess to a complete stranger, but they begin to develop an honest line of communication with these “naked truths.” This pulls them closer together and Lily knows that this could be a whirlwind romance and she’s not ready for it so they agree to take things slow. But as her and Ryle get to know each other better Lily can’t help but think back to her first love, Atlas. Homeless, Atlas stumbled into the abandoned house behind hers and this is where things got intense and deep really quick. We see pieces of him appear daily and it seems that he’s left breadcrumbs trailed throughout her life. So when he reappears it threatens what Lily and Ryle have built.This is all I’m going to say about the plot. Like I said, I don’t want to spoil anything for you, but what I can do is talk about how amazing and real these characters are. First up, Lily. I loved that we were able to flip between her past written as journal entries to Ellen (yes that Ellen) and her present. It was so well done because something with this type of flashback and be distracting or confusing, but this was quite the opposite. It was enjoyable and revealed more of Lily’s character each time. She’s such a strong character and I was so proud of her when she took the leap of faith and started her own business especially because it was something that she had been dreaming of. One key to her success was a girl named Allysa. An incredible friendship formed between these two. It was easily to see why with Allysa because she’s funny, goofy, a huge supporter, and honest. My favorite line from her mouth was that she is a “Pinterest whore.” It killed me. What girl in her teen-mid twenties isn’t?! Ryle was quite the rollercoaster for me. At first I swooned and adored him, then something changed. He became a character I detested and it was crazy to watch the 180 degree flip, but I also felt bad about it. You’ll see why, but Atlas. Sweet sweet Atlas. He’s got to be one of my favorite male characters ever! Like I said, he was sweet, thoughtful, kind, and filled with so much love. The relationship between him and Lily developed slowly and quite innocently and as it progressed it turned into something so deep that it was overpowering and charged.Now there were moments when I found things to be a little too predictable, but like a good CoHo book there was a shocking twist ahead. I didn’t see it coming. It punched me in the gut. I wanted to be wrong. I cried. It made me angry that this whole situation happened. I found myself questioning morals and IT. WAS. HARD. What was amazing though was that CoHo was able to weave moments of love, laughter, and swoon worthy moments into all of the heaviness. Just when your heart can’t take any more the ending hits you. It leaves you stunned and wanting more, but the ending is perfect. And the authors note at the end punched me in the gut. Don’t skip ahead. This MUST be saved for last. You can yell at me later.
title: A powerful and eye opening read that's a MUST for anyone.

author: Jennifer R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2019
review_content: In so many ways I liked this book but I was so turned off by the nasty  language. The way he spoke to her should have given her a clue he was going to be trouble. If a man spoke that way to me, I would be out of there in a heartbeat. The sexual encounters were just that. No love making. And the same old thing over and over again. Icky!She seemed like two different people in the book. Her younger version had more common sense and respect for herself. I get that women can get tangled into an abusive relationship but it was pretty clear early on.There are times were she shines and times when I wanted to scream at both of them. I most likely will not read another book by this author. It was too raunchy and I was asking myself several times why I kept reading it.It made me grateful for the good man I married!
title: Too much nasty language!

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2019
review_content: Whoa! This book hit close to home. It took me back to the kitchen of my youth as I recall walking into a heated argument where my mom’s boyfriend was hitting her. He was an alcoholic. After the third time, that I can remember about, I stood up to him and that was the last time she put up with it in our home. He managed to get to her one more time in the parking lot at her place of employment and the police department across the road couldn’t do anything about it, because the line that divided the street was a county line. She left him and made us a promise to never date anyone who we did not approve of. No questions asked, if we said the word they were gone. She eventually remarried and has been in a non-abusive relationship for the past 23 yrs. I remember ONCE pushing (testing) my boyfriend in an argument to see how he would respond and he never once raised his hand at me. We’ve been blessed to have a good and healthy relationship/marriage for the past 25 years. Ladies...you deserve better and so much more! Don’t EVER settle.
title: Heads up ladies!

author: Claudia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021
review_content: This is my first Coleen Hoover book and I fell in love with her writing, the work itself is beautiful and is organized.I would say the age range on this specific book would be from 14-30ish. Meaning yes there are some explicit scenes but it is definitely not over the top or exaggerated. The reason why is recommend this book within that age range (if u wanna read it then you do you) is because it is very much directed towards teenagers and young adults. Olderfolks can read it too, but from my observation based off other reviews and my personal perspective. I’d say if you are more into mature and less “childish” books, then you might want to skip on this one. But again, you do whatever you want.Now the story itself met my standards, it might make you cry. I did fall in love with one of the MC, Atlas, gosh what can I say.I thought the ending was appropriate, but I guess it will depend based off your personal morals.
title: Overall 4/5

author: Lenor B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020
review_content: “In the future…if by some miracle you ever find yourself in the position to fall in love again…fall in love with me.”I was so excited to start this one, by some means I just didn't read it when it was released but I think that everything happens for a reason, and maybe I am in a place right now where I can actually truly appreciate this book . So here it goes… one of the most earth shattering books Colleen Hoover has ever written, I couldn't put it down; I know that every single book that Colleen writes makes a difference in me, there’s always something back in my mind that changes thanks to her books, they make me different and I’d like to believe they make me a better person.Lily has worked hard to get out of that town that has so many bad memories she wants to forget, she wants a different start, a better one and the chance to be the woman she always dreamed to be, when life puts Ryle on her path she doubted to even be around him, but Ryle made it easy for her, they fell hard and fast and when she least expected it, someone from her past came to make her thinks twice about the choices she has made in life.Ryle has an aversion to relationships but something inside him is telling to change that rule for Lily, he successful and he knows what he wants in life but after one look at Lily, everything that he was supposed to put first, just changed. But there’s something that he’s hiding from Lily, and it’s something that Lily might not let go that easily but what happens when you meet the one person that makes you reprogram everything you’ve thought was priority?Atlas was the first love of Lily, their story is not quite common but they were innocent, a pure love based on honesty, they knew that they were going to part ways but they decided even at a young age that they needed each other in order to survive their present, even if their future was uncertain.I have to come clean… I'm not proud but not many times I take time to read the notes from authors, but after reading this book, I needed to understand what was behind this story, and well let me tell you that if I was out of tears by end of this book, well THAT note, just made me cry even further. Colleen… I want to be you when I grow up
title: One of the best of Colleen Hoover!!

author: alyssa miller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2020
review_content: I feel a bit conflicted writing this review. Once I read the afterward it made me reevaluate some of my critiques. The portrayal of Lily and Ryle's relationship illustrates some of the complexities involved in an abusive relationship, many times it isn't all bad all the time and that's one of the reasons she stays. When Lily has her inner monologue grappling with being in love with a whole person and thus contemplating forgiveness and feeling compelled to HELP and to work through the issue that really resonates. And the scene with she and her mother is incredibly real and poignant, I've never heard it expressed quite so eloquently, that if a man truly loves you he will want you safe from all harm and if he is the source of your harm and anguish he will leave you.... I don't really believe in a "noble" abuser although there may be very rare exceptions. I have encountered soldiers with such severe ptsd and night terrors they have attacked their partners and have elected to separate so they will not endanger their loved ones, but this scenario is profoundly different from an abusive relationship specifically the one portrayed in this book. When I read the afterward and the author explained her own connection to the story I did feel a bit conflicted in challenging her unrealistic narrative because it is based in her reality and past experience. However, with Ryle the rationale or origins of his abusive tendencies are explained by childhood trauma for which he has been in therapy for years. He is a highly functioning accomplished professional who maintains good relationships with his family. His relationship with Lily is obsessive and possessive these emotions are the fuel for his rage/abuse. Obsession does not self-extinguish and I find it very hard to believe that Ryle would just step aside and respect Lily's boundaries. While the author may have experienced a peaceful separation between her parents where they essentially agreed to part ways as amicably as possible this just doesn't happen for 99.9% of women. If Lily's story were real she would've likely experienced months and years of stalking type behavior culminating in her murder or severe injury.... Perhaps I am being too harsh but the pattern of abuse in this story doesn't resolve in this fashion without aggressive intervention. I know the author relied on her own family experiences as the basis of this story but she really should have done more research into domestic violence.
title: Possible spoilers....

author: Htins
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2017
review_content: This was a good book... but not great, which is surprising. I felt like Lily was with Ryle way too long after the first incident. And honestly I wanted way, WAY more time with Atlas. He was hardly there and I would have preferred him to be the main character and not a side character, which is what he felt like. All in all, great author - writing is great, flow is good. But the story itself just wasn't for me this round I guess. I prefer a romance book with an actual "hero" and not a "villain". Because let's all be honest, that's what he is regardless of whatever background he has or how sorry he is. Just really disappointed that this was labeled as a romance when it was mostly about abuse. If I would have known that, I wouldn't have spent 8$ on it.
title: Ugh.. NOT a romance book. Don't label it as one

author: Kacie88
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2021
review_content: Wow, what a story. This book hit close to home. Thank you Colleen Hoover for delivering on this one.“It Ends with Us”, is a twisted story of reality for many people. It tells the story of a young woman who has witnessed her fathers abuse towards her mother and herself in the past and also tells the story of her present. There is empowerment in this novel, but also complete down and out helplessness at times. It ebbs and flows with heartbreak and the highs of head over heels love. It isn’t your typical “empowered” abuse story in many ways, it shows the real struggle women go through to find empowerment and sometimes not finding it. At times your left thinking, “Why doesn’t she just leave?!”. But this story tells the “naked truth” of how these relationships more than often end up trapping those within it and how sometimes it’s impossible to leave (at least in your own mind) and sometimes it’s impossible to stay. It also shows that no matter the short amount of time some one is in your life, it doesn’t determine the impact they will have on you.A beautiful story of love and raw reality. You won’t regret picking this one up.
title: Beautiful Heartbreak

author: Kelly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020
review_content: As always, Colleen Hoover manages to make me laugh and cry tears of heartbreak and happiness for her characters. The only fault I can find in her writing is not truly a fault but just me wanting a little bit more after her endings...like we have to go through all this happiness and turmoil and then then the main character ends up with the love interest right at the very end and I just want to beg her to give me a little more of what their life together ended up being like. Like: Did her and Atlas have kids of their own, was he a wonderful stepfather, how were Ryle and him, where did they end up living (his house??), maybe some lovemaking thrown in there haha. I just really wanted more of her and Atlas I guess maybe to soothe the heartbreak that was her and Ryle. It was a beautifully written story though and I think the reasons she wrote it were admirable. I felt like that about Heart Bones too just wanted a bit more after they found each other again. I do think Ugly Love did a pretty good job with the epilogue.
title: Bittersweet Ending

author: Briana Bailon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021
review_content: This was my first Colleen Hoover book that I’ve read, and all I can say is, I was throughly impressed by the writing. Before reading this book, I wasn’t sure what to expect. I thought this story would be straight forward in terms of figuring out the plot line, but I was mistaken.From the beginning of the book, I was fascinated with Lily’s character and the interactions she shares with Ryle and Atlas.
