As the story progressed, there were moments that left me in shock and I genuinely felt a lot for Lily and what she went through. The way Colleen wrote this story gave a unique perspective into what Lily went through, and what many women have experienced like her. As I got more into reading the story, I found myself holding back tears because, my heart broke for both Lily and Atlas.As I’m writing this, I’m still holding back tears because I’m sad I’ve finished this story and I’m feeling a lot of emotions ranging from being happy to how Lily’s story ended and sadness from the hardships both she & Atlas have endured.If you haven’t read any of Colleen’s books, I would recommend reading this, it’s definitely a book worth your time, and by the end of it, you’ll be looking for a box of tissues around the house.
title: Tears of sadness, happiness, and a story with an eye opening perspective

author: K. Berry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
review_content: I have read other Colleen Hoover books and I love her writing style.  This book was different and I had read it based on a recommendation and did not bother reading reviews first.Abusive relationships happen at all ages, so in my opinion, this book is good for all ages, from teenagers to adults.Lily Bloom understood what a bad relationship was by watching her parents.  (Some people grow up in loving homes and do not always understand what a bad relationship is).  Lily had empathy for her friend Atlas, who was going through some rough times and they developed a 'good' relationship.  Years go by and Lily does well for herself and she meets Ryle Kincaid.  Although he is a neurosurgeon and successful, he has flaws, which you will understand as you read the book.  However, it turns into a 'bad' relationship.  (I don't want to give the storyline away, but I would just say that many people in abusive relationships have a hard time walking away.  Lily took a different stance eventually and I just think this is good for people to read, to learn that it is OK to take a stance and stand up for yourselves, even though I'm sure it is easier said than done.  It is a heartbreaking subject).This book just hits you in every emotion... its a tough topic but Colleen did a great job with this.  I highly recommend!
title: How to distinguish between a good and bad relationship!  a MUST read!

author: Bbooks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020
review_content: “Fifteen seconds. That’s all it takes to completely change everything about a person. Fifteen.”― Colleen Hoover, It Ends with UsJust.....no words.This book was fantastic. In fact, I think it maybe the best book about Domestic Abuse I have ever read anywhere. This was a book I read with a bunch of friends and I do not think any of us realized the depth and the power this book would have. We loved it.I thought the Author did an amazing job of getting into the heads of the characters, particularly Lilly and Ryle.Not just that though. She really depicted a whole relationship from its wonderful beginnings to the exact moment..the MOMENT..everything changes. It was just done so seamlessly. I was blown away.There is domestic abuse here so it can be triggering. This work of literature may and most likely will, move you to tears, Truly.Five stars and an incredible read. Wish they were all like this.5 likes
title: The best book on domestic abuse I've ever read.

author: Samantha
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover never ceases to amaze me with the depth of realness she is able to put into her stories and characters. Ryle couldn't be just a  neurosurgeon with dazzling looks. Lily would never just be able to walk away and never look back. They needed to grow together, learn together, and break the vicious cycle together. I love that CoHo was able to write a story that proves we are strong enough to overcome our weakness. We can do bad things, but not let them define our entire lives or take over our personality.Lily was the perfect balance of  being strong enough to leave, yet real enough to struggle with leaving someone she . She is an amazing example for young women and especially new mothers who find themselves in a difficult situation that seems impossible to escape. Ryle was the best example of someone who seems amazing, but has a darkness that he can't keep hidden,  no matter how hard he fights it. I think they'll love eachother more through coparenting than they ever would have had they let this issue repeat itself. Atlas, sweet and caring,  was the real proof that no matter how rough the water is, if you just keep swimming,  the ocean eventually leads you ashore.Thank you, Colleen for not making this serious issue into a candy-coated, hollywood fairytale.
title: You can stop swimming now...

author: Dannica Alcantara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2017
review_content: Right after reading it for two days, I immediately open Amazon and write my thoughts.The book begins with Lily meeting Ryle, a successful neurosurgeon, and the romance that sparks between them. Ryle is against long-term relationships, but Lily finds herself falling for him anyway. Everything is perfect... for a while. It starts as nothing really. An accidental push, a hot temper. A few stitches and an apology later, all is forgiven. However, there is a breaking point, and there will come a time it needed to end.Every CoHo book, I already know it is something you will always remember, deep in your mind and deep in your heart. It took me long before I got the courage to read another CoHo book. But even though I prepared myself, I can't believe she did it again, she completely blown me away! I am speechless as I type this. I don't know what to say, really! It feels I have so many things to say about the book, but it made me speechless! I still feel that it's tightly gripping my heart.I got teary eyed, during the 86% of the book, then I am so messed up during the 95%. I am torn, it was not something I expected in the end, but CoHo wrote it so beautifully. I personally relate with Lily and her mother, because my mother also experienced what they experienced. It truly cuts me deep because I know what it feels like, to watch and feel helpless. But just like Lily, albeit late, my mother fought. Somehow in the end I root for Ryle, somehow I feel I am Lily, butThank you Colleen Hoover for sharing your past. For taking courage to share this life.
title: Unexpected, Painful and yet Beautiful!

author: Kari
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2016
review_content: View on my blog here: [...]I read my first Colleen Hoover book at the beginning of the year when I stumbled upon “November 9” online. I had no idea how popular her work was or how seasoned of a writer she was, in fact, I had never even heard of her before, but I took a chance and I was instantly attracted to her characters and her “easy reading” writing style. It’s not hard to escape reality and completely lose yourself in the lives of her characters and their situations. Since then, I have also read “Ugly Love” and now “It Ends with Us.”As a fairly new reader of Colleen Hoover novels, I have to say that “It Ends with Us” is my favorite thus far.Less sex, more story!I’m no prude, but one of the reasons that I didn’t really care for “Ugly Love” was because it was more like a late night soft porn on HBO and lacked what I crave in a book, which is a great plot line.Don't get me wrong, there are tons of sexy time scenes, but I found myself more drawn to the story this time and grew an attachment to the actual characters and not just their sexual members. ;) I had to roll my eyes through most of the super cliche` parts that most women swoon over, but the plot line in IEWU is full of amazing characters and so many layers that it is impossible to put this book down! I really loved the story told through Lily's childhood journals about her relationship with Atlas.There is a lot of humor on the sidelines, but the overall vibe of this book is solemn, heartbreaking, and hopeful.IEWU deals with subjects such as homelessness and first love, but the main focus of the novel is domestic violence. Colleen Hoover executes this theme well and shows her readers first-hand what women and children that endue domestic violence may experience physically and emotionally. Colleen's characters have to face love, life, and loss and embrace every situation that is hurtled at their hearts.There isn't much else I can say here without spoiling the plot, because I have discovered that her novels are best if you know very little about them. I will just say that Colleen has really stepped up and wrote a powerful and gripping novel that everyone can learn from.OK.!SPOILER ALERT! This is the part where I moan and groan about the story aspects that I question.Is rape EVER forgivable?I was very annoyed that Lily seemed to forgive Ryle for the marital rape incident and never reported it when she went to the hospital. She was more concerned about Ryle's reputation rather than her own safety and well-being. WTF! Yeah, she got away from him and left at this point in the story, but still...Would you ever leave your child alone with someone who is known to be abusive?At the end of the book Colleen explains where the inspiration for IEWU came from. To my surprise, it came from her childhood experience with domestic violence. She explained how her father would have violent outbursts directed at her mother, but never at her and her sister. I understand that each situation is different, but in Lily and Ryle's situation, It seemed like his anger was purely temper and anyone in his way could be a victim. I didn't feel like it was okay to leave her new born child alone with him for long periods of time. I mean, she didn't even really feel comfortable being alone with him. Why would you trust him with your child? When Lily and Ryle married, they barely knew each other, and by the end of the book I felt like they STILL didn't know each other... How does she know that Ryle isn't going to be violent with their child?UGHHHHH.
title: Colleen's Best Yet!

author: Tabby (Tantalizing Reviews)
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2016
review_content: It has taken me quite some time to write this review. The delay wasn't because I disliked the book, the delay was because I was absolutely blown away with It Ends with Us.Lily and Ryle's story is one that will forever stick with me. It has in fact been month's since I finished reading the book and even today, the emotions, the pain, the happiness... everything still touches me, still impacts me.I loved the banter between Lily and Ryle, their sweet moments, their blossoming love, but under that was a secret. Pain, anger, and a love in turmoil lay beneath the surface.Atlas.  Oh, how I love Atlas. He's protective of Lily, they have a past that included love that was ripped away from them. He's not the boy he was, he's now a man, who still loves Lily.Reading what Lily went through and remembering the similar aspects to my life, took me back in time, ripped open old scars and someway, somehow stitched them back up again, but this time I realized I wasn't weak, I was Lily, I was strong.If you haven't read this book, you need to. It will penetrate you soul, heart and mind. I have to admit this was the first book I have read by Colleen Hoover, even though I have other books of hers on my Kindle. I will be reading those ASAP.
title: Favorite book of 2016!

author: annalise
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
review_content: The reader is introduced to Ryle and all of his quirks and we slowly fall in love with him. He’s sexy and bold, a little dangerous and consuming. We are knee deep in that love for him when he strikes Lily for the first time and it’s incredibly jarring. I have a minor in women’s studies, I have worked with battered women, I directed the Vagina Monologues for years in college and when this happened to Lily that first time in her small kitchen, I asked myself “was it an accident? Yeah I think he was running the water over his hands and accidentally elbowed her” oh wait but then he yelled at her. Then he told her it wasn’t funny. I’m saying to myself “he’s upset she’s laughing, but didn’t mean to push her.”Here’s why this story was so powerful to me: abusers don’t come labeled. They are not all bad with no sweetness. And often, the lovable traits are real. Even moreso, their ability to love is real. The tricky part is in that dizziness that is powerful love, there are sharp edges and rough hands and bruises that never completely fade away because they stay deep within.So as the reader, we make excuses with Lily. Then maybe some of us turn a corner and turn on Ryle and are angered that Lily hasn’t done the same. But this is how it happens for many women. This isn’t the story of all abusive relationships. This isn’t a handbook for what you should do when the love of your life strikes you. This is a story, a plausible story, and there are many women out there who will identify with it. And there are many other women who can learn from it. Abusive relationships are not black and white.Heartbreaking and potent. I truly appreciate this story.
title: Rollercoaster of emotions

author: April Dancer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2019
review_content: This is my first book by Colleen Hoover, and I liked it.  I think her writing style is charming.  The dialogue was completely believable.  The main characters have so much dimension to them.  Life is never black and white, and neither were the situations in this book.  However, my understanding is that this story is not representative of her work, so if you're looking for your typical romance, you may not like what you get.  As for me, I'm looking forward to reading more her books.SPOILERSSPOILERSSPOILERSSPOILERSSPOILERSBut I must say that Lily did NOT make the best decision she could for her daughter.  She made the best decision she could for herself.  If she had made the best decision for her daughter, she’d have tried to get sole custody of Emerson with supervised visitation for Ryle.  Because the fact of the matter is that Ryle has bouts of uncontrolled anger, and one day, if she's not removed from his custody, his daughter will experience the full brunt of it.
title: Liked it!

author: RaChelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2016
review_content: Oh Ms. Hoover, I really don’t even know if I can continue to read your books. (lies, just lies, I tell myself to help my heart heal and trick it into a subdued moment so I can actually function for the day, I will read every book you ever write. every. single. one)Just when I think you can’t possibly find another way to rip apart my heart in the most beautiful way possible, you do it again and ten times over. My heart HURTS after this book. It hurt during this book, it hurts now, hours after I have finished it. It was gut wrenching to read, so deep and emotional, and unbearable it made me love and hate you with every ounce of my being.I don’t want to go into detail, because I went into this book completely blind. I didn’t even read the blurb, I trust you and your writing that much. And I don’t want to spoil the roller coaster for anyone else. Just know, if you haven’t read it yet, be prepared to deal every emotion you can think of. As I was reading I could feel early on it was going to be a book with conflicting feelings, and at every event, I felt myself more and more torn in which direction I SHOULD be feeling, and what direction I was ACTUALLY feeling. Justification, excuses, love, pain, you write them in a way that makes it impossible to not feel each emotion deep down in my bones and my soul along with Lily and every person involved. Another GR review said it best in that: “I cannot stress how important and damn smart this book is. There is no black and white characterization - it's much deeper and more complex than that, and therefore, far more emotional.”-Emily May ß--------- YES, that is exactly the words I want to express. There is no black and white, and as much as you want to tell yourself there is, there just isn’t. The world and emotions and situations are horribly gray. There is damn gray everywhere. So much gray it is hard to see through it.The power and the honesty in this story is eye opening. I found a special place in my heart for Alyssa. There is a special moment, where her clarity as a person is beyond brave. To be able to separate her feelings into what Lily should actually do, really shows the deepness of her friendship and love for Lily.
title: My heart had to be scraped off the floor.

author: Christine M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
review_content: I love CoHo!!! She is one of my favorite authors. I’m just starting out with reading her books but I love the way she writes. When I read any of her books I just feel as though the words are being spoken to me. They just flow off the page so smoothly; I love it! It Ends With Us really touched me. It honestly was a little emotionally hard for me to read just because I wasn’t expecting any sort of domestic violence in the story, however, I was so happy with the way the story ended. It was heart-wrenching but so uplifting and hopeful throughout the entire story. It was such a twisted form of love and Colleen really portrayed a male lead that you became angry with over and over but also couldn’t help but have a tiny bit of sorrow for him due to his past.For readers who are going through or who have been through any form of domestic violence this may potentially be triggering to you if you aren’t fully healed or if you haven’t been able to seek for help through therapy to start healing. Just wanted to include this with my post because I didn’t see it coming but consider myself healed enough to where this didn’t cause me any harm.I took a leap of faith 4.5 years ago and texted a stranger on the internet who kindly shared her number for those in need. She gave me that little bit of faith and bravery that I needed to leave my then boyfriend who abused me. If any of you need even just someone to talk to (for any reason) you can text me at 504-224-6431 I know how lonely it all can feel.
title: A bittersweet story with a hopeful ending!

author: Kris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021
review_content: This book was AMAZING 💗I've never felt a love story like the love story here, and yes I still call it a love story despite what happens in this story. I don't know if it touched me in a different way because I'm married and I've been married for some years now and have faced a lot of hard times just as any marriage does and will and to truly feel and get what Lily feels for Ryle despite everything. And the ending ( I won't give spoilers) OH MY GOSH the ending,  absolutely BROKE my heart!I don't want to give away what the story centers around but I would say research it a bit if you are triggered by certain subject matters especially if you've experienced it in your life, but this is honestly a book I want my own daughter to read (once she turns 18 because there's explicit sexual parts in it) and that I think every women should read whether she has been or is in this situation and even women or anyone who only see's these kinds of situations from the outside and makes judgements because I know I was one who did it and now I see it in a completely different light which is what the author wanted and I think she did an amazing job doing it without romanticizing this subject.This book and the characters will forever stay with me. I HIGHLY recommend this book and give it 5 stars and two thumbs up!Oh, and I will never be able to watch "Finding Nemo" the same way again lol.
title: A MUST READ!!!

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020
review_content: I loved this book I felt Lily's and Riley's anguish and love for one another I liked that the author showed that no  matter  your class , status or what you do for a living you could possible have abusive tendencies. I was proud of Lily she  gets it together at the worst but best minute of her life. I felt for Riley but at the same time it was his own fault and I hope he got counseling and it help him in his next relationship. I felt like Atlas was a back story waiting in the wings for Lily .  I would of liked the epilogue to be about Atlas's  relationship years later .
title: This is the second book I've read from this author and I think I'm a addicted

author: Xoxo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2021
review_content: Spoiler warning🤷🏼‍♀️ I bought this after seeing a tiktok telling me to go buy without reading the description. The woman said simply “this book changed my life”. So obviously I came right to Amazon and purchased through prime and next day delivery...I’m the type of person to read and reread a book a few times. That’s why I purchase and don’t just go to a library or used book store. That being said- I flew through this book. I normally fly through books when I’m hooked but this was a different type of fly through. The book was just an easy ready. And once said and done I’m looking back kind of annoyed and bored. The abuse aspect of the main characters life and relationships  is so normalized in this book that it’s honestly kind of disturbing. I wouldn’t rush to hand over to my friends or daughter to read because of this. Maybe it’s just not for me idk.
title: Returning...

author: Tllec5
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020
review_content: This book was heavy and I absolutely loved it. The love and emotions rocked me with Lily, Ryle and Atlas.You have Lily who dealt with a lot of demons growing up watching her parents with a shit relationship. She wanted to be everything they weren’t in the future. You have Atlas who was her first love, a homeless boy she was kind to and ended up being the sweetest dreamboat man. You have Ryle who is a sexy neurosurgeon who is against relationships and kids and marriage etc. But he has a weak spot for Lily and he can’t figure out why. There is lots of spice and nice in this book mixed with physical abuse and dash of rape. It was told beautifully and I longed for Lily to find her happiness. The story gives you a perspective of how people are quick to judge when it comes to spouse abuse when there are so many layers that come to be in that situation and how hard it is to get out of it.Also, Ryle’s sister Issa is adorable and I want her as a friend. Her rich ass husband is pretty awesome too.
title: Intense and heavy - SO GOOD

author: Nancy Franklin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019
review_content: The story is like a B movie. You can figure the outcome by chapter two. After reading over half of the book it goes in the throw away pile. Not worth sharing
title: boring

author: Erika
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
review_content: “No matter how convinced you are that your life will turn out a certain way, all that certainty can be washed away with a simple change in tide.” - It Ends With Us.SO . MANY . TEARSOnce again, this is a book that I am late to. I have heard so many good things about Colleen Hoover over my book reading journey, and I just recently have been getting into her books. The first book I read by her was “Verity” and while that book is very different than this one,the writing is both phenomenal and emotional. I definitely need to get it together and read all her books. Overall, I rated this book 4.5 stars but I have rounded it up to 5 stars for review purposes.Overall, this book was amazing. It started out as a love story and then switched to some sexy scenes, but halfway through the book is when it became intense. Seriously, I am positive my heart rate steadily rose for the entire second half of the book. With this intensity came heartbreaking revelations and decisions that left me ugly crying at the end. When reading these parts I was so conflicted in regards to the main characters decisions and emotions. The book touches on many serious aspects of romantic relationships, abuse, and love which are all very hard hitting.I felt that all the characters were well represented, complicated, and contributed to the story so much. I was in love with the main character, Lily, and her drive to achieve all she wanted in her life and in her romantic relationships. I also think that she grows throughout the book and this change is represented in her personal thoughts as well as her actions and decisions.The end of the book was such a tear jerker for me, and I can tell that Colleen truly put her whole heart into this book. This is one that I am going to think about for some time, and will recommend it to anyone who asks me for book suggestions.“Life is a funny thing. We only get so many years to live it, so we have to do everything we can to make sure those years are as full as they can be. We shouldn’t waste time on things that might happen someday, or maybe even never.” - It Ends With Us
title: 🌷4.5 STARS🌷

author: Amanda S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2020
review_content: This was unknowingly my 2nd Colleen Hoover book and once again, I was gutted. Crying in my bed at 10:30 at night.It is a story with a strong message of strength and courage. I couldn't put the book down. It was raw and honest and sad and painful. I was impressed by Lily's character and the choices she had to make. I wished it would have been different, you can't help but feel put in her place, feel her emotions, go over the same questions she asks herself and figuring out what is right and wrong. She did the right thing and even with it being the right thing, it entirely broke my heart.I do however wish there was more to the epilogue - I wanted more! I think this book should definitely be shared with all women in your life.Would I read it again? I definitely would but I don't know if I could put my heart through that again.
title: A MUST READ!

author: JeninFlorida
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2021
review_content: I understand people don't want to give spoilers, but I think that it is important to know the book deals with domestic violence.  I was not expecting that, or prepared for it.  I don't think it's spoiling anything, because I'm not disclosing which characters are involved in it.But it is very triggering, I am a survivor and thought I was going to read a love story.  It has been 3 days since I put the book down, and I'm still high anxiety and stressed out.  It's hard to even write this, but it is important for customers to know so they can decide if they can expose themselves to it or not.The book is a great read, and the characters are very well developed.  I don't know if I would recommend to anyone else who has anxiety around domestic violence.
title: Great, but does need warning of triggering material

author: KC2
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2020
review_content: I like the main character and felt she was strong and introspective. I liked each of the characters, frankly, and could see good in all of them. I appreciated so much that Lily put her daughter first at the end of the book and I was excited to see it end at that. She has a newborn baby and I was excited to see her just focus on the child. Unfortunately, right when it seems as though she will put her child first, she decides to start a new relationship.  I felt like that took away from Lily's persona as the strong independent woman who puts her kids first. I also think that because she immediately vegan a relationship with the "other" guy after leaving her husband, she made herself appear more culpable for the problems than she would have otherwise.  Perhaps that's the point of the book, that there is gray area.  Either way, the ending ruined the book for me.
title: Missed the mark

author: Berry Nice
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: NAKED TRUTH: FLOVED IT!There are no words that will do this book justice if I tried to express what I feel about it. Everything that it made me feel.Everyone NEEDS to read this!The story of these characters is soo deep, heartfelt, truthful, sad, wonderful and raw.Of course the writing is phenomenal. My heart was full of love and it broke BUT it was put back together with admiration for the strength, boldness and courage that was Lily.If I highlight phrases that touched my heart and soul (gave me food for thought) I would end up coloring the entire book.I'm thankful to Colleen for sharing this story with us☆“Just because someone hurts you doesn't mean you can simply stop loving them. It's not a person's actions that hurt the most. It's the love. If there was no love attached to the action, the pain would be a little easier to bear.”♡"It stops here. With me and you. It Ends With Us"~ ~ "In the future...if by some miracle you ever find yourself in the position to fall in love again...fall in love with me."
title: Life Changing. Everyone should read this one!!!

author: NT Too
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2017
review_content: I really enjoyed reading this novel.  It was heartfelt.  It was funny and sad.  Lily was smart, funny, and strong.  I like that Lily was very in touch with herself.  I loved that she loved Atlas.  I loved the way she was able to be transparent and not so judgemental. I felt that it was important for her to experience some things in the way her mother has, because it helped her in the long run to understand her mother.I was disappointed with the outcome of the story, but I believe it was necessary and realistic. I wanted to see Ryle change.  I was rooting for Lily and Ryle and thought the title was about them making amends.  I was hoping it was about them solving their problems together and not apart. Having experienced my own parents going through domestic violence as a kid, I only ever wanted them to work it out.  They would break up and make up and as painful as it was to see my dad pack up and leave time and time again, one day I think we all had enough of the violence.  This day, my mother never remarried.  My dad did.  I have always looked at my mother as a strong, resilient woman.Having said all of that this was an excellent read and I could not put this book down.
title: Excellent

author: Holly Hall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2016
review_content: Naked Truth #1:It only took me 5 hours to read this book. I sat down with it and couldn't make myself stop until I had gotten to the end.Naked Truth #2:This book destroyed me emotionally, and it was worth every moment.Oh, Colleen Hoover. I don't know how you do it, but you do, and you do it so well.I'm going to keep this review short because I agree with all the advice floating around the internet about this book: go into it blind. It's best if you don't know much about what it's going to be, so that you can fully experience what this story has to offer.What I will say, is that this book really gripped me in ways that I didn't think it would.I'll be honest and say that when I first started it, I wasn't quite sure I was going to like it. Let's just say the main male character, Ryle, is quite blunt, and straightforward and I wasn't sure where exactly this book was going to end up because of that. But as it progressed, I began to understand that this wasn't the story I thought it was going to be. It was so much more than that.This story is important, for reasons that I think will become very clear once you read this book. I've seen and read all sorts of stories of how this has impacted other readers, and I'm so glad. It's a story that's hard to read sometimes, but it's important that we do, so that we can understand.When you get to the finish, you'll have a brand new appreciation of the title. I know I do.Also, be sure not to skip ahead and read any of the author note beforehand. But once you do finish the book, please read the author's note. That put so much into perspective for me and it's powerful.I don't think you'll regret reading this book.I know I don't.And oh, Naked Truth #3:I want to be like Colleen Hoover when I grow up.
title: Beautiful Book

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2020
review_content: This is a terrible book! It is cliche that is makes my teeth hurt. I guessed the ending of this book by the first couple of chapters. The characters are shallow at best. All the cliches are present. The girl who is so beautiful but of course she doesn’t know it. She’s so beautiful, in fact, that of course there’s two men who just absolutely cannot live without her. The handsome playboy who of course could only fall for her. The boyfriends sister/her best friend who always sides with her over her brother (even though she knows everything that’s going on and continues to have a relationship with her brother). The ditsy friend who’s only around for comic relief. The dialogue between characters is childish not believable in any way.
title: Terrible

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: First off, let me start off by saying that I have never reviewed a book before.However, I just finished reading this book for the first time, and within the first minute I was ready to flip back to the first page and start again. There will be MANY more reads of this book in the future.***I'm a Colleen Hoover fan girl. I read Slammed around this time last year, and have spent the last 12 months reading everything she's written right down to every blog post, and book review of hers that I can find.***Being the fan that I am, I have been anxiously awaiting this book - following social media, blogs, reviews, and early giveaways. There was nothing that could have prepared me for THIS BOOK.It didn't send me on the emotional roller coaster that some of her past books did. I didn't feel like I had been hit by a train multiple times and then was carefully put back together like her writing usually makes me feel.No, THIS BOOK. heightened my every sense, and gently touched all of my emotions without actually breaking me. This book threw me into a real scenario where I was forced to truly think about everything that I would or could possibly do in the situation the characters were in. It forced me to re-think my own way of thinking, and encouraged me to appreciate the life that I have just a little bit more. I've said that Colleen's writing improves with every new book, and after finishing It Ends With Us today, I have no doubt that she did it again. This is currently my very favorite book, and I just feel the need to keep staring at my copy.It Ends With Us exceeded all expectations. I would encourage any and every woman to read this book. I would encourage any and every book lover to read this book. There really aren't words for how amazing and well written of a story that it is.
title: I didn't feel like I had been hit by a train multiple times ...

author: Danielle Taylor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2017
review_content: I wanted to love this book as much as everyone else.  It's a topic that is very emotional and definitly needs more awareness.  It was well written but it just wasn't for me.  My problem with this book was that while Lily was a very sweet and wonderful character I didn't connect that much with her.  On top of that Atlas just wasn't in the book enough for me to feel the big connection between the two of them and the ending between them was rather abrupt.  Personally I just don't like reading a book that has me feeling sad through most of it without a huge payoff in the end.  There wasn't enough Atlas in the book for me to get that huge payoff.  I did love the hospital scene between Lily and Ryle.  I can see why so many people love this book it just wasn't really for me.
title: Well written just not for me

author: Amber Carda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021
review_content: This was my first Colleen Hoover book.  I had seen someone post about her writing on FB and after reading the reviews on Amazon, I decided to give it a try.  First, let me say that this book keeps you thinking, even after you put it down.  You'll find yourself going on a similar emotional journey with the main character and the book.  This leaves you to desire more until you can't put the book down.  I only gave it a 4 star, instead of 5 because I feel like the Colleen Hoover did an amazing job detailing every point of the story to the point you felt you were there watching it...but the ending felt rushed.  I feel like Colleen Hoover could have gotten away with that approach if there was a sequel.  While the ending was appropriate--I was left wanting more about detail about where that road went as it pertains to the two main male characters.  So much room for a sequel!!!
title: 5 stars if better ending

author: Jordan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2018
review_content: First off... WOW! I am part of a book club and we wanted to pick a love story to honor Valentine's Day, and boy did we ever! I'll admit, I have read a lot of romance novels, but this was the most realistic (in a sense) story I have ever read. This is the first book of Colleen Hoover's that I've read. The complexity of the two romances in one really kept me hanging on the edge of my seat. I really didn't know what to think. I didn't know who I wanted her to choose. I honestly felt as though I could feel how Lily was feeling through Colleen's writing. It was "magical" (cheesy I know). And Lily was such a dynamic character that I can truly say I never under appreciated. Most romantic novels lead to find things about the leading lady that are irritating, and at times ruin the rest of the book for me. Not the case here. I wanted to just keep reading the book when it was over. I needed more. So much so, that as soon I finished this book, I bought and stayed up reading until 4 a.m. one of  Colleen Hoover's other books "Maybe Someday". I read the entire thing in one sitting. I couldn't put it down either. However, that's a review for another day. Truly, do yourself a favor and read this book.
title: Wow! My heart is cheering and breaking all at the same time.

author: Allie Blea
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2016
review_content: SpoilersI found myself constantly torn between being angry with Lily for forgiving him and also for getting angry with him. I sat there reading and thinking to myself "if you hadn't done that, you wouldn't have set him off". But then I would turn around and be frustrated with her for not being a strong woman and saying enough is enough and leaving.I was 8 when my mom left my dad, the youngest of 3 kids. My brother and sister had seen a lot more and a lot worse than I ever did (at least as far as I can remember). My dad wasn't so much physically abusive as he was verbally, but I remember times when he would get up so close to my moms face screaming in it that he may as well have hit her. My brother is 6 years older than me and my sister 10 years older. My parents had been married 23 years before my mom mustered up enough money and courage to leave my dad and her kids behind. My brother has struggled with anger as long as I've been alive. I've seen the terror in my mom's eyes when my brother pulled her around our living room by her hair when he was just a teenager. Broken drywall and interior doors that had my brothers fist or head plunged through. Trying to help him cover up a hole in our living room before my dad got home so he wouldn't be kicked out again. Things a young girl shouldn't be subjected to. When I was 12 I dated a boy that was not good to me. He forced me into sex, belittled and bullied me. It was nice to have the attention from someone, especially a boy. He was a couple of years older than I was, there were times he'd hit me and even put his hands around my throat. But I was just happy to get the attention, even though it was negative. I didn't tell anyone about it until I was in my twenties. I was ashamed, I felt stupid for acting like my mom, I was incredibly embarrassed for allowing someone to treat me like that. I met my husband the following year, he's sweet and would never hurt me. We've been together for nearly 19 years and married for 11. You can break the cycle as long as you realize that it isn't your fault.I sat here reading your story and found myself struggling to sympathize with both sides. But I guess that's the point. Our society blames the victim instead of the persecutor. I enjoyed and appreciated this book. I was afraid to read it because I worried that it would hit too close to home, and it did. I'm very happy that Lily broke the cycle for her daughter. I hope this story will help those out there struggling in similar circumstances.I just want to tell you from the bottom of my heart Colleen, thank you to you and your wonderful mom. I'm so happy that she was able to get out of that horrible relationship.
title: Heartbreaking and Eye Opening

author: C. Evans
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020
review_content: My first exposure to a Colleen Hoover book was Verity. That books was full of suspense, twists and turns. This book was indeed slower paced and more predictable. It started off with a strong premise. Then slowly veered off track. I believe because this book was written off of her personal experiences it meant a lot to her and the subject of spousal abuse.I hope this book helps to heal those who have been affected or experienced domestic violence. God Bless all survivors of domestic violence.
title: Domestic Violence bought to the light

author: DevonS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2019
review_content: I very rarely have time to read these days, being a mother and working 50 plus hours a week and all. I stumbled across this while on Amazon a few days ago and started reading it around 7 pm. Before I knew it the clock read 1am and I could not put it down but had to wake up early for work. The next night I stayed up until I finished it because it was THAT GOOD. It had me hooked from the beginning and took me on an emotional roller coaster I’m sure many of the other readers have been on. It wasn’t the happy romance book I had heard Colleen Hoover often writes but a book with a strong and powerful message. Being a girl who dealt with the same type of trama growing up it really hit home. But I too ended the cycle and found my happy ending just like this book.
title: The Best I’ve Read In A Long Time

author: Alba BookPics
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2016
review_content: [... He is. He asked for you. And I know you're with my brother and I'm with child, but can we please just take a moment to silently admire the perfection that is that man?]I've read a lot of books in my lifetime.Some were so bad for me I wish I'd had a lighter right there to erase all traces of it from my shelves. Others were so good I constantly struggled with my selfishness to keep the story all to myself and not let anyone read it while at the same time wanting to have tons of people to discuss said good book with.Then came the gems. The epic books. The books that changed something in me every time I turned that last page and sigh a little contented sigh of happiness or sorrow or sadness or any feeling that happened to be evoked by the ending of the book.Then came the 3 books that somehow saved me from myself. Books that I will never be able to read ever again but that are constantly in my mind, no need to read them again. They are forever imprinted on my very soul.I found one of those books thanks to Colleen Hoover.She recommended me Taryn's books (I say recommended ME  loosely because she usually just promotes Taryn's books on her social media and I just happened to be on Instagram at the perfect time.)But then.There are these books.Books that don't fit in any other category you might shelf your books in.Books that surprise you because you know what you're getting yourself into. Or at least you think you know.But later you think, What in the beautiful flowers in my garden did I just sign up for?"Almost every Colleen Hoover book I've read has been like this.Surprising. Inspiring. Sometimes I can predict the outcome. Sometimes I can't. But I always love the story all the same.It Ends With Us is a great book. I loved it and I kind of hated it.Because, beware... honest truth coming.I've been that 'girl' that 'woman' that person that even though has gone through psychological abuse was quick to start saying... "why doesn't she leave him?" When I'd hear of women suffering physical abuse. I'd say "I would've done that ages ago... Why why why... or I would've I would've I would've..."I hated it because I discovered something I pretty much hate about myself (not that I need to add more to the list lol) I hated how quick I came to conclusions about people's life choices when mine aren't perfect nor easy.I know not every case is the same. Ever.But this book made me pause.Made me think (which is always something I appreciate.)Made me take a knee ^_^ and breathe and say..."Stop. You are NOT them. You don't KNOW. And even if you think you know... just stop."So first I want to apologize for being that person but second I want to thank Colleen for writing this book.I can't even begin to imagine how this must've been for you.After reading the author's note at the end I felt like I had mostly read a journal entry rather than a fictional book.I felt so many things all at once.I felt sad for Ryle. I felt sad for Lily.I felt sad for Atlas.I felt sad for Emmy.["When's your next day off?" He says."Never. When's yours?""Never."I shake my head. "We're doomed..."]But then.I felt hope for all of them. I felt happy for all of them.I felt proud for freaking fictional characters.I was a mess one second and a completely normal person the next.If that doesn't mean this book was well written I don't know what does.I haven't written one of my long book reviews in over a year because life stinks. But then this book came and life didn't stink as much for the days it took to finish it.And now that I have read all of it I couldn't just come here and rate it and leave it at that.I wanted to share a little bit of what happened to me while I read this.So thank you for writing this book dear author.Thank you for not hitting that delete button. Thank you for seeing it through. And thank you for publishing it and making it available for us.I for one feel like a complete different person as to who I was when I started it.It wasn't everything I hoped for, it wasn't everything I expected, it wasn't at all what I thought it'd be.And I am completely thankful for that.It was so much more!Here's to naked truths, Ellen Degeneres, cycle breakers and the book title actually being a part of the story!Ps. Allysa fan for life. That girl is goals!! Everything goals!! And I need a sponge bob onesie T_T
title: It Ends With Them

author: Sara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2017
review_content: Colleen. Oh my god.I bought and read this book right when it came out. Yes. It has taken me a year to review it. What can I say? I'm bad at processing overwhelming feelings. Colleen Hoover shattered my heart and healed it and shattered it again with her gorgeous writing and storytelling.In truth, it's taken a year to digest it and want to read it again. Because this book killed me. I fell in love with the main character, Lily. And Ryle. And Atlas? Don't get me started... I read it and it hurt, and it made me think about things that I didn't want to think about but definitely needed to, and it made me feel things that I didn't really want to feel. The world isn't black and white. That much is clear. Somehow, Colleen found a way to turn words on a page into lovely, flawed, real humans unlike anyone has achieved before. It makes for a beautiful read.As an avid fan of CoHo, and having read all her work, I can tell you with 100% certainty that THIS is her best thing yet.PS. Ugly crying is totally allowed and expected with this book. It's okay. You're not alone.
title: A book in a class of its own

author: LOCKSIE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020
review_content: While growing up, incidents we see as children sometimes stay with us for the rest of our lives. Unfortunately, some things we witness have profound effects on us and we do one of two things, repeat or break the cycle.Lily, the character showcased in this emotional story is a hardworking young woman who knows what she wants out of life and how to get it. When she fall in love with the handsome Ryle, life is good until that life closely mirrors the one she thought she left behind.Totally enjoyed this read! Love how Lily’s mom shared her wisdom; it was needed to tighten their relationship.Recommended reading.
title: You can't help who you love.

author: Lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
review_content: Colleen Hoover has a talent for coming up with fantastic storylines with strong messages. But honestly, I struggle getting through her books. I often shelf them and revisit weeks/months/years later. Why? Her writing style. My writing teachers always stressed “show, don’t tell” and I feel Colleen Hoover’s approach is opposite and it makes the writing so choppy and falls flat. Her books would be so much more impactful if she would step away from telling us every last detail of the characters physical movements and repeatedly naming the emotion the character is experiencing. Idk. I just don’t connect with the characters because of this.
title: Writing Style...

author: SallyAnn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2017
review_content: There's a poignant message to this story and it's a very serious and topical issue. In this story the 'message' is wrapped up with other life drama; intertwining love stories, relationships, life and business successes -  and a good degree of warmth. There's some clever, quirky aspects to the book; I enjoyed the 'naked truths' as a communication tool between Lily and Ryle and I thought Lily's younger self, which is an important backdrop to the present day story, was successfully and cleverly told via a journal penned to talk-show host Ellen De Generes. I'm a bit doubtful as to the authenticity of the love between Lily and Ryle - it seemed more like never-ending lust to me, with minimal substance to their emotional connection. For me, that was a bit of a let-down as was the fluffy character of Alyssa and her uber-rich, uninteresting husband, Marshall.Perhaps my main question mark and the reason I did not rate this book more highly is that it is all a bit of a 'soap-opera' ... homeless boy (who creeps into teenage girl's bedroom at night) turns his life around, teenage girl ends up living in same city as previously homeless boy and then, in a city of squillions bumps into him ... and, so on.A more measured and considered dose of reality would have had me rating this book more highly.
title: A good read.

author: Abc123 Classrooms
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020
review_content: This was my first Colleen Hoover book and it will not be my  last for sure. This book had me so emotional at times, especially after reading the authors notes at the end. This was such a good read for me I did not want to put it down even when I knew I was reading it with a buddy read group. It was very powerful t0 read with the domestic violence in the storyline. She was really in depth of how she portrayed the characters and how bad violence can be in a normal setting household. This book is a great read the characters and the story is absolutely lovely. In the story she writes in her journal like she is writing to Ellen and the way she opens up in the journals and tells her feeling it adds a lot to the story. All I can say about this book is you need to pick it up now and read it. It is great. Now I will be reading all of her books.
title: This is a must read book

author: morgancombs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2017
review_content: trigger warning: this book deals pretty seriously with domestic violence.this. book. thiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiis book.i love, love, love this book.i was so excited when i was perusing the new books section at my local public library and came across a colleen hoover book. i think i was the first person to check it out and i think i maybe had it for a day before it was returned. and i haven't seen it on the shelves since. so yay for lots of people checking this book out.colleen hoover is a magician. i read somewhere that she writes her books in some ridiculously short amount of time. you cannot tell that these books didn't take months to develop and write. (hence the magician status) colleen is a gifted writer and if you haven't picked up any of her books yet - you should. and then you should be prepared to just order them all because you won't want to stop reading her books. but then you'll be sad when you realize you've read all of her books but don't worry. you can read them all again, or she may just have another one coming out soon - you never know.but seriously - this book.it ends with us was one powerful book. girl meets boy, boy is a grade A dream boy. you will fall in love with ryle right along with lily. you will root for this love story. lily and ryle will make your heart ache.so then the flashbacks to lily's not so easy teenage years start and you find yourself enamored with that story line as well. atlas is the boy we all wanted to fix when we were 16. that one that could steal your breath away but that had that tortured soul that just need to be taken care of and loved and protected.then the fairytale shatters and as a reader i was left with very conflicting feelings. i had fallen in love with these characters and their stories and it broke my heart when the violence started. now, to be clear, as far as portraying abuse in a book goes, colleen was absolutely masterful in her presentation of enough details to convey what was happening without resorting to gratuitous, over-the-top, shock value violence.this book broke my heart, made my stomach hurt, and made me cry a bit. but lily is not written as a victim as much as she is written as a survivor. lily is brave and smart and chooses to take a different path with her life than the path her life went down when she was a child.colleen has written a very honest, realistic book and i'm actually ready for a re-read as soon as i get my copy back! it ends with us is uncomfortable, poignant, and believable.another 5/5 from this girl. seriously. read this book.
title: heartbreaking and hopeful.

author: Janese
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2021
review_content: I honestly love this book to the point I can’t put it to words. Even though Ryle is set out sort of as a bad guy, there’s still an understanding of why he is the way he is, and that he isn’t that bad guy, he’s just one with mistakes. This book also has some really good messages that I would hold so close to my heart. Therefore I definitely recommend this book. But I will warn you that there’s abusive relationship(s) in this. Though the book fits into many great tropes like best friend’s brother, first lover to lover, and “I never liked anyone until you.” Though I did sort of struggle on imagining the characters because the features were only mentioned about once or twice in the book. So the character development sort of has to be worked on, but I understand throughout the book you learn more about the characters so I liked that.
title: I recommend this book.

author: Tiffany Copple
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2017
review_content: Ok so this is yet another book of Colleen's that I have waited a couple weeks after reading to review.  I think because not only was it an emotional story , I think it  touched me in away that no other book has. It blew me away and made me think about so many things in my life.Lily meets the homeless kid Atlas when she is just 15 . So many things happen to them . Atlas knows that Lily's dad abused her mom , that he has even hurt her a few times. Lily and Atlas fall in love but then Atlas finally had a family member willing to take him in. This changes things for them . Fast forward some years , Lily meets an amazing man named Ryle  , they become married but soon she realizes that Ryle might be a little bit to much like her father.  Things come to a head when Atlas arrives in the picture again.  Lily stays and puts herself in situations that she shouldn't . But what happens when you love some one too much , but you hurt them time and time again . This book delves into so many issues about abuse . Not just physical but mental and emotional also . Also it answers some questions about why women or men stay in abusive relationships. I cried so many years through out this book , I didn't think I had any left  to cry. While he's this book is a romance it is also so much more. Colleen has a way of telling you someone's story but making you feel like your a part of it . This book was simply profound
title: Profound

author: Karen Stinnett
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021
review_content: we fight for the ones we love. We suffice for the ones we love. This story will make you happy and sad  without turning the next page .The pages are filled with line by lines that keeps one turning the pages. The story captures your attention form beginning to end. I love all the characters. You dislike their choices at times. You celebrate the good times and hold your breathe because you know trouble waiting  around the bend.  I needed the sister to be more proactive about getting him her(brother) on medication. Didn't take me long to finish this book. There is abuse to be careful if this is a issue for you.
title: Is love enough?

author: Chelsea Richardson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2020
review_content: This will forever be a top read of mine. I agree with the review on the cover from Kami Garcia, "Every person with a heartbeat should read this book."I did not want to put this book down I had to know what was going to happen next & while the majority of the story is similar to that of Colleen's Mother and her real life story I loved the added aspect of Atlas. His relationship with Lily helped make the story the amazing one that it is.There is so much heartbreak & truth and I found myself crying happy tears by the end of the book.It is a must read for everyone!
title: A memorable story

author: Maria Nowlan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2016
review_content: Words. Words normally come out like natural fluid when my fingers reach a keyboard or a pencil with paper. They make sense. I have no words. Except to talk about the lack of words I have. Which is very unjust for an author such as Colleen Hoover. But she's the ONLY author who has ever silenced my opinionated self. She silences my conscious and even my subconscious... I can feel the gears wanting to move but they are frozen with emotional numbness.All of Colleen books are beyond amazing. They sink down into your soul and like magic you watch her world come alive in your mind and in the world around you. This book touched home for me and maybe that is why I'm speechless. Because I have tried to describe in a thousand ways, in a thousand words exactly what she described. She literally look all my emotions and anxiety crazy brain that I could never quite pin point and stuck them in front of me to where it FINALLY made sense, even to me. These characters grabbed my heart, ripped it out, stomped on it, put it through a shredder and then slowly made it whole again with hope, love, and gave me a little bit of faith.Normally I bawl my eyes out, throw the book across the room and curse at the ceiling at Colleen for giving me an emotional rollercoaster that I know will leave me a book hangover until the next month, all this and more has happened every time I read her books. This time I couldn't. I didn't shed a single tear because I didn't have time, I had to soak it all in. Now a day later after finishing, the realness, the rawness of it is sinking in and I'm going to probably me an emotional raging mess by the weekend. just read the damn book ok? I'm not an emotional person, I never leave reviews because I feel they don't matter but damn it THIS matters. Colleen Hoover's mind/heart/soul matters. Take care of that mind/heart/soul Colleen, if it ever becomes normal, my mind/heart/soul will surely haunt you.
title: Words normally come out like natural fluid when my fingers reach a keyboard or ...

author: Aubrey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2017
review_content: I. Was. Floored. *spoiler post because I feel it's necessary*There needs to be a bigger content warning. *physical abuse* - I was cringing but as someone who has never been in a situation like this, I did exactly what the author was writing about. I COULDNT understand.By the first incident, I literally had to close the book out and breathe a little. I DID NOT SEE IT COMING. I seriously thought that Ryle was her one. I thought it was who the book was about her being in love with the whole time. And while it is, in a sense, as a mother, the end of the book made so much sense. It gave me closure on this story. This is a story some people may not want to read, but then again, it's one everyone has to read. This is so much more than just a romance story, it's real life. It's heartbreaking and heart mending. Just wow.
title: Just wow. Content warning in this book ABUSE. but it's a must read

author: IV
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2016
review_content: I don't know what killed me more the book or Colleen's acknowledgements. This book was brutal yet so very poignant.  It touched some serious issues and I sometimes needed a minute to calm my heart. Breath in and out before reading the next paragraph. Yes, this book will hurt, this book will make you and cry and sad an defeated and yet so freaking hopeful that people can change. But how far would you go ? What would be your limit ? We may want to say that in the first act of disrespect or abuse, that we would be out of there. That's what we want to say. But in most cases, that is rarely what happens. Hope does that. Love does that. It makes you want to forgive. This book showed just that. Our willingness to want to forgive the unforgivable. It could happen to any one of us. Bravery comes in so many ways. Being ' Bold and Brave' isn't as easy as it seems, but Lord knows that should be the moto for every woman out there. BE BOLD! BE BRAVE!  Colleen once again wrote a tearjerker but also one of the most important books I've read in a longtime.
title: I wish I could give this book to every woman I know

author: Babydoll
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020
review_content: I first bought the book from Amazon directly, then had to return it because of the disgusting condition it came in. So I bought from a different seller and finished the book basically within a day. I LOVED the book so much, I didn’t want to put it down! I’m so bummed it’s already over. I’m so bummed their story is over. I enjoyed it so much & I absolutely recommend it! The ending is so bittersweet for me, which some may not agree with it. I also wanted more from the ending personally, which is a little silly to say because it still ended good. I just didn’t want the book to end in all reality. The author did a great job with this book. I will miss the characters and the story very much.
title: Don’t buy from amazon warehouse - AMAZING book though, I recommend!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
review_content: I had this book for about 48 hours before I got the courage to read it. And yes, the courage I gathered to read this book did me wonders. I used up a roll of tissues. I'm a mess at an ungodly hour. My eyes are puffy and my nose is sore. And I am eating chocolate at 6AM (because that's when I finished the book -- started it at 11PM) just to make myself feel better. Chocolate at 6AM people!I dove into the book not knowing anything. Not a synopsis, not a spoiler in sight. I got the book purely  because the author was Colleen freaking Hoover - and if you ever read one of her books, you won't ask her readers and followers why.But I will start my day doing some good and give you a bit of a spoiler: YOU WILL CRY!Naked truth? About a few chapters in, I stopped a bit for a break. It was a delicate situation I was reading - and I wanted to read a spoiler just to put my mind at ease. But guess what - I did not see any spoilers! I must have been searching or browsing at the wrong places, because I searched for about ten to fifteen minutes and couldn't find anything. So yeah, at that point I knew I was going to do it on my own.It Ends With Us. I was wondering what it could mean. A lot of plots can come from those four words. And it kept me wondering until the very last chapter. After that, it was like a 'eureka' moment. I did not expect that. Not at all. So if you have preconceived notions on what happens in this book - throw it away. It's better to just go in blind.I was going through the reviews and I found somethings unsettling. It surprises me that people put low ratings on the books that matter. Some will say that they read this book because of all the hype we generated and after reading it - they didn't understand it at all.The situations and characters here are realistic. If you are looking for dragons, faeries, nymphs, aliens, vampires, assassins and the like - you will not find it here. You simply have the wrong genre. (Don't bash, I'm not against those books with those themes at all, in fact I read them too. Just an example.) But if you are open-minded and can grasp what's going on in the world around you - you may like this book. In fact, you may even love it.Look at it this way - some people read fiction books with all the adventures and legendary creatures and they almost believe it. But they read about abuse, charity cases, love and not just fictional love, but 'real situations' kind of love, and anything basically about life and its struggles and they say it's not plausible. Those people are ridiculous.I want to put this out there. Because a book makes you cry does not mean it's already a five star read. I admit - I have encountered a lot of books which made me cry but were mediocre, to say the least. This book is not one of them. This book transcends those and more.Naked truths. I cried for this book because I can read about broken people trying and struggling in life. I cried for the children who are abandoned and homeless. The street children who turn their lives to crime because they had no choice. I cried for the lovers who were torn apart by situations they cannot control. I cried for the ones physically, mentally and emotionally abused. And I cried real hard for those who loves but doesn't deserve love.Honestly, Colleen Hoover's books should come with a warning label. Every book she had, it almost always made me cry. Except for those novellas, this woman knows where to hit you when you least expect it.One of the reasons I love reading Colleen Hoover books is that they are always filled with a powerful message. One you can relate and apply to in real life. There are a lot of lessons here that may guide you in life - you just have to dig really deep and find them.If you have read the book - I urge you to pass it on. The message in there may be 'that message' that someone you know might need at some point in their lives. If not, don't worry. You're sharing one hell of a book.
title: I will start my day doing some good and give you a bit of a spoiler: YOU WILL CRY!

author: Yiwen X.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2021
review_content: the first maybe 2/3 or 3/4 of this book bored me. I thought I was reading another 50 shades of grey type of romance book - a good-looking, rich smart neurosurgeon who is only into one night stand just happens to fall in love with this girl at the first sight then they started this very predictable fairy tale story.  When I almost wanted to give up on this book, finally the twist happened. In the end, I was very impressed by the heroine's courage and decisiveness. The last bit of the book has some really good writing and life lessons. I'm giving three stars just because I think a big part of this book is quite cliche. I donated it right after I finished it. Not really worth the time and money.
title: only good in the last 1/4

author: Lauren Miller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2016
review_content: This gut wrenching novel grabs you and doesn't let go.  Comic and tragic by turns, Colleen Hoover has crafted a novel that puts a spotlight on domestic abuse.Lily Bloom is fresh out of college when she meets a young doctor who is just finishing his residency. And even though there is an immediate attraction, they both go their own ways. He's not interested in a serious relationship, ever,  he insists and she's busy starting her own business.Eventually Ryle and Lily meet again, both having never forgotten each other. They fall in madly love and marry.But a young man from Lily's youth, her first love, enters the picture. Atlas was a homeless high school student. Lily helped him survive while at the same time doing her best to prevent her father from being abusive to her mother. Lily's father had been abusive to her mother for years. Atlas was her best friend and she leaned on him to help get her through the heartache of watching the continued abuse of her mother.Years later, Lily and Atlas reconnect as friends and nothing more, as they both have a profound and deep respect for the other. Lily is in love with her husband, she trusts him and respects him. The first time he strikes her, it's deemed a mistake, he didn't mean to and he's sorry. He loves her and does everything he can to make up for his actions. At first, Lily blames herself, just as her mother did.  But is she strong enough to stop it? Or will she endure it, making excuses, just as her mother did. When Ryle sees Lily and Atlas innocently talking it sets into motion a series of events that will shatter their marriage.Domestic abuse is insidious, the abuser often excuses his actions by shifting the blame to his wife, or girlfriend. This enthralling novel explores how the abuser and his victim unwittingly conspire though co-dependency, and how the abuse can dangerously escalate.I highly recommend this exceptionally well written novel. I  couldn't put it down.
title: Heartwrenching and Well Written

author: Lea Olivari
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2016
review_content: I need a tissue.Colleen Hoover, once again, take a bow!I was unable to put this book down from the moment I started reading. I found it on my Kindle this morning and spent whole day reading.This will not be a typical review and it will be completely spoiler free, because I do not want to give anything away. Trust me, you have to dive in immediately.Oh Colleen, I see what you did there... man... I am sitting here, staring through my window like an idiot for the past thirty minutes, thinking what to write about this book. I feel completely inadequate to write anything remotely resembling a review. My brain has turned to mush.I was thinking I should just leave my desk and write a few words some other day... but now that I composed myself, I feel like I can finally say something.How to describe my feelings?How to put these emotions into words?I could just narrow it down to maybe one - AWESOME!No that's not good enough. This novel is complex and heart wrenching.This is by far one of the best Colleen's works. I say that each time, but this one is GOOD.No, not good, it is FANTASTIC.I mean, come on, we all know Colleen is a freaking master of her craft. I am jealous how talented she is. I doesn't get better than this. Her books are always unique and refreshing, not like anything I've ever read before.This book broke me. Literally. I didn't see it coming. I couldn't prepare myself for it. It was like a crushing wave. I cried. Yep, I did, I am not ashamed to admit it.This story will stay with me for a long time. It really got me thinking about many things.About the choices we make, whether they are right or wrong, and life paths we choose.But, let me tell you.. it s inspiring and hopeful. It celebrates life and second chances and everyone should read it.This is one of the most powerful and meaningful books of 2016.
title: Amazing!

author: Courtney~MustReadBooksOrDie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2017
review_content: Shel: I fell in love. I fell in love with this book and so when it broke my heart it really BROKE MY HEART and then as I began to feel like I could piece it back together, it broke my heart again. And yet. And yet, I kept going back for more because this book was so well written and so compelling that I was willing to feel all of the emotions to see how Lily's story would end and the ending did not disappoint at all. Court: The term all-the-feels definitely might be over used, but I can't think of a better way to describe what this book did to my emotions than that. And I don't care if it is a cliche response...because it did. I felt every gamut of emotions exactly as Colleen meant for us too. Because this book is complicated...just like real dang life, and sometimes it sucks, and sometimes it's beautiful even when it sucks. So...IEWU is exactly like that. And it was beautiful, but heartbreaking and hopeful all at the same time and I am so glad I read it...and I am so glad Colleen Hoover exists and writes things that are not cliche and uncomplicated so I can use cliche blogger expressions since I don't want to spoil the book! *whew*Shel: And that's all I feel like I can really say because I 1 million percent think that going into this novel blind and without spoilers is exactly the best way to read it. I'll be recommending this It Ends With Us to anyone who will listen to me--it's that special---to paraphrase a friend: every woman should read this novel and they should share it with their friends and daughters. Court: Yep. Just...wow. There is so many things going on in my mind right now, so I probably should've waited a little while to review it - but I just couldn't. This book just is...it is amazing, and as I said complicated and beautiful. It is harshly real, but realistic in that nothing is ever as it seems on the surface. I want to read it again. And will the characters to do what I wanted them too. Darn it, y'all. Just darn it.Shel: I'll end with this--thank god for the Lily's of the world; her strength and kindness was inspiring. Court: And Allyssa...she's somewhat of a dark horse that I didn't expect, as was Lily's mother. I want to be Colleen when I grow up, though.
title: A beautiful book

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2020
review_content: As a survivor of domestic violence, this book is absolutely beautiful. Without spoiling it too much, The way Colleen describes each and every scene, emotion, and feeling of Lily hit so close to home for me. If only every person in the world could read the beautiful words written to describe the reality of these types of relationships and the emotions and thoughts that contribute to each persons choices. Absolutely one of my favorite books ever, when my two year daughter is old enough I will remember this book and give her it to read for herself before she ends up in a situation like I did.
title: Beautifully written and eye opening for so many people

author: Stephanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2019
review_content: This is the 2nd book of Colleens that I have read. I thought when I bought it that the price was high and I usually do not buy books that cost that much unless it Paperback form. But I have been hearing so much about It Ends With Us that I had to get it. Well the price was well worth it. I loved this story. The writting and the characters were fantastic! All that Lily went through from her childhood into her adulthood.  I was so rooting for her and Ryle until he started hurting her. Then I got pissed! I am very happy with the ending and that she found her first Love Atlas again. Will there be another book to let us know what happens with her and Atlas? I would love to read about their happy ending. I mean we basically know they end up together. To all you women out there that are going through domestic abuse: Keep swimming!
title: Wow

author: Yummymummy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2018
review_content: So Colleen Hoover always gives me all the feels. I usually fall in love, laugh out loud, and cry reading her books. It Ends With Us though, man. It was so good! I fell in love and was completely gutted by these characters, often at the same time! I never read what her books are about before I read one because I trust her enough as an author to not write crap, so I didn't know what the story was about. Because of that, I do feel like I should say this book may contain triggers for domestic abuse &/or SA victims.
title: Woah even for Colleen

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2016
review_content: Wow. Just wow. I am not sure how to put what I thought about this book into words. I have read A LOT in my 29 (+ a few) years and this book has been an experience. This is a story everyone has to read because it will make you think about the choices you make in life and how those choices affect others. On one of the last pages Colleen writes that this book was not entertainment for her and she explains how she has shared something deeply personal, this is what makes Colleen one of the greatest writers of this generation. She doesn't shove it down your throat but creates a narrative that seems simple but along the way it becomes complicated.  This  is what makes this novel have such a powerful impact because its real, its raw and it happens. I have run out words to write about It Ends with Us but do yourself a favor and read it. It will stay with you for a very long time and I hope it changes peoples lives for the better because we only have one life with very few years in it.
title: Completely and Utterly Mesmerized

author: Ineffable Book Blog
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: 5 Fantastic Awe-Inspiring Amazing StarsThis book...I mean, what else could I expect from Colleen freakin' Hoover, master of words and creator of characters you basically wish were real so you could meet them, hug them, and then become best friends with them.I had no idea what to expect from this novel because the blurb was pretty vague.
