Yet you actually don't want to know anything else before going into this book because every word was a surprise gift that just kept giving. I loved not knowing everything about the book and characters and being able to guess where the book is headed. I actually don't see this suspenseful element in a lot of books, especially romance novels (they seem to always give away the plot).So going into this book with no idea what the character will do or where the plot is headed, I have to say that I LOVE THIS BOOK! There was literally every element of a romance novel carefully balanced into one amazing novel everyone should read.I loved the characters so, so much! They were strong, passionate, and yet so perfectly-humanly flawed that you can't help but get caught up in their emotions. Each character was distinctly different yet all together they equated to a group of individuals you want to root and cheer for throughout their battles with life. I literally fell in love with all of the characters within the novel and really hope to see more from them!!!I don't want to ruin this book for those who have read it, but I just have to say that I literally never expected anything that happened in this book. There were facets to this book that definitely hit on some sensitive topics and yet these topics become more approachable and yet at the same time a light is shined on ugly truths people often forget. I'm not going to lie, there were parts of this book that were hard to read and even understand yet had me in tears as I too struggled with the decisions characters in the novel had to make.Everything about this book was just pure beauty! Beautiful characters, beautiful words, and an even more beautiful plot that will drag you in and tear you apart in the most amazing way. This is definitely a book I would recommend to any reader!!!
title: Best Read This Year!

author: Teddie S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2017
review_content: ★★★★  from Kindle CustomerLily Bloom has just returned from her father's memorial service after delivering a disastrous eulogy. She's wondering if her mother will ever speak to her again. Lily was supposed to share all the good things about her dad. But when she got up to speak, she couldn't think of a single thing to say. So she walked back to her seat and sat down. Lily grew up watching her father abuse her mother. She had nothing good to say about him.Lily has a hard time understanding why her mother had stayed in an abusive marriage. But then Lily meets a guy named Ryle who's super good looking. And he's a doctor. And they end up having great sex (which we're made privy to in great detail). And then this Mr. Wonderful loses his temper....While reading the book, I went back and forth between liking Lily a lot, and being totally exasperated with her; between feeling somewhat sympathetic toward Ryle, and hating him. There were times I didn't like where the writer was going, but I was glad it ended in a satisfying way.I do have some complaints with the book. I thought the "naked truth" concept was just plain rude. I would not be flattered if, within ten minutes of meeting a man, he said he wanted to "****". Also, I didn't find the explicit sex necessary. And I was annoyed with the number of times Lily mentioned how great looking Ryle was. Enough already.I'm rating this book 3.5 stars, rounded up to 4.0 because of the Author's Notes at the end of the book
title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde

author: Rebecca Crull
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2016
review_content: There is nothing this women writes that I don't like! This was such a powerful book with amazing characters. I have been surprised how this story has stuck with me the last couple of days since I finished it. It is such a profound statement, how one moment (or 15 seconds) can change everything. If it wasn't for those few short moments (in the course of a lifetime), everything would be different. I love this story even more because of its roots being so personal to the author.Even with all that being said, I did have a couple of issues with the book. For one, as much as I loved Atlas, he kind of felt like a disposable/editable character. He was her out at the end and the catalyst for Ryle's downfall, but other than that, he could have easily been replaced. Also, it felt like Ryle was too perfect and changed his mind about relationships too easily. Still, I do love/respected the way Ryle was written at the end. It was so painful to watch/read how he completely screwed up everything and then had to except it and live his life with the knowledge of what could have been.Now, Colleen....you HAVE to write a sequel to this book! It would be a complete injustice if the story ends right there.
title: Perfect title to a powerful book!

author: Jo Fergus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2016
review_content: The day my mother married my father she was was 17 years old and pregnant. She had only known him for a few months and when she realised she was pregnant, a wedding was organised. When her parents pulled the car up outside the church, they turned to her and said ‘are you sure, you don’t have to do this, if you don’t want to marry him we can take you home now.’ Fifteen seconds can change everything. It took 13 years of marriage to him and the birth of three children before she had finally had enough. #NakedTruthIt is very easy to have an outsiders perspective on other people’s lives. A lot of us have said things like ‘if that was me I would have done this,’ ‘when I have children they will not be behaving like that,’ ‘if my husband cheated on me he will be out on his arse.’ I believe that you have no idea what you would do in any scenario/situation unless you are actually going through it yourself. An outside prespective is a lot like hindsight.The learnings I took from my parent’s marriage were not obvious to me until I had my first boyfriend – at the age of 13. He was my first love and we were together for 9 months. I had a lot of freedom as a teenager which was not necessarily a good thing. My mother had four part time jobs to make ends meet and was enjoying the company of men for the first time in her life. The lack of supervision for me and my siblings meant that we experienced things a lot earlier than our peers. When my boyfriend started behaving in a way that reminded me of my father I decided to end it. I have no idea how I figured out what my future with him could have been like if we continued to be together. Somehow I must have known.Like Lily in this story I would find it incredibly hard to do a eulogy for my father, in fact I just wouldn’t. I have a relationship with him because he is my father and my children’s grandfather but there will be no tears shed in grief when he passes over one day. Maybe tears for the relationship we could have had. Maybe tears for the moments in my life he has chosen to not be a part of – like my wedding day. #NakedTruthThis was a heart wrenching story. Like Lily I felt torn with indecision on her behalf but I also felt so proud of her. And in the end immense sadness too. The epilogue was bittersweet and was the perfect balm for my burning chest.A fabulous read from Colleen Hoover who never fails to give everything she has to every book she writes. This was a very personal story for her and I appreciate all the #NakedTruths she shared with us and how difficult that must have been for not just her but her wider family too.
title: A story full of Naked Truths

author: a unicorn love blog
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: Damn CoHo, back at it again with those devastating books.Colleen blew me away. She slayed. Freaking. Slayed. Me.It Ends With Us is her most thought-provoking book that was unexpected and moving. The struggles and the hope warred inside this book and resulted in a beautiful story that needed to be told so we can see that not everything is black and white. There are shades of gray in each abusive cycle. I needed to read that because I walked away with a better understanding of those beautifully, strong women who slay every single day.You the real MVP.You.I went into this book blind and that, honestly, is the best way to go. Please, do me a favor, and dive into this book blind. You won't regret it. The story will be more epic that way and the progression of this unexpected book will be gut-wrenching when reading it for the first time because you will be truly living it  without any preconceived notion. I want you to read it and say O.M.G when you get to the crux. You’ll realize you are in this story with Lily, cheering and rooting for her.Probably the best book of 2016 and definitely on my top ten book of all time. All. Time. It was an emotionally raw, empowering, and pure heart. My heart hurt after reading this book because it was just that good. I knew Colleen would tie up my heart in strings because she has done that with every, unique stories she has written. It Ends With Us took my heart strings and destroyed it seven ways from Sundays, with its beautifully epic and destroying words and Lily. Lily. Lily.She was an amazing, strong, heroic character and I want to be her when I grow up. To be her and have the courage to make a choice in the most difficult of times is worthy for one of Ellen’s infamous monologues. She was a superhero and everything in between. She loved so deeply and beautifully that it was painful to watch her love and the choices she had to make. Her inner monologue and reasoning was so on point and beautiful that it was devastating.Lily is in every single one of us. Her strength, courage, doubts, and vulnerability makes us all of us. It what you do in those hardest and painful times that shapes you and makes you believe in what you can do with the strength you possess in those fifteen minutes. You’re worthy. You’re a freaking heroine. Even amidst the doubts warring inside of us."That’s what fifteen minutes can do to a person. It can destroy them.It can save them."When the title of the book came into play. It broke me and pieced me back together. It was a such a deeply moving, heart wrenching scene, and I shattered.The book was a book about resilience and strength possessed in the darkest of times.Everyone should read the book. EVERYONE. I’m a heartless and cynical b and this book moved me.  Trust Colleen, cause she will take you on for the most gritting, emotional ride of your life.5 stars for a poignant, brave, hopeful unicorn love.
title: 5 stars for a poignant, brave, hopeful unicorn love.

author: bittersweetreads
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2016
review_content: A lot of people ask me why I’m so infatuated with books, particularly Romance. I would tentatively answer, because I love the fantasy it creates in my head. More often than not, I witness a world that is different from my own. But the most memorable kinds are those that I EXPERIENCE.Within a span of seven hours I became Lily Bloom. I felt every beautiful, every tragic, every nostalgic moment she went through. Colleen Hoover toyed with my emotions. There was even an instance that I was inches away from heaving. Even my body refused to accept the events unfolding in my second life. I waited for a few days from release of this book before I started it, because I wanted to clear my head from any presumptions. And even if I'd say the wait was worth it, I still didn't escape Hoover’s propensity for breaking hearts. As I moved along, I had to stop and ask myself, am I that weak? Is it even remotely right to feel this way? Colleen made me question my beliefs and my own level of resoluteness.Honestly, I'm not even certain if I want to experience it all over again. But there's a pressing need that's pushing me to re-read and dissect the characters. They are multi-faceted and they have very distinct voices and flaws. The twists are just icings on the cake. The real deal are the characters, most especially Lily Bloom. She's a strong, authentic, and compelling protagonist. Ryle will blind you while Atlas will puzzle you. But again ultimately, It Ends With Us is all about Lily Bloom. This is her flight!The irony of it all is that even though my heart was not fully mended after finishing, it still felt like I'm closing a chapter in my life. It is a given that every romance should draw that element of fantasy, but I realized that I will always yearn for the REALITY that comes to fruition as a story unfolds. The TRUTH that pulls me and is more captivating than the butterflies and feels. And largely, the powerful message that augments my understanding of things I don't normally experience. It Ends With Us was thought provoking and honest. This book delivered all these cravings and took me to a more profound level of reading!I am now one proud Romance fanatic because of Colleen Hoover and her beautiful stories.Be a part of this life altering experience, read It Ends With Us!
title: The most memorable kinds are those that I EXPERIENCE

author: Birty53
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2019
review_content: Spoilers in this review.Warning: physical abuse and spousal almost rape are covered in this story. Very vivid situational descriptions.This book is not about the real romance of the story but about the journey Lily must travel to find her true love. It’s also about spousal abuse and the consequences of being raised in a home like that and then finding yourself living the abuse yourself in your marriage. But, more important, Lily, the female lead, is a strong character, being honest with herself and what is happening in her life and how she plans to move forward. It’s a life journey for her and a sad but beautiful tale.
title: Heartache or Romance?

author: Terri Stewart
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
review_content: WOW!  I read Verity first and loved that book. I knew it was a different style of writing for the author and I devoured it. I don't normally read the romance type of books but she was so good I wanted to give it a chance. The one I chose was It Ends with Us. Based on true events and people. This book was so good that when I was at the 87% mark I had to close it and try to get some sleep. I could NOT sleep at all just thinking about it. Normally that will happen to me after I finish a book so I hurry up and start another. That says so much about how much I was invested in this book. Finished in 3 days and that while working full time.  It touches (a lot) on domestic abuse and relationships. A roller coaster of emotion but so worth it.
title: You HAVE to read this book!

author: Candy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2016
review_content: Lily Bloom has come a long way from her small hometown in Maine and a childhood that was far from perfect. She’s determined to succeed and is doing just that with her own flower shop in the big city of Boston. One fateful night, Lily meets Ryle Kincaid. Ryle is smart, funny, good looking, and a talented neurosurgeon.  Lily rocks Ryle’s world and he will do anything to make her happy. Ryle also has a dark side: an uncontrollable violent temper. Fortunately he doesn’t loose his temper that often or so Lily tells herself. When her childhood sweetheart reappears in her life and turns her world upside down, Lily must make an excruciating decision about her future.I love Colleen Hoover. I have said it in other reviews of her works, but she could write a 300 page book about paint drying and it would be epic. With that said, It Ends With Us is Hoover’s best work to date. I am still reeling from this book weeks after I finished it.Hoover has a wonderful talent for making you empathize with her worst characters. I really wanted to hate Ryle and by all means he deserves every bit of hatred I can muster. Except I was right there with Lily, struggling and making excuses for his unacceptable behavior.If the world had more people like Lily in it, I think we would live in a much better place. When Lily was a teenager, while all the other kids made fun of Atlas Corrigan, who wore old clothes and smelled funny, Lily decided to become his friend. When she realized he was homeless, Lily made sure he had food, clothes, and even a place to shower. She didn’t do it for accolades but because she couldn’t stand to see someone suffer.It Ends With Us is Hoover’s darkest work yet. It deals with a very difficult subject matter that could be a trigger for some people. With her usual writing skills, Hoover creates a harrowing story of love and heartache that will leave you crying and cheering for Lily. Anyone who loves an excellent work of fiction with unforgettable characters and story should read this book.
title: Hoover’s Best work to date!

author: Crissy M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2016
review_content: I decided to read It Ends With Us while in my cruise. Let's face it, what was going to interrupt me? Dinner?Actually, I read most of the book in a day, then had to stop for dinner and a show. So here I was awake and reading all day while my travel companions napped. Then when I went to see Rock of Ages I took a nap... seriously, a book kept me wide awake all day, but a play with loud 80s music put me to sleep! In fairness, I love Rock of Ages but I have seen the show twice. But still...It ends With Us is everything I love about Colleen's writing. There are amazing characters, heartbreakingly amazing characters. Characters that we love even when they are doing dumb things, because they are human like you and I, then she weaves them together in unexpected ways.It Ends With Us is a specific story about the human spirit. It touches each of us because we've all been in Lily's shoes, whether her smart shoes or her not so smart shoes. We've all been the victim or the judge at some point.The balance that Colleen put into these characters is truly amazing. I often love characters that I know I shouldn't love, it's the fun of reading fiction. But Colleen actually brings this to a new level, when through Lily we get the chance to question ourselves and what would we do. And not just once, but throughout the whole story.In the end we get resilient characters, ones that I know will be ok in the long run, once they sort out their shit, because they're not bad people. They're good people who do bad things.
title: I love Rock of Ages but I have seen the show ...

author: mrs_goatman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2016
review_content: As I've come to expect with Colleen Hoover's books, the writing was flawless and pulled a lot of emotions out of me.  We meet Lily when she's 15, living at home, and struggling to deal with her dad's abuse against her mother.  Lily feels powerless to stop it and turns inward to her oh-so-fun journal entries to Ellen DeGeneres.  I absolutely loved these!  It expressed so much of Lily's inner thoughts, both in a humorous and emotional way.  She befriends Atlas, the 18-year old who's squatting in the abandoned house behind hers.  It was endearing to see Lily want to take care of Atlas, and the budding friendship between them.  My only complaint is that I needed more... more time for Lily and Atlas to be together, more deep feelings to emerge.  We fast forward 8 years... Lily starts a new relationship with Ryle.  He was a hard nut to crack for me, especially after I was so Team Atlas.  But Ryle was brutally honest, smart, driven, and I oh-so-loved "naked truths."  If only we all did that.  I really wasn't expecting the rift to occur between Lily and Ryle and couldn't figure out how Atlas was going to play a role in Lily's present, although her past always seems to linger.  I adored Allysa, who made such a wonderfully fun and warm supporting character.  Did I love the ending?  Not so much... again I needed more.  But this book constantly pulled at my emotions, and pulled me in so many different directions.  It also had me trying to put myself in Lily's shoes. Was she making the right decisions?  Could I have made those decisions?  That's what makes a great book, in my opinion.
title: Powerful, beautiful, flawless writing of love and loss

author: CheleH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2016
review_content: An angry 3.5 to 4 STARS.........This one is like....I was SO in love with it....and then 50% on , let the manipulation begin! But I was okay with it, because I guessed and expected it, but then she always has to twist the knife. It's so ludicrous. I liked both guys but why make Ryle so lovable and hated all at once. He should of never been a lovable character, Atlas should of been, which I really didn't feel the attachment to him.All the hype for the book. This book would have been greatly enhanced by a more extended ending, maybe a longer epilogue. This isn't the happy ending Hoover usually does; it is abbreviated so as to be more impactful in its message. It is a hopeful ending, but a sad one nonetheless.All the Ellen letters drove me bonkers, sometime it was a lot of rambling and some I was ok with it. I didn't like reading letter after letter it got boring and I would lose interest often. I have read every Colleen Hoover book, but lately I have been dropping the stars. Most of all her book where 5 stars now I am getting to 3.5 to 4 stars.
title: It definately stuck with me

author: Lisa LifeInLit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2016
review_content: THE STORY:Lisa: I went into this story completely blind. I do this quite a bit, honestly, and it almost always pays off. But with this book especially, I think going in blind is the way to go. If that’s not your reading style, I’ll give you just a bit of background.Lily hasn’t lived the easiest life. After graduating from college she moved to Boston where she opened her own business. Things were finally looking up for her. All of her hard work had paid off. She runs into a local neurosurgeon and immediately feels a connection with him. Ryle, especially wearing his adorable scrubs, is easy on the eyes and such a charmer. He’s also a player and only wants one-night-stands. He refuses to get into a relationship for several reasons, one of them being he just doesn’t have the time outside of being a doctor to be in a real relationship. The sparks start flying and Lily realizes she’s quite interested in Ryle… that is, until a blast from her past, Atlas, reappears, and brings up allllll kinds of confusing feelings.Becca: Yes! I 100% agree with Lisa, if you can go into this one blind then I recommend that you do! It was absolutely incredible to experience each moment and have no idea what was going to happen next!I don’t want to say too much and spoil the story for anyone. I will say that this book does span a large part of Lily’s life. We see her as a teen and also as an adult, it was very well done and I enjoyed the blend of past and present.THE CHARACTERS:Becca: Oh these characters… where do I begin?! I absolutely loved Lily! She had been through so much in her life, yet she persevered and followed her dreams. She was strong and fought for what she believed in. I loved learning about her past and being with her in the present. I felt as though I knew her, I understood and empathized with very thought and every emotion.When Lily met Ryle, I fell for him as instantaneously as she did. He was strong, confident, funny and of course sexy in scrubs ;) Their relationship was a whirlwind that wrapped them up so quickly and I was in it with them! When things got tough for them, I felt every moment as harshly as they did.When Atlas (the blast from Lily’s past) appears it throws this whole story in a different direction. Of course, we meet him with young Lily and then again later in the book. Atlas has this smooth, quiet confidence about him. He comes from absolutely nothing and makes something out of himself. I admired and respected him and I fell for him big time!I know some of you are probably sniffing out a love triangle and freaking out. In my opinion, that is NOT what this is. Some may call it a love triangle on a technical basis, but it really is not and I urge you not to skip this one for that reason because that term is to cliched for what this book actually is.Also the secondary characters in this book, Lily’s parents and Ryle’s sister and her husband are truly imperative in this story. They are just perfect and add so much to the story.I do not think that there is another Author out there who can make me fall in love with characters quite so hard. CoHo develops her characters so well that I feel as though I know them! I had so many feels for these characters that my heart couldn’t handle it! In the past I have loved many CoHo characters (and I still do) but none made me feel what these characters did and none made me feel quite so much that I was a part of their story. Trust me when I say these are characters that you want to meet.Lisa: That’s so, so true, Becca! I agree that CoHo has an amazing ability to make us fall in love with ALL characters, even the not-so-easy-to-love ones.I’m honestly not sure I would categorize this as a love triangle. I know others have, but I disagree. (view spoiler)My favorite characters in this story were, as Becca mentioned, the secondary characters. Specifically Ryle’s sister and her husband, who are wonderful additions to this beautiful story. I also enjoyed the family dynamics and how everyone had each others’ backs when it was most important.TO SUM UP:Lisa: WOW! Just… wow! This has got to be the BEST book Colleen Hoover has written to date. The stark honesty and impacting nature of this story will punch you in the feels. Hard. I’ve never experienced an abuse story to quite this level. I was blown away by this story and left a babbling ball of nerves and tears. A book hasn’t touched me this deeply in quite some time. I also learned quite a bit from this story. We’re always so quick to judge in instances of abuse… but there’s so much more to the story than you see with the naked eye. Don’t judge. Don’t assume facts that aren’t true. And, most importantly, don’t ever think it can’t happen to you or someone you know. Such a strong story that is sure to impact every reader that opens the cover in one way or another. I’m leave completely blown away by this story, as well as hopeful, which is such a wonderful thing. Colleen, you’ve done it AGAIN!Becca: I know some of you may think that I always say this and yes I am a true CoHo fan, but this is by far her best work ever. It Ends With Us is so raw and full of emotions, but most of all it is honest. I cried… A LOT! And I am not talking a few tears or a quiet wimper… I am talking ugly crying that I couldn’t contain. The message it delivers is a powerful one and I know that this is a book that will stay with me forever. Please make sure that once you are done you read the Author note at the end, it will give you an even better view of this book afterward.Colleen Hoover, you slay me with your words. You break my heart and then put the pieces back together. You are an amazing writer and I believe you are a gift for readers like myself. Keep doing what you are doing and I will keep reading everything that you write.(Thanks to Atria Books for the review copy!)
title: especially wearing his adorable scrubs, is easy on the eyes and such ...

author: Katie S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016
review_content: Okay okay okay, I think after giving myself a day to process everything after finishing It Ends With Us, I'm ready to (partially) review it!Do you ever hear the saying "oh it's just a book"? Or the, "don't worry it isn't real, its just a story"? Well starting this book, I thought it would be just a story.But it wasn't.You see, this book was not just a book, not just a story, it was so much more than 384 pages of ink printed on paper.It was life-altering, and so incredibly important.My piece of advice (other than go read this book right now!!!), is to GO IN BLIND! Colleen Hoover herself told everyone to not look at spoilers, and for once, I didn't.Man.....am I so happy I didn't.I have never read a book where I felt like the character as much as I did in this one. I was in my one little world where I was not Katie, but instead I was Lily Bloom.I learned a lot being Lily Bloom.I went through a lot of emotions as Lily Bloom. I laughed, I cried, I cursed, I cried again, I sobbed, and I loved.*Emphasis on the cry part. I cried in the car for forty-five minutes after finishing this book because it was just that life changing.*This book is so much more than a book, and I really truly deeply believe every one should read it, especially women. It opens your eyes to way more than you would ever expect.I want to discuss every little detail about the book in this post, but that would be me doing you a huge disfavor. Don't read any spoilers, just buy it, read it, and I promise you'll love it.
title: Colleen Hoover you are the Ellen of authors!!!! 5/5 STARS!

author: Hailey Conner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2021
review_content: First, This book was amazing. Like, read-it-in-one-sitting amazing. So well written. However, there should have been a **MAJOR TRIGGER WARNING FOR DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT**.  Without any spoilers, what occurs is detailed and continues throughout the majority of the book as a major theme. I can't believe it isn't included in the book description on Amazon. I was completely caught off guard by it. The author does a beautiful job with it, including encompassing the mindsets and thought processes of all the characters - but I would never suggest this book to anyone still working through their own traumas or triggered by descriptions and themes of domestic violence or physical/sexual assault.Again, amazing book. Such a good read. But I wish I would've know the true premise of the book before purchasing/reading.
title: Such a good read BUT should come with a trigger warning!!

author: Paris Hansen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover has done it again. She’s written a book that has changed me in a way that I can’t even begin to describe. I went into this book completely blind and was immediately in love with Ryle and Lily. Then as things started to unfold, I thought for sure I knew what was going to happen next, but I should have known better. Colleen rarely takes things in the direction that I am expecting.This book was leaps and bounds beyond what I was expecting. It was emotional and beautiful and I think that everyone should read it; men, women, people who aren’t into romance novels. This book opened my eyes to a different side of the store. It made me think about things in a different way. I will no longer wonder why because I understand things better now.Warning: I did ugly cry while reading this book. Full on ugly sobs, mascara running down my face. The afterword really got me, but it is something that everyone should read. But this book isn’t all about the emotional stuff. There are some great laugh out loud moments in this book and some sexy times as well. This book had everything I want in a book and more.This is Colleen Hoover at her finest writing about something that is deeply personal to her and something that affects more people than you probably realize. I absolutely loved this book and I cannot recommend it enough. If I could give it more than 5 stars I would.
title: Amazing Book...Colleen Hoover has done it again.

author: Trudy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2016
review_content: *** This may be a little spoiler-ish ***I can honestly say I am not sure why I am giving this a 5 star rating. Maybe I have yet to completely process it and when I do I am sure it will be worthy of the 5 stars. Maybe it is because it made me laugh, love, hurt and then it made me angry. So angry I wanted to throttle Colleen for putting Lily through everything. I did not cry but I did feel. It brought back a lot of memories. No, I did not watch my Mom being abused at the hands of my father but yes, my Dad did hit my sister & I. Did he love us, yes. Was he sorry, probably not because that was how he was raised and he thought it was how you taught your children. It ended with me. I made sure to never spank my children, to always walk away when my anger came to the surface and just like Lily I made sure to break the cycle so maybe that is why I feel this was a 5 star book. Maybe it goes even deeper than that. Colleen managed to address a very sensitive subject, showing many different sides of it, and even though she makes you understand why someone would stay she also makes you understand why it is so important to leave. She wrote about how it effects more than just two people, it has long lasting effects on everyone and it changes everything forever.All that being said, I needed more. I needed more interaction with Atlas. What became of him after Lily's birthday. How come they did not keep in touch? I needed more Ryle. I needed to know if he healed, how he was doing, what changed or did anything change? I get that this is Lily's story but I am not sure it was finished yet. Maybe we need an Atlas novella, or a Ryle novella, maybe we need a sequel, I'm not sure but I just don't feel like the story was complete. It was all wrapped up in a tidy little ending but it wasn't finished.Like I said, it has only been three days since I read It Ends With Us so I am still a little unsure how I feel about it. I love Colleen's books. I love how she writes. I love her characters. I loved the characters in this story, all of them. They are normal people. They are your friends, family, loved ones and they have faults. They have fears, they love and are loved. This story was beautifully written but I am still processing and I think that is why this is a 5 star book! Three days later and I am still thinking about it, about the characters, about their journey, about their loves and lives and that is a sign that a story is worthy of 5 stars. When you cannot just get over it, you won't forget, and you feel. Colleen did everything right. She wrote the story that Lily needed written and as a reader it is my right to need more, to want more. The fact that I feel lost shows that everything was just the way it needed to be so yes, this story deserves a 5 star rating and so does Colleen!
title: A story that needed to be told and needs to be read!!!

author: Sgilman83
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: When the pre-order came out for this book, of course I had to have it.  There was no cover, there was no blurb but I knew it was going to be great.  Everything Colleen Hoover touches turns out to be an epic read and It Ends With Us is no exception.Once the book was received, I knew I had to wait until after work and the gym to really dive into it since I needed at least 5 hours uninterrupted to start and finish.  I made the mistake in starting the book at lunch and those 30 mins wasn't enough.  The first chapter intrigued me and only meeting Ryle and Lily wasn't enough.  So my 30 minute lunch turned into an hour and the last 2 hours of my workday had involved me sneaking her book on my kindle app on my phone...thank goodness i have 2 screens so that i can somewhat hide my phone in my office. I also have a routine after work where i work out for an hour (no exceptions) and I decided to go straight home to read, while enjoying an in and out burger, since i knew this ride was going to prevent me from cooking for myself and my fiance.  Poor guy didn't know what to do with himself when he got home and saw me in the dark, reading and not looking up until I was done.Once again, I didn't know what this book was about so everything unfolded like a big puzzle and there were points where I had to just put down the book for a second to gather my thoughts. I had to many emotions while reading this book and once I finished, i just laid in bed and was emotionally drained.I loved every single word, page and chapter of this book.  Thank you so much Colleen for writing this book and for existing!
title: So Many Emotions, Another Great one by Colleen Hoover

author: Jinni James
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2016
review_content: Wow! That's the first word that came to mind once I reached the end of this book. Just.....WOW!First off let me just say that this is a strong, emotion filled, gut-wrenching, story with a great ending. Now I understand all the 'trigger' posts. I avoided a lot of the posts because I didn't want any spoilers, I'm glad I did. I completely understand some readers needing to be warned but I for one am happy I didn't know what was coming. Granted it made me want to throw this book out of the 30,000 mile up window I was sitting next to but nevertheless it was a fantastic read and I believe it should be read by everyone.  Thank the Heavens I was sitting on a plane next to my amazing husband when I read the second half and ending of this story because that was the only thing stopping me from bawling my ever loving eyes out. This was a story that needed to be told.The story begins in your typical fashion, girl meets boy, girl likes boy, boy doesn't want a relationship, but they end up in one anyway BUT what is not typical is Lily's backstory read through as journal posts to Ellen DeGeneres. That was a cute touch since I love Ellen. Journal entries about her first love, a boy who was homeless living in an abandoned house next to hers. A boy that never really leaves her mind, ever.Her journal posts would be what you would think a fifteen year old girl would write about mostly, a new crush and such but it also contains deep emotions about her currently lifestyle with her parents. This is where the 'triggers' come in. To spare any spoilers I won't say anything other than there's violence.Later Lily meets a handsome neurosurgeon on a rooftop in Boston. Instant chemistry at it's finest. However, boy doesn't want a relationship so they both go their own way until the fates cause them to cross paths again and finally the boy succumbs to the fact that he can't let the girl go.When they say 'if something seems too good to be true it probably is' it's usually 9 times out of 10 true. Ryle isn't exactly everything Lily would have hoped for even though she wants him to be desperately.Lily finds herself torn in more ways than one. This story really explores a woman's thought process through so many traumatic situations. Lily is strong in some many ways but conflicted in others. She's just like any other woman out there, which may be another reason I adore her.This story has many twists, heart breaking, gut wrenching, twists yet it is still a love story with a great ending that I think every woman in the world should read especially those battling through difficult relationships.Sometimes it's better to walk away than to live with something that isn't right.
title: If you are on the fence about this book, GO DOWNLOAD NOW!

author: Christine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
review_content: I fell in love with Lilly from the moment she was introduced in the book.  Her beauty, intelligence, empathy, vulnerability, and strength were all characteristics that made me love her.  I won’t rehash the book here but suffice it to say it was amazing.  The relationship she had with Ryle was tumultuous at best but was indeed a love affair.  I read the book in 2 sittings as I was anxious to see how it ended.  I highly recommend it for a great read dealing with a difficult topic that unfortunately happens too often in today’s society.
title: What a great story about strength!

author: Renae McBrian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: rsgdajtdfgxjgsresgbredhfxhgbdzjmtrsjrsjfgxjfcfckFk you,Colleen.Good, now that I got that out of the way, I can attempt to form a comprehensible stream of words here. I keep typing out a reaction, and then highlighting and deleting it all. My words cannot do Colleen's words justice. I have never, ever said this about a book before, but this. book. is. life. changing.I feel like I say this about everything Colleen writes, but this book was nothing short of amazing. Honestly, it could be a list of gibberish on the back of a greasy fast food bag and I would still read anything she wrote/co-wrote/had an idea about once on the toilet. But this book is so much more than that.First of all, books don't make me cry. I can think of maybe five books that have ever made me cry, like real sobs, and one of them was my book while I was writing it so it doesn't even count. But this book is so fricking real. So when I say that the end of this book had me sobbing, I want you to understand the full meaning behind this statement.I've waited for It Ends With Us basically since Colleen first announced it. As an avid CoHort, anything that Colleen writes automatically ends up on my shelf. I avoided reading anything about it as much as I could. I knew, going into it, that it was hard for her to write, and that something about cow poo happened. That's it. I didn't even read the back of the book. I wanted to be surprised.But surprised isn't the word I would use. Colleen took a taboo subject-- a very real, very important taboo subject-- and gave a very detailed version of it.I wrote a more detailed review on my blog, but really, just read this book. You won't regret it .
title: Colleen Hoover does it again!

author: M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016
review_content: Wow. I feel like I preface every Colleen Hoover review with that simple word yet it’s generally the best way I can describe how I feel immediately following my “CoHoma” (aka the Colleen Hoover induced haze/shock that immediately follows reading one of her books). This was super complex and deeply personal. I cried a lot of ugly tears…mostly toward the latter part of the book, but definitely not surprising because her books always get to me somehow. I don’t know this woman, I’ve never met her, I know her the way most readers do, through her words and let me tell you if you follow anything about her, you’ll know just how kind and generous she seems. Reading this book made me feel as though I knew a deeper part of her and it may sound weird, but I saw some of the best in her through this one book. She manages to make you question everything you ever think you knew by simply making her characters so human. You fall in love with them, you take journeys with them, your heart is sometimes broken by their actions, but in the end you have a better understanding of not only them, but yourself. This is what It Ends With Us does to the reader, it allows you to not only engage in a wonderfully complex journey, but it also makes you do some soul searching.I’ve followed her work since Slammed and have been an avid fan ever since, I go through the same process with every release…asking questions like, “is this my new Colleen favorite?” and then grunting or sighing because I know rating or ranking any of her work is pointless because everything she writes is golden. There has never been a bad Colleen Hoover book and I’m convinced there never will be. Her books are generally very poignant, thought provoking, usually witty and always ; her characters are perfectly flawed, they have depth and their stories generally shock you into a “CoHoma” (this is my new word and I’m sticking to it because her books are spellbinding). It Ends With Us is different in that it pushes limits, makes you question yourself and what decisions you would make if you were any of these characters. This isn’t very different from most of her books because she always shocks me, but her voice and the plot twists combined are completely unparalleled. This was a tough read in so many ways for me because it was so relatable. For many who pick this book up you might have been through something similar or chances are you know someone that has. You may have even judged, commented or witnessed something similar, regardless of the how, I’m betting that you will relate in some way. When you realize how easily black and white can turn to grey it is then that you will understand what it truly means to unravel the mystery that is a Colleen Hoover read. She finds a way to make even the most difficult situations real and creates a challenge for the reader by daring them to confront ugly truths or in this case naked truths.Lily is an incredibly strong character that will both inspire and transform you. I’m afraid to say this was Colleen Hoover’s best work yet, but because of how personal it is I have to applaud her for sharing such a difficult yet brilliant story with her readers. There are a handful of books I’ve read with similar storylines and they’ve never gotten to me to this degree. I hate to be so vague, but this story is worth withholding the plot, the summary does not begin to explain what you will go through reading this, but it is worth every second. Although the end seems final and complete (and totally perfect) somehow I hope she somehow is inspired to continue this as a series or at least a novella. I hope you all will take a chance on this one it is probably on my top 5 best reads of all time and might be my favorite book published in 2016. This book is heavy at times, but if you pick up one book this year please please please let it be It Ends With Us. I promise you won’t regret it.
title: Powerful, Poignant & Complex

author: Shannon D. Josendale
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
review_content: This is not your typical romance novel...the characters in this book are so well developed and you are so engrossed in their story. It's been a long time since I've read anything that make me gasp out loud in shock but this book did. If you looking for a typical romance novel than this is probably not your book. You'll have a love/hate relationship with some of the characters and it's the love you have for them that makes you hate some of the things they do. It has such an important message and really helped me to understand a situation that I could only judge before from the outside. I don't want to give any spoilers away so I'll leave it at that. Read this book. You won't regret it!
title: I couldn't put this book down!

author: Rebecca
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: This book, where the h do I even start.....I was lucky enough to get an early copy of It Ends With Us, about two months ago. It has taken me this long to write a review. I have tried coming up with the right words to sum up this book, but to be honest, there are not enough words to do that. My biggest piece of advice is to go into this book completely, 100%, blind. I did and I'm so thankful!I have loved every single one of Colleen's books. I have been shocked when each one is as good as the last. I knew I'd love this one, but I had no idea how much. Colleen put her heart and soul into this book. As a reader, you are truly a better person after reading it. If It Ends With Us doesn't open your eyes, heart, and soul....you have problems. This book is, by far, Colleen's best work....EVER! I smiled, laughed, cried, felt sick to my stomach, got my heart broke, and felt a huge amount of hope while reading this book.I, truly and honestly, feel like this book changed me. I HATE spoilers so I don't want to say too much. I will say that my amount respect for some people has grown by leaps and bounds after reading this, I want to hug certain people a whole bunch, and I want to kiss Colleen for giving us this beautiful, gut wrenching, soul shattering story. (I know how much you'd just love that, Hoover!)Do yourself and those around you a huge honor and service by picking up this book and devouring every word. You'll be a better person because of it, that's a guarantee.
title: It's not a should read, it's a MUST read. It's a life changer!

author: RM Reviews
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
review_content: This is the first book I've read by Colleen Hoover, but it won't be my last. The book sucks you in from the first appearance of 23-year-old Lily, whom we meet sitting on a ledge twelve stories above Boston about to meet the gorgeous neurosurgeon-in-training Ryle. But both Lily and Ryle have something dark in their pasts, and the novel's plot turns on how the past informs the present. By turns sad, funny, poignant and ultimately, life-affirming, the novel will stay with me for a long time. Count me as yet another of Hoover's many fans.
title: Beautiful writing, and a plot that will stay with you a long, long time...

author: darlnnikki71
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: I knew this book was going to be unlike any other Colleen Hoover book I’ve ever read. It was coming from a raw, honest, and very personal experience. I found myself completely engrossed within the first few pages. So much so, that I was up until 3am, needing to know how it was going to end.I went into this story completely blind, which is something I very rarely do, but I would highly suggest doing the same. This book is full of hard truths, and so real that I had to pause and collect myself many times, because my emotions were all over the place. The main characters Lily, Ryle, & Atlas will absolutely capture your heart. You will be completely invested in their story, and the naked truths they bare. “Imagine all the people you meet in your life. There are so many. They come in like waves, trickling in and out with the tide. Some waves are much bigger and make more of an impact than others. Sometimes the waves bring with them things from deep in the bottom of the sea and they leave those things tossed onto the shore. Imprints against the grains of sand that prove the waves had once been there, long after the tide recedes.”  What do you do, when it’s those you love the most, the ones that have made the biggest impact on your life, that end up hurting you in ways you never thought possible? This is Lily’s story, and it’s a profound one.This book will be on the top of my recommendation list.
title: Profound and Hopeful

author: Stacey Broadbent
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2018
review_content: I bought this book a year ago, and it’s been sitting on my shelf, waiting for a moment in time where I didn’t have any work on or distractions, because I just knew it was going to have an impact.It Ends With Us delves into some pretty serious subjects. Throughout the story we get to see glimpses into Lily’s past through her journal entries, and it’s not always pretty. Some entries were harder to read than others. I have to say, it really made me appreciate my own upbringing.I am so pleased that Colleen wrote this book, allowing a look into the lives of those living through domestic violence. To see it from a side that many wouldn’t, and to bring to light the confusing thoughts of both the victim and the bystanders.It wasn’t all doom and gloom either. It Ends With Us was engaging from the very first line of the book. The characters were likeable - I particularly loved Alyssa and Marshall, and of course, Atlas. But Lily, she was something else. She was strong, caring, compassionate, and someone to look up to. I adored her.I also love that Ellen DeGeneres plays a part in this story! She too is an inspiration, and it only seems fitting that she be mentioned.Overall, fantastically crafted story with real depth. But then, I wouldn’t expect anything less from CoHo 😉
title: fantastically crafted story with real depth

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2019
review_content: I want to start out saying I don't write reviews because writing just isn't my thing, but I could not stop thinking about this book. This book was not what I was expecting, but that's a good thing. A lot of times an author throws a wrench  in and you think "they just messed up the entire story". I'll admit, once I figured out what this book was actually about, I was a little upset thinking that's not what I wanted..  I was wrong. First, can I say how much I love the beginning of their love story. I loved the naked truth and everything about the roof top has me swooning. I fell in love with their story. Now half way through the book, things go in a different direction when the "casserole" part came. that's when I realized this book was not what I thought it would be and I was a little upset. I  loved these characters and didn't want it to change.  Then when Lily starts making her justifications and excuses I found myself shaking my head and sighing. I wanted to grab her and yell how dumb she was being. Don't become your mom!  I also thought this is where the love triangle would appear and the prince would save the damsel riding in on his white horse. I'm happy to say I was wrong about that too. Thank you for that, reakly! The story wouldn't of been the same, she needed to do this on her own. I'm happy this wasn't made into a love triangle because this story isn't a love story. It was about finding strength to do what's hard and it came full circle. Towards the end of the book I found myself no longer in my head (iit's easy to judge what people should do when you are on the outside looking in) But actually in Lilys. i found myself missing Rylle and their relationship and, dare I admit, wanting it to work. I know, it sounds crazy and as soon as the thought entered my minf, id throw it out! Yet, my heart wouldn't listen to my head. It wanted the love stoty. It wanted rooftop Ryle. It wanted the happily ever after. It wanted to give Ryle the chance to change. For things to work. I wanted to believe he could be better. My head knew it was wrong, but still those feelings still came. I loved the ending of the book and I really don't think it could of ended any other way. I finished the last sentence with a tear in my eye and a smile on my lips. I'd also like to thank the author for the message in the back. It made the story even more powerf. And as a mother of two daughters, I hope I can be the kind of mother they can be proud of. Maybe if I am, they will want to be me when they grow up.
title: Not what you would expect!

author: MIFTAHUL JANNAT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2019
review_content: Colleen Hoover never fails to disappoint me, never! The stories I have read of her always has a deep meaning and chemistry between the couple which I love. All her stories deserve to get 5 stars but I somehow don't want to because I don't like a book where there is a third person because it confuses me, at the beginning of the book I start to ship a couple and then BOOM a third person appears which I hate.After reading the book UGLY LOVE which I [ hate, loved ] it, I thought I won't be reading any of Colleen's book because in that book Miles was very much still in love with Rachel when he was with Tate and that disappointed me, so that's why I made up my mind that I won't be reading any of this authors book but DAMN! after reading IT ENDS WITH US, I don't have words. It was just perfect!I somehow at the beginning wanted her to end up with Ryle because I fell in love with him from the first but when I read about Atlas, I started to have a soft corner for him and wanted to read more about him.At first, when Ryle hit Lily, I as well convinced myself that it was a mistake because I WAS SO MUCH IN LOVE WITH RYLE, but the way Atlas cared about Lily and protected her, my mind changed and I was like 'go Ryle, go away, Lily should be with Atlas now!'I loved how the author always portrays the serious issues so gracefully, I really admire her writing and work as well as her thinking about the characters and their chemistry. The character of Lily was inspiring because even though she was madly in love with Ryle, she didnt let him win and didnt give him a chance because he was wrong and he physically hurt her. she deserved to be loved but not in a way he did, she deserved far more like how Atlas did.I really liked the character of Allysa because she always supported Lily even though she was Ryle's sister, she was far the most trustworthy friend I even read about and she always followed her duty as a best friend and as a sister.“All humans make mistakes. What determines a person's character aren't the mistakes we make. It's how we take those mistakes and turn them into lessons rather than excuses.”
title: CAN ATLAS NOT BE MORE PERFECT?

author: Two G's
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020
review_content: This is one of those books that keeps you glued to every page, yet it's very emotional and kind of difficult to read.  I am giving it a 4 instead of 5 because it's not a happy-go-lucky subject matter, it's heart breaking!  But for those who can handle that kind of book, read this one!The writer does an amazing job of telling the story to where you really feel like you know the characters and want what is best for all of them.  Days after finishing the book I am still thinking about the characters as though I knew them at one time.  That is good writing!
title: Excellent Book

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover is one of my favorite authors, and I always look forward to a new book by her.  This one really takes you on an emotional roller coaster.  The subject matter is not easy and at times became difficult to read.  Lily's journal entries from high school told the story of her intense first love and provided the background for Lily's turbulent feelings about her parents.  When the story opens Lily is encountering a new love; the journal entries begin to appear a bit later.  I will say right off the bat that I was immediately intrigued by the male character who was her first love.  I felt such empathy for him and his situation.  I also felt compassion for Lily because she was caught in an environment that was eating away at her, and she had no control over it nor a way to escape it.  The new love seemed like a decent guy who really cared for Lily.  Initially, their relationship seemed to fit the scenario of "the non-relationship man who falls in love and settles down when he meets the right woman."  Yet, as the plot unfolds with all its twists and turns it becomes SO much more than that.  At times, parts of this story were difficult for me to read but the book is definitely a journey well worth taking.  The ending is very touching, brought tears for me.  But I did wish that more interaction between the main characters at the ending would have been more fulfilling for me.  After such an arduous journey to reach that point, I would have liked to see more of a glimpse into their happily ever after.  I do HIGHLY recommend this one!
title: 4.5 Stars

author: Jacqueline
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2016
review_content: This book is written very well. I think every woman should read this book and keep for her daughter for when she thinks it will be age appropriate. I think this would be a great book to pick up in college and have young men and women discuss it.I liked Lily. I liked that I got to know why she made the decisions she made. It was easy to like Lily because of what she did for Atlas and how she was with him.I liked Atlas, he didn't have it easy. I like how we got to know him when he was a teenager and lily helped him out.I don't know how I feel about Ryle. He's a good guy but he has something that haunts him. He loves Lily. And he's willing to give things he wouldn't in the past a try. I know he's part of Lily's present. I loved his sister Allysa. She really was Lily's best friend through the good, the bad and the worst.This book helped me understands somethings I didn't before about why people make certain choices. I highly recommend this book. It should be on everyone's to be read list.
title: A Must Read!!!

author: Maureen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020
review_content: You know how sometimes, when you read a book, it just makes you feel... something? I wished this was that book for me, and it wasn’t, but it is definitely going to be that book for a lot of people. It’s incredibly well-written, beautifully planned out, and a little teensy bit disappointing (in how the plot ends, but in the same manner, very necessary). Regardless of whether or not this book has the ability to make you feel that something, it offers such an important perspective into an incredibly common but well-veiled issue. Definitely worth the read.
title: Didn’t love it, and I have absolutely no idea why. It’s an amazing book well worth the read.

author: Faithsmom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2016
review_content: I'm embarrassed to admit this, especially as a fellow romance author, but IT ENDS WITH US is my first Colleen Hoover book. I have others on my Kindle, but as you all surely know, TBRs are a funny thing, and I'll likely die with thousands of books I still plan to read.But, holy hell am I glad I made time for this one.FIVE CRAZY EMOTIONAL STARS!This book had me in a mess of emotion. I laughed. I cried. A few times I even set the book down and swiped at my tears thinking, "I can't read this." Or, "So, THIS is what being triggered feels like."But I kept on, because I don't DNF amazing books, and something inside me KNEW I needed to read this.----->Don't go into this hoping for a comfy romance with lots of swooning. <-----I mean, don't get me wrong, Ryle and Atlas are HOT HOT HOT, but that's not what this book is about. Go into this knowing you might gain some perspective. Go into this knowing you might feel some things you don't want to feel. Go into this knowing you might be forced to take a deep look at yourself and acknowledge some things you don't want to acknowledge. Be prepared to go through the ringer with this book, but don't avoid it because of that reason. Sometimes it's okay to feel all of those emotions we try not to, or to rehash all those past feelings.This is a VERY necessary read for EVERYONE. Especially if you've even ONCE thought, "Why doesn't she just leave him?" Please, please, please, from someone who's both been in an abusive relationship and at one time even looked down upon others for not leaving their abuser, PLEASE READ THIS BOOK. It is so absolutely ESSENTIAL.
title: A necessary read for EVERYONE. Especially if you've even ONCE thought, "Why doesn't she just leave him?"

author: JSMiller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2016
review_content: NO SPOILERS HERE!This book has 50,000 four & five star reviews on Good Reads.  So figured I had to read it and find out why.  Part 1 is a  romance novel and does not disappoint in the sexy department.  Part 2 a wonderful love story and probably the best contemporary love story I have read to date.  The characters are developed and at times very complex as is the situation they all find themselves in.  It's a book, part 2 especially, for every woman, young or old.  If I had college age daughters I would say it's mandatory reading. This is a thoughtful perspective on how we view other women and question the relationships they are in and try to understand why.  This author goes deep and the reader comes away with an understanding.  Your emotions will be all over the place. In addition to the  sexy part you will also feel crushing heartbreak, moments of comic relief,  fear, frustration, satisfaction, and peace. Like other readers I wanted a chapter or two more to answer a few questions.  But I guess I can make up those answers myself.  Just read it...don't look at the description or read the back of the book or the author's note at the end. Just read it.
title: Clear your schedule...no interruptions during this book!

author: Nikki Storebo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2017
review_content: Wow.This is, without a doubt, the most powerful and incredible book that Colleen has written to date.Lily and Ryle meet on a rooftop in Boston, after each has had a particularly difficult day. They two go months without seeing one another, but are thrust back into each other’s worlds by chance. After trying—unsuccessfully—to avoid one another, they come together, and thus marks the beginning of a beautiful romance. Things are perfect between them … until they’re not.I’m going to try to do this without giving away too many spoilers for everyone.This book filled my heart up. All the way through the first part, there were nothing but amazing things happening. Love happened. Dreams became realities. Friendships bloomed and characters developed and I seriously had the biggest smile on my face.And then, Colleen used her words to reach straight into my chest, tear my heart out, and throw it in a blender.I’ve never felt as conflicted while reading through a book as I did with this one. It was so easy to fall for both these characters, because Colleen did such an amazing job of writing them. Lily is this amazing young lady who, despite not having the best childhood under her belt, is still full of life and dreams, and the passion to accomplish them. Ryle is sexy and funny and smart and driven. Together, they have this chemistry that flew off the pages and slapped me right in the face. It’s impossible to deny their attraction.But then there were these little things that started to crop up with Ryle. And even though they started out small, they got bigger and bigger until they were just crazy things that made me simultaneously love him, hate him, and pity him. My emotions were everywhere the farther I got in the book. But, that’s part of what made me love it so much. I didn’t want to put it down. I had to know what was going to happen, how Lily and Ryle were going to do things.I loved the way that Colleen wove Lily and Atlas’s story in using the journal. And the whole Ellen thing was brilliant too!One of the strongest elements of the writing in this book is Lily’s character development. At the beginning of the story, she’s so critical and judgmental of her mom. As the story progresses, and she finds herself in situations like what her mother has endured, she starts to understand why it wasn’t fair to judge her mother in the first place, and just how complicated and emotionally challenging relationships can be. I always saw strength in her, from the very start of the story, but that strength multiplies tenfold by the end of the book, because she’s forced to make some very difficult and painful decisions, all in the name of doing what’s best for her daughter.At the end of this story, I found my heart feeling full once more. Happy endings aren't always perfect ones, and It Ends with Us is a beautiful example of a story that has an imperfect yet satisfying conclusion.Five stars to this beautiful novel.
title: A gut wrenching and beautiful story!

author: S.J. Dowling
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover never disappoints, never.  And based on posts and pre-release reviews, I expected this one to be very emotional and deep, as have all of her books been.  This one, though, especially after reading the book and then reading her note to readers, was beyond just emotional and deep.  It seeped into crevices of your being you didn't realize were there, and stirred up everything within you.  I have never experienced what Lily experienced, so I have nothing with which to compare.  But we've all had difficult life-changing decisions to come at us from time to time.  Everything leading up to Lily's biggest life-changing decision was "I've mortgaged a piece of my heart to this book" wonderful.  Funny, heart-warming, squishy romantic, heart-shuddering.  Lily's background with Atlas, her unique meeting Ryle, it was all such a nice, interesting read.  When it gets into the meat and the heart of things, it became cold like a hard cold stone in your heart, with your mind teeter-tottering back and forth with what you want Lily to do, how you want her to respond.  Reading Ms Hoover's note to readers was not so much icing on the cake as it was an "aha" moment that locked every piece of the book tightly into place in your mind and your heart.  I appreciate Ms Hoover's being able to share this story with us, her adoring reader fans.  I have so much admiration and respect for Ms Hoover for her talent, ability and humility, but for sharing that amazing talent with us in the creation of some amazing characters who are more like our friends.
title: This is the book that took her over the top, into the clouds of our hearts forever!

author: lisa_littleflower
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
review_content: I don’t have a tolerance for manipulation. This book is kind of hard to get through in the sense that the manipulation is obvious and you don’t understand why Lily is putting up with it. But the epilogue really brings it home. It’s hard to understand abuse when you’ve never been put in that kind of situation. It makes you grateful for the loving people that do exist in your life.The whole thing with Atlas at the end makes me wonder how Ryle would react. The epilogue proves being civil is possible but based on situations in the story, it’s scary to think about.
title: Epilogue completed the story

author: Lauren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2020
review_content: Overall, I really enjoyed this book and I think that it is an incredibly important story to tell.  I loved the authors notes at the end, and I think that her personal experiences being intertwined in the story truly enhance it. I will say that I think a few of the characters are undeveloped, but the best moments of the story are the journal entries written by Lily.  When not reading about her past, the timeline skips a little too quickly for my taste, jumping over huge events and speeding through the developing relationships among the characters. The author does do an especially good job of not identifying a villan too quickly and making readers hope for every side to work out.  I will definitely be looking for more from this author as soon as I can.
title: Worth the read

author: Linda @ (un)Conventional Bookworms
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2016
review_content: Yeah. It most definitely should end with them. It Ends with Us is a bit different from CoHo’s other stories with more mature characters. There are quite a few things that are similar too, though: the amazing writing, the character-driven story, and my tears…It Ends With Us is a very strong and necessary story. It deals with some pretty heavy subject matters, and I have actually already used it as an example of something important with a young woman I know… Lily Bloom is a very strong woman, and she has built so many walls around herself and her heart that she might have been completely impenetrable, but she wasn’t. The story itself starts with some chance encounters, and it has one part of the action happening in the present, and another part in the past, where Lily reads through her old journals to try to make peace with her past and the people in it.Having empathy and understanding for other people and their problems is something I think is really important. And It Ends With Us truly made me walk a few miles in someone else’s shoes, and it definitely put some things in perspective for me. I had some pre-conceived notions about some kinds of relationships, and I really don’t think I do anymore – so kudos to CoHo for managing to really make me see things from a different point of view.Most of the story in It Ends With Us is from Lily’s point of view, and as I said above, there are parts set in the present and other parts set in the past. There is definitely a lot of heartache, but I didn’t feel completely overwhelmed by sadness until the end. The range of emotions I felt was complete, though, and I think this is one of CoHo’s strong suits. She manages to so fully make me believe in her characters, that seem so real because they’re flawed, that I immediately want their life to be the best it can be. If you haven’t picked up this book yet, you should just put down everything you’re doing right now and go grab it! And start reading it!
title: Don't look for spoilers - Amazing story waiting for you!

author: Tracy S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2017
review_content: There is seriously nothing Colleen Hoover can write that I would not like.I honestly wasn't going to leave a review for It Ends With Us because honestly I don't even know where to begin to articulate a book such as this one. Then I was sitting here thinking, there is no way in hell I could not write a review for this because this book, It Ends With Us, has the ability to not only touch the lives of those that read it but it could save the lives of so many too.You will laugh and fall in love with ALL of these characters. Colleen Hoover has this ability to make part of this story, to draw you in and not let you go. You will cry, oh God will you cry. And if you are like me you will finish the book and have absolutely no way of doing this book justice in a review.So if you take one thing from this review it should be READ IT. Don't even hesitate to pick it up and let yourself drown in the lives that Colleen Hoover so amazingly created.
title: Love all of them!

author: Melissa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2017
review_content: This was my first Colleen Hoover novel. A lot of people recommended her so I took a look at what she had on Amazon. Most of her books were 4 stars and up with reviews numbering in the thousands. Honestly I chose It Ends With Us because I though the cover art was pretty. I glanced at the reviews, but once I saw a few people saying to just jump in blind, I did just that, and I am so happy I did. I began this book not having ANY idea about what it was about. After a few chapters, I started to get bored. Lily Bloom, had a troubled home life when she was younger, but now everything seemed ok. I anticipated that she was going to have to choose between her current prince charming and her childhood love (I had already chosen who I liked best and was worried Lily would not agree). Then all of a sudden at around the 50% mark, IT. ALL. GOT. FLIP. TURNED. UPSIDE. DOWN. I was shocked and I have no  doubt it was because I was lulled into a false sense of security and I'm wondering if Colleen did it on purpose, or if I'm just the most oblivious person on the planet. Either way, it was an awesome book. Tearjerker for sure.
title: IT. ALL. GOT. FLIP. TURNED. UPSIDE. DOWN.

author: Kari | Books For The Living
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2017
review_content: It has taken me a while to write a review for this book. In the simplest of terms, this book destroyed me. I went in knowing very little about the plot and theme. I think that was a good thing, but probably contributed to why I was so destroyed by it. I wasn’t expecting an emotionally heavy book, but that is what this is.I’m not sure I’ve felt this much anxiety while reading a book before. I read it fast. When I’d force myself to take a break and put it down, my hands, arms, and shoulders were actually sore from me being so tense. That should indicate just how attached and emotionally invested I get to characters and their stories.The description on Goodreads, as well as the one on the back on the book are quite deceiving. They make it out like it is a love triangle. I wouldn’t classify it as such. Lily’s relationships with Ryle and Atlas happen separately from each other. I’m not giving anything away here when I say that Atlas does come back into Lily’s life unexpectedly, but it doesn’t quite happen in the way one might think or expect. It certainly doesn’t progress the way I thought it might. So no, this isn’t a love triangle.Like I said above, I didn’t know a lot about this book when I decided to read it. I knew there was a lot of hype surrounding it’s release, but that’s about it. I’m not going to say much more that is specific to the plot, except that it is not a “light read.” It deals with emotionally heavy topics. If you’re one to look for ‘trigger warnings’ you may want to look at other reviews for those warnings. I don’t want to say much for those who don’t want to know.This book did have sweet moments, funny moments, lovely moments, but it was also heartbreaking, sad, and at times really tough to read. Thinking more on it, one reason why this book destroyed me so much is because I found myself thinking like Lily. Making excuses, saying ‘if only.’ If I reacted like this to characters in a book, what would I do if I was in Lily’s position in real life? That scared me.Lastly, I’m not sure I’d personally categorize this as a romance. Yes, it is about love and relationships at the core. Yes there’s some sex, but it is definitely not your typical romance book. That said, I would say this definition I read about romance novels does apply to it:“Two basic elements comprise every romance novel: a central love story and an emotionally-satisfying and optimistic ending.”(It just might not end in the way you expect it to.)Colleen Hoover wrote a novel that affected me in a way I didn’t expect. The message that you will find within these pages is deeply important. It had me evaluating myself, my thoughts, and what my “limit” would be. I think it’ll make you think about things in a different light as well.
title: Totally unexpected

author: Christy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: Oh My Word! What to say? I think for once a book has left me speechless.Naked Truth? I don't know how I will recover from reading this book.I wish I could give this double ratings because this wasn't just a book. It was life-changing!Seriously, I view life differently. This book has such a big impact on me and I don't even know what to say. I can't relate but I know people who can relate. I empathize with them now after reading this book. I mean I don't even know them personally but I want to give them this book to read because that's how powerful this book is!I fell in love with Lily. She was amazing and strong and bold and brave. So many words describe how awesome she is.I literally am gutted! I don't know if I've ever cried happy and sad tears while reading one book. That's what this book left me feeling.BEST BOOK EVER that Colleen Hoover, or really any author I have read, wrote. I've never cried so many times throughout a book. I would cry like every ten pages. I was straight out bawling near the end.
title: Gut-wrenchingly real and honest! Hands down BEST BOOK EVER! Everyone needs to read this ASAP!

author: Monica P
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover definitely has a way with words. I also think I can officialy say that Colleen is now my favorite author. As an avid reader, one of the most difficult questions to answer is who our favorite author is. Ever since I read Slammed years ago, she became one of my favorites, but after this book I know shes my favorite. IEWU has become my favorite CoHo book to date.
