From the beginning I knew this book was going to be emotional. And I was right. It’s not a CoHo book if you aren’t shedding some tears at some point. From the synopsis I knew there was going to be two guys in the picture. But from the beginning, I knew who I was rooting for. Then something else happened that made me question it, and then it kept repeating until I knew who I wanted her to pick by the end. The book was definitely hard to read at some points. But one thing that I can say with absolute certainty is that Lily is one heck of a strong character. The choices that she made were admirable, especially as we got closer to the end of the book. She stood by her decisions, and it was interesting seeing her thought process when certain things were happening. Her history with Atlas was heartbreaking and emotional. But after reading more about what they both went through and what they had accomplished when they met again was a bittersweet moment. It is really hard writing this review without giving too much away. There are so many things that I want to talk about but I won’t because this is one of those books that you have to go in blind. Just read the synopsis and dive in. The story was beautiful, heartbreaking, emotional and brilliant. There is no doubt that Colleen will forever be one of my favorite authors, but at this point in my reading life, probably my favorite author.
title: Favorite CoHo book to date!

author: Gina S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: To express the profound impact this book has had on me. It is a story I did not expect. One I may not have read knowing how it would evolve. Yet it has touched me to the depths of my soul. I cannot stop weepingg, but at the same time I cannot believe how much I love what Colleen has achieved with this amazing story. I loved it from beginning to end and everything in between. It is a love story for the ages with a powerful message that cannot be  denied or ignored. Colleen's message at the end though, well I bawled through it in entirety. I am not sure I have ever loved a character quite as much as Lily Bloom. The same can be said for Ryle too in spite of the darkness that overcomes him. The Ellen journals were a highlight. Colleen, you are just so clever and relatable and utterly remarkable in the way you capture the essence of life and Love and reality. As for Atlas, well all I can say is what a fitting name for someone so strong and courageous and good to a fault. There are just too many profound moments in this book, which is why it is so important to read it and embrace it and hold it your heart always. I will read it again and again and in all likeliness love it even more than the first go round.  You have done it again Colleen. So proud of you, and grateful to be one of your biggest fans.
title: There are Simply No Words...

author: Kali S. Mason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover is one of my favorite authors so that is a disclaimer that I intend to love everything she writes. So far she has not steered me wrong. I avoided any teasers and blurbs because I like to soak it all in and just experience the mental journey she take me on. I was a bit frightened when I began reading this. I know she said it took a lot out of her to write how hard it was for her to get through writing it. So I had very high expectation. The first part of the book seemed like a departure from the typical CoHo book, yes there are attractive people who are perfectly flawed with great wit but it felt so romantic, I felt like I was watching a Nicholas Sparks movie, not bad but more on the sap side for CoHo. But then we get to the second half and she rips your heart out and leaves it pumping on the floor and all you can do is stare and it because there are no words for the emotions that she takes you through. I feel every tug of the heart strings, every angry vibration of rage, the utter sadness ,the hope the fear ,the laughter, it is all there in only 373 pages. I don't know she does it each and every time but she does. It takes a special mind and person to feel so deeply and be able to express it and Colleen Hoover is a very special person. I leave you to finish bawling.
title: Perfection

author: A Romantic Journey Book Blog
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2016
review_content: So, I've been a HUGE fan of Colleen Hoover Ever since I read "Hopeless". Every book since has never been a let down. So, reading this book, I went into knowing it would be a great read. However, I didn't realize how GREAT it actually would be. Nor did I realize that it'd knock out so many of the other incredible books that I've read so far in my life.This book had me in tears, laughing until my sides hurt, yelling at the pages, cradling the book to my chest with a sigh.So, I started reading this while I was at an appointment. I read one chapter (I'd actually been interrupted while reading it by a woman talking to me about the effect this book had on her) and I had to close the book after that single chapter. Not because it wasn't good, but because it was THAT good. It gave me enough to know that the ride my time was just about to go through.Life happened and it took a couple days before I could pick the book up again. However when I did, I read from Chapter Two to the author note. I couldn't put it down. Nor did I want to adult at all while I read it.Lily is so much of a realistic character that your heart seems to beep in rhythm with hers. With every up and down, you feel every bit of her confusion, pain, happiness, sadness...Ryle makes you swoon with his honesty and his drive to be best he can be.Atlas... ohhhh Atlas, you fall for him before he's even more than just a boy from Lily's past.As the whole story unfolds... I don't think I've cried so much reading a book. I was so torn between who I wanted Lily with. My husband heard a lot about this book as I was reading it. When Lily finally makes her decision, my heart shattered and soared at the same time. I don't know - even now - how my heart survived through this book.I'd love to hear more from these characters only because I'm so attached to them all. I just wanted the book to never end, but then I wanted to know how things worked out for all involved. This book was just simply... Life Affirming.If you've not read this book, I strongly recommend it. The reality behind this 'story' is sadly one that many face in silence and even more never fully understand their decisions behind it all. A DEFINITE MUST READ!
title: Wow, NEVER expected to feel like this after reading... AMAZING!

author: Litto
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019
review_content: Wow. The author writes this story in such a way that I was actually able to have a deeper and greater understanding of why women can find it so hard to leave their abuser.  This story was so very relavent in my life right now as my sister is struggling in an abusive marriage. I have become so frustrated with her that she won't leave him. After reading through this book, I could see the difficulty these women can face. The author portrays Ryle in way that she almost shouldn't! I found myself liking him and hoping he would change. I have read 6 books total this summer inluding Where the Crawdads sing, The Nightingale, the Great Alone, etc. But overall this is the one that stood out. I still have it on my mind and would recommend it to many.
title: Best book I have read all summer

author: Sandy Farmer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2016
review_content: Colleen Hoover always makes her books so hard to review without spoiling anything. It's a blessing and a curse. I'll say up front that It Ends With Us isn't my favorite Colleen Hoover book, but she pulled out all the feels from me and I ended up crying. Actual tears. It's not easy to make me cry, but Colleen Hoover has done it more than once.It Ends With Us starts out on a roof top where Lily meets Ryle (I STILL HAVE NO IDEA HOW TO PRONOUNCE HIS NAME which is a bit of a pet peeve of mine). The two have both had traumatic days for different reasons and begin to talk. Because they're complete strangers they find it easy and refreshing to be completely honest with each other in what they call "naked truths." I liked that these two had a connection one night but then didn't see each other again for quite some time. Ryle helps give Lily the inspiration and motivation she needed to leave the job she had at a marketing firm to start her own business--a floral shop.As part of the overall story, Lily finds and re-reads some journals that she wrote back when she was fifteen years old. I didn't love that the journal entries were written in the form of letters to Ellen Degeneres. I mean that made them unique, but also a little annoying to me. Ellen is hilarious so I can kind of understand the need to try to bring in some humor to the weightiness of the story, but that didn't quite translate as Ellen herself wasn't really present. It also served as a flashback to give Lily's backstory and setup for events to come. I'm not always a fan of flashbacks and I found myself sighing (not in a good way) when these sections came up at first, but the further into the book I got the more I wanted to know how her journals would end.It Ends With Us is a good bit different from all of Colleen Hoover's other books. In the most obvious way I can't really discuss due to spoiling, but what is the same is that I really did feel everything that Lily feels. I felt her excitement with a new relationship, the nostalgia from her past, the hurt and frustration from being let down, the confusion and battle of head versus heart. It Ends With Us is a story of gray areas and how quickly you can find yourself in the exact position you thought you of all people would never be in. And if you read the author's note at the end (read only after finishing the book) then you'll see how deeply personal It Ends With Us was for Colleen Hoover. This was a story that needed to be told.I laughed, I cried. I shook my head. I predicted. Even though It Ends With Us wasn't my favorite Colleen Hoover book, I still have to give it 5 Stars because she put me through the entire course of emotions. Any time a book can actually make me cry it deserves those 5 Stars. Have you read It Ends With Us? What did you think? Let me know!PS I appreciated that this was a less physically descriptive book than the last couple that she's done as well.
title: 5 Stars - And this isn't even my favorite Colleen Hoover book

author: cspicer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2016
review_content: Lily am amazing girl grows into an amazing woman. She watched the horror of her mother and fathers relationship and still maintains herself. She meets a wonderful boy in Atlas and they find each other lose each other but never really lose each other. She meets Ryle I loved him until I didn't. I love his sister and her husband. The characters are amazing, this book is phenomenal. It is life changing.On a personal note Colleen Hoover gives us courage and hope. She is brave and bold. She takes risks and tells a wonderful, sad, heartbreaking and beautiful tale. This is not your typical book and is is real and raw. Thank you for writing this, thank you for showing us  something that you don't see repeatedly thank you for the way you explain this and help us to see. I too don't understand our didn't understand why people would stay in this but you helped me to see and understand more.I grew up in an emotionally abusive home where you always felt worthless and scared to hear what you would get called next. Not the same as physical abuse but just as emotionally scarring. It's a vicious cycle as it's what you grow up with and expect. Changing those expectations is hard and not allowing that behavior in your life is harder. I still get scared when people yell and I freeze when people yell at me. Fight or flight kicks in and I shut down. I'm not going to shut down anymore. I'm going to FIGHT thank you to authors like you and Tarryn for giving us hope and love that we will be understood and supported which is something we may not find in other places. <3
title: Amazing, thought provoking, emotional wreck of a novel

author: Nicola Veri
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2021
review_content: This is by far the the best book I have ever read. I didn't expect this book to affect me in the way that it did. I wish everyone could read this book and feel everything that Lily (the main character) does. I have never been this deeply affected by any book EVER. If I had to pick a book to recommend to my best friend, sister, mother, or literally anyone else, it would be this book. I genuinely can't begin to describe how this book made me feel. Most definitely a 5/5 star and the best book ever.
title: AMAZING, EVERYONE SHOULD READ

author: Darby Readz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2016
review_content: One of the best books I've ever read. It was hard to read at times. I wanted Lily to forgive Ryle, but at the same time I recognized in my own mind that I didn't forgive him and he really didn't deserve the love of such a great woman.I found myself full of compassion for Ryle. He was a great man. Even after reading his actions my heart still bleeds for him. He was such a complex person with justifications for his faults. But as I've learned in my own life, it doesn't matter the reason when our happiness and wellbeing and that of our children are at stake. As mothers we're responsible for raising our children in a loving and safe environment. And sometimes when we search hard enough or when we're lucky we are able to do so and have love.This books should be read! It was beautiful truth of something so many women face in different degrees. And I would recommend it a hundred times over even though my heart feels heavy after just finishing it.I am in awe of Colleen's ability to tell such a fantastic, emotional, and relevant story. Truly inspiring!
title: Sooooo freaking good!

author: lenna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
review_content: Loved this book. Loved all the characters and loved the ending. It’s not very often I agree with romantic endings but this one I agree with even though my heart is sadden for one of the characters. This book was about domestic violence in a relationship. And it gave the perspective of the person being abused. I’ve been on the one to think how could you love someone who hurts you and it wasn’t that bad he’s gorgeous and has everything going for him but you know deep down it may get worse. It’s about the struggle someone goes through to ultimately make the decision to leave or not. LOVED THE BOOK. Sexy characters, great story, flowed really well,  Made me cry and LAUGH!  I would read it again!
title: Great book!

author: Kristine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: WOW...I'm speechless.I love Colleen Hoover and I love all her books but I can't even begin with this one. Yes, I loved it but it gutted me at the same time.The less you know about this book the better going into it. I didn't read the synopsis or a single review before diving in. It definitely enhanced my enjoyment. Therefore, I will not discuss the actual plot and what it was about.I have always said that Hoover has an unbelievable talent for evoking emotion and making me feel every little thing along with the characters in her books. She has that special something that makes me feel her characters unlike anyone else. It was never more evident than it was in this book.It Ends With Us is going to sit with me for a long time. I never truly understood what a book hangover was until I finished it. Fans will love this book and this book will create new fans too.I loved this book. If you haven't read it yet, what are you waiting for? 384 pages reads like less than 200. I finished it half a day. I highly recommend it to fans of the genre or anyone with a pulse. It's that good and will stay with me for a very long time.
title: Incredible!

author: O
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2016
review_content: This book crawled inside of me and hugged my soul. Everything about the story itself, as well as the characters, is very powerfully eye opening!  If there has ever been a question in your mind as to how domestically abusive relationships get as far as they do, or why exactly women stay with their abusers then you absolutely have to read this book! It Ends With Us is absolutely capable of pulling emotions out of you that you didn't even know was possible. Colleen Hoover has mastered the art of developing a personality in such detail that you can't help but to relate on the most personal of levels.Everything about us humans is uncovered, leaving our otherwise hidden fragile underbellies exposed for the world to see what were capable of.  The beautiful, the nasty, the love, the hate, and even overwhelming confusion isn't merely portrayed in this book, but its felt. On. Every. Level. It's an outstanding love story within a love story within a love story.Lily, the main character, (written in first person) is no stranger to domestic violence. She grew up in an abusive home. Not so much toward herself, but to her mother.  She watched first hand as her mother was beaten regularly by her father. As an adult Lily is independent and determined to live her life exactly opposite of her mother.The men who weave themselves into her life (and her heart) are strong-willed powerful men. Both of them have overcame their own childhood struggles. They've grown into driven, successful beings, and their interactions with Lily are both unique and equally authentic. Lily feels her love AND other emotions, on a level that's so intense it becomes borderline overwhelming. Talk about a page turner!This is hands down the best book I have read in at least a year or two. Not only will I recommend it, but I will nag all of my friends until they have all read it, because if I don't have someone to talk to about it then I might die.  I'm bursting at the seams with emotion and if it were possible to give a book 6 out of 5 stars then this would be that book!
title: This book crawled inside of me and hugged my soul.

author: Thuperduper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2018
review_content: First off, I hate when people say, "Everyone needs to read this book" but seriously, EVERYONE NEEDS TO READ THIS BOOK. It deals with the important topic of domestic violence and answers the question that everyone seems to have for people involved in an abusive relationship, "Why don't you just leave??"I read this book near the time of it's release and I still think about it and remember it vividly. I'm not really a fan of Colleen Hoover but I'll read her books if I want an easy, quick story. After reading this however, I can't even enjoy her other books because this one is leaps and bounds above the others. If you pick up one Colleen Hoover book, make it this one.
title: Unforgetable and Powerful

author: Jujulove17
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: It's hard to try to put into words what I'm feeling right now. There's very few books that have moved me as much as this one and I read A LOT! I'm still in shock that a book has caused so many emotions. I don't want to say too much because I wouldn't want to spoil it for anyone. Let me just say, that I get it now. I get why everyone made a huge deal about this book. I get why people are getting copies for their daughters that aren't old enough to to read it yet and I get why you would want everyone you know to read. For a book to give you all the feels when you have never even dealt in real life with the situation is amazing. I have two daughters and as soon as they are old enough I will have them read this. If you've been waiting because you are unsure you want to read it or you just think it's all hype, I urge you to read it. The conflicting  emotions I had while reading even confused me. What would I do in that situation? And all I could think is that anyone could be Lily. With that being said go download it! The paperback is on sale! So worth it💕 #TheTearsWontStop #MyHubbyIsConfused #WhatAGreatBookWillDoToYou #ItEndsWithUs #CollenHoover #books #bookstagram #booksofinstagram #bookshelf #NewRelease #Oneclick now #ibooks #amazon
title: Amazing

author: HKK1204
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2016
review_content: I think there might be something wrong with me. I did not like this book as much as a lot of other people seemed to. Don't get me wrong, Colleen Hoover is one of my favorite authors in this genre and because of that I have a certain level of expectation when I read her books. For example, in a large percentage of her other books that I have read she always surprises me - she always turns the story in a way that I never expected and I love that. That didn't happen for me here - I knew she would leave Ryle and I knew she would go back to Atlas. A surprise would have been finding someone completely new. As a reader I love books that bring about emotion - this one didn't do that for me. I have read books that have made me laugh out loud and books that have made me cry and I didn't have any heightened emotions when I read this story. I liked the story, even though the subject matter was very heavy, and it was very well written (which I expect from a Colleen Hoover story) but I just didn't connect with it like I was hoping that I would.
title: Just okay for me

author: kelly Dempsey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2016
review_content: As is typical of this amazing author, her story grabs you by the arm a drags you in so fast that you can't even remember when you started. I had no clue what the story was about or where it would go because the plot summary was left intentionally vague. I took a leap of faith, knowing I wouldn't be disappointed, but about a third of the way in, I wanted out!! This couldn't be where she was taking me!  This was too heartbreaking!! Please don't let this happen to Lily! But, I couldn't put it down. I was so invested that I HAD to know what would happen. I'm so glad I finished it. The respect I have for this author, the woman who inspired it, and all the Lily's of the world is inexplicable. This book is best read with no spoilers,  and I will stay true to that plan. Thank you for sharing this journey.
title: This book gutted me!

author: Angelicashops
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2017
review_content: It was too cheesy for me. Spoiler allert, don't read if you are planning to read it= I got it because of all the good reviews but seriouslya handsome neurosugeon that is single falls in love with the girl at first sight, etc, etc, I don't want to spoil it for you, but everything is so full of clitches and so predictable... The only positive thing about it is that it exposes the reality of domestic violence. Other than that, it is not worth reading... unless you like chick books that are super cheesy.
title: Too cheesy and predictable

author: Andrew Brunson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2019
review_content: This is one of my favorite Colleen Hoover books! It is deep and sensitive to very real issues and will pull every single one of your heart strings. As with all of her other books, I read it in one sitting. I couldn’t put it down. After finishing the story, I read that she had based the idea of the book off of her mom’s experience and she further discussed how her own personal connection to the story influenced this and that piece of knowledge deepened my respect and love for this book even further. Read this book!!!
title: Buy it. Devour it. You won’t regret it!

author: Kia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2016
review_content: I had recently went on a Coho binge and I read November 9 and Confess back to back. Besides those two, I’ve also read Ugly Love. This book. THIS book was easily my favorite by her tied with Confess.This book is not one that I will go into detail on, just because I don’t think I should or need to. But I do want to talk about this book and how I experienced it.The description of this book tell you nothing. It seems cute and fluff and seems like it will be an adorable romance read. This book though, is nothing of the such! There are so many people who haven’t read this book that still need to read this book so I’m gonna keep this short!I started reading and this story and like Colleen’s other stories, this started out giving me butterflies! I thought it was awesome that her characters seemed a little older and they seemed to be headed in the right direction! I fell in love with the progress of the present story, and I became a bit…weary of the past tense story.* As the story progressed, there was a point where everything shifted and changed and everything was different. After that, I knew this one was going to be something to remember.This book took me to a places that I wasn’t ready to go to! And I don’t mean that in a bad way! I planned on getting my review for this one done way sooner, but I am still having trouble with getting my thoughts out because there’s so many!I cannot personally relate to the events that happened in this book, but this book hit me so hard and wouldn’t let me get up. I’ve done countless papers and many have revolved around this subject and the statistics that I continue to find are more than devastating. There were times when I had to go back and reread entire pages because I was in denial about what I read. There were so many things that I wasn’t expecting and so many things that shocked the hell out of me.The characters were incredible and Lily is one of the strongest characters I’ve ever met! She was one of my favorite character’s that Colleen has created and you see her having to adapt throughout the book.Although this is a work of fiction, she based it on truth and the issues in this book happen all too often and it’s something that needs a remedy in time. Through this work, Colleen was able to paint a picture that not many people are able to see. I’m glad that she was the one to publish this book that could reach so many people and because of that, I have a new love for her!I was thoroughly surprised by this novel and I’m entirely grateful and thankful that Colleen has written this because it needed to be written! If you haven’t read this one, you need to read it!*by weary I mean worried and if you’ve read it, or when you read it, you’ll know exactly what I mean. Angst.
title: This was perfection and one for the records!

author: Lola
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2018
review_content: Wow, jumped into this book not knowing anything but what the summary stated.... I was captured within the first page of Colleen Hoover's writing. I could not put this book down. The way she writes just flows and I became Lily and felt everything she felt. This is one of the best novels I've read this year. Loved! Beware, this is a heart wrencher.Minor SPOILERS ahead:I fell in love with Atlas... And can we have a moment of silence for the man that is Atlas! ...... One of the best males characters I've read!Then I grudgingly fell in love with Ryle (I mean, can you blame her?)...Then the rest of the book is pretty gut wrenching which sucked because I was floating on air during the Atlas parts in Lily's journal. I think CH did an amazing job writing Lily's journals in the perspective of a 16 year old teenager. It completely took me back to high school when I first fell in love. A lot of times, narrators that are young can be so annoying but this was so well written!! My favorite parts has to be Atlas and Lily's friendship and love.... so sweet. *fake cries*This book has a lot of triggers dealing with domestic violence. I loved that the characters are not all black/ all white, but realistic. It is a heavy topic, heavy love, but so superbly executed, I'm so glad I read it. Having dealt with domestic violence myself, I felt that Colleen really nailed the experience that some women go through.Can't wait to read the rest of her books!
title: BEAUTIFULLY written!

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2016
review_content: The Feels:I am always partial to Colleen Hoover. Always. So when the pre-sale for this book opened up with nothing more than a title and author I blindly pre-ordered expecting nothing short of magic. I was not disappointed. This book is like nothing she has ever written ever before. Ever. Yes- ever. I may have mentioned a few times that I love going into books blind (at least as much as possible- sometimes this doesn't work in my favor lol see my post from Friday) and with this one I didn't even read the blurb on the back. It was a beautiful and amazing surprise. CoHo is always so good at ripping out your heart and making you wonder what the heck you just read and then she puts you back together again so you're willing to read the next book she comes out with and this book is no exception. Although I feel like instead of ripping out my heart she just gouged it and left it to bleed out slow and messy. I seriously want to just go on and on about what happened and how I felt but I don't believe in spoilers so I won't. Just know your heart will feel this one and it will feel it deep and for a long time. The magical unicorn of writing that is Colleen Hoover continues on the tradition of putting work out there that not only makes a reader feel but makes them WANT to feel. The characters are alive and real and I for one have maybe bumped Maybe Someday down to my number 2 favorite CoHo book. I feel like there is nothing else I can say other than buy this book. Do it right now. Drop everything you're doing and go buy it.My Recommendation:At this point in today's post I feel like I've made my self very clear but if not- 10 stars out of 5. Yes my friends- CoHo has broken the scale! So in case you missed it- BUY THIS BOOK NOW!
title: 10 Stars out of 5

author: Shelby B. Skaggs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2016
review_content: I had no idea what this book was about when I started reading it. I did not read the previews or check online to read snippets. I just knew that Colleen Hoover writes amazing books and I needed to read her latest. I am completely blown away by this story. I thought as an outsider reading, Lily was a strong woman from the beginning with a heart of gold in the way she treated Atlas. I loved the way her journal writing was done as I am a big fan of Ellen. I loved Ryle, even though I mispronounced his name all thru the book. I actually could feel his disparity in not knowing how to handle his anger. I can only imagine loving someone like him, knowing it would not last. I loved Alyssa for loving him but knowing he needed to fix himself before he could love someone else. And Atlas, bless his heart for overcoming his younger life to find his place in the world, and always being Lily 's person. For anyone who has gone thru something similar, I hope you know how strong you are and That sometimes it's better to love someone, but not be in a relationship with that person. I would love to give this book more than 5 stars...it is just that good.
title: I am speechless!

author: Wendy LeGrand
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2016
review_content: It Ends With Us was one of the most difficult books I've ever read, but it was also one of the most beautifully crafted stories I've ever experienced.  I didn't just read this book, I felt every single sentence all the way to my heart and soul.  I couldn't put it down even though there were plenty of times I just wanted to walk away and forget it.  But I can't forget it.  I'll never be able to forget it.  It is one of those books that makes you step back and evaluate life, not just your own but everyone's.I have always been a people watcher, it's one of my most favorite pastimes, watching someone and imagining their story and what their life is like.  But now that I've read this book, I look at every single person in a completely different light.  I no longer just wonder what their career is, or where they've traveled in the world or what their house or car looks like.  I wonder if their lives have turned out the way they thought they would.  Are they happy and in love and in a relationship with the man or woman of their dreams?  Or did their dreams get shoved in the back of the closet with their old journals, only to be taken out when they're feeling melancholy and want to reminisce?I'm not even quite sure how to end my review, other than to say that I haven't been this affected by a book in a really long time.  I have nothing but mad love and respect for Colleen Hoover for tackling an extremely difficult subject but more so for the brilliant way she wrote it and how she pulled me completely into the story and into Lily's head.  I'll be thinking about this book for longer than I probably really want to but it's left a lasting impact on me.  I love you, Colleen!!
title: A beautifully crafted story that will make you step back and look at life in a whole new light.

author: IllinoisGirl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2017
review_content: It's rare to find a mainstream romance that is as well written as this book. I don't mean just in terms of prose, although that is solid. But the story and characters have lives that don't revolve around attraction and desire, although there is plenty of both. The heroine, Lily, grows up in an abusive home and forms a relationship with a homeless boy who helps her deal with her home life. Most of this is back story, and while I usually am not a fan of the diary as backstory, it works here, in part because the author is clever, but also she resists the temptation to dump lots of extraneous detail into the "diary." The heart of the story is Lily's relationships with the homeless boy (who is now grown up and doing well) and a handsome, wonderful doctor. Lily must confront her abusive past after it rears up in her adult life, which she does through love and the help of her friends and family. I really cared about Lily and both the "heroes."
title: Well Done

author: Ange
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: I was really excited to read this book especially since Hoover writes the main character only a year or so in age difference to myself. While I want to leave an honest review I feel as though I have to give a warning about a spoiler alert. During my reading of the novel, despite feeling compelled to finish the book, at times it felt like I was reading a fanfiction off of the famous site Wattpad. Not to mention how one of the plot twist in the book is terribly similar to one of that from the popular medical drama Grey's Anatomy. One of the main love interest seems as though he is based off of Derek Shepard? Dreamy blue eyes? A neurosurgeon? I mean could she have been more obvious about it? The relationships are all based on sex and college hookup culture as well as unrealistic. A read nonetheless but pick something with more of a plot.
title: Similar to a Wattpad fanfiction

author: Dawn G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: Infinity of Stars Review (no spoilers)Wow!  Where the heck do I start?  I haven't read a Coho book in quite a while because I haven't had much time, however I REALLY wanted to read this one & boy am I glad I did.  I went in blind.  I didn't read any reviews, teasers or the blurb.  Never have I ever done that before but let me just say, that was the BEST decision ever!  You do not want to know what this story is about, just go & READ It.  The emotions I felt all throughout this book were insane.  I smiled, I laughed out loud, I felt the heartache (literally) & I cried.  Oh boy did I cry. But please don't let that scare you away.  Normally it scares the ever loving crap out of me, but I really wanted to see how this book was different & what all the hype was about.  This book was AMAAAAAZEBALLS GOOD!  So so good!  I finished it at 4:30 am & I'm still reeling from what all happened.  IEWU is close to Colleen's heart & now I know why.  You are awesome Colleen!  I seriously can't imagine writing something like that because of the emotions you go through.  Thank you for giving us this awesome story!  I don't know what else to say really.  Just read the book people!  You will understand in the end.
title: Amazing, emotional, beautiful story!

author: Funkycez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2016
review_content: First of all I would like to thank Ms. Colleen Hoover for writing this book.  She's written so many amazing book but not in the same plot as this one.  This is close to many women's and men's heart because of the fact that it discusses what happens in real life.  Just like what she said, this is by no means a book about how an abusive person is supposed to be.  This is a book about how a person made a decision to end what an unfortunate thing she's dealing with."Cycles exist because they are excruciating to break. It takes an astronomical amount of pain and courage to disrupt a familiar pattern. Sometimes it seems easier to just keep running in the same familiar circles, rather than facing the fear of jumping and possibly not landing on your feet."Most of us judge too easily when we hear or witness a person being abused.  It's easy for us to say that why can't they just leave or report it to the authorities, but we are not the one dealing with that problem.  For people in abusive relationship, some of them becomes to the person who abuses them and in most cases, they don't have any means to support themselves and no other choice but to stay with the person who is abusing them.With this book, Lily showed that she doesn't want to continue the cycle anymore and made the decision base on what her daughter will go through.  Not necessarily that Emerson will follow the same path, but by removing that situation around her helps her in not having to deal with a situation that Lily went through.  Ryle loves her and she's his world but that love will not solve all the problems in the world especially if it involves hitting someone.  Lily made a conscious thought of making her life and her daughter's life better by staying away from an awful situation.I do hope that anyone who reads this book who are in the same situation to think about what Lily did, even if not to follow what she did to be away from a relationship that hurts her.  At least the readers will be able to think that yes, every single one of us can stop the cycle and make it better for ourselves and the people around us.
title: Brilliant

author: Swat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2019
review_content: I loved this book! I was a little hesitant about it when I first bought it after reading some of the reviews but it blew away all my expectations. Colleen Hoover knows how to get her reader hooked. I was thinking about Lily even when I was at work! I couldn't read it fast enough!Lily's personal turmoil and her strength were both heartwarming and heartbreaking. I just wanted to see her have a stable and happy life. And for a few days, weeks, and months, she would. But, then it would all change into anguish and sadness. But that's how life works, I suppose. What a powerful and candid portrayal of abuse and how it shapes children and their lives as adults. I would recommend this book to anyone!
title: Here's a naked truth

author: Crossroad Reviews
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2016
review_content: I always start Colleen's books without knowing anything about them. I just dive in and start reading. So once I figured out that book was about domestic abuse I was even more interested. This is by far one of my favorite books by Hoover. I myself was in an abusive marriage years ago. And I can say leaving for me was one of the hardest things I've done. I had a two year old daughter to keep safe. It all came to a head when we had a very large fight and I ended up in the ER with a bruised back. That was my limit. Lucky for me I had my mom and grandma to fall back on.Being abused by someone you love is one of the worst things to experience and leaving them is a very hard choice. I really loved that this book covered so much of what these women and men go through.This book will fill your heart with love and then blow it all to hell. Just to have you fall in love again.  Lily and Ryle go through so much. And I felt for them though each page I read.  Both characters were so head strong and the story was so heart ripping!I was almost at the end of this one and thought I was going to get out of crying. Ya I was so wrong. As the last few pages concluded I could feel the tears start to stream down my face. Ya I'm a sap lol. I would have to say that out of all the stories I've read by Hoover that this one is flawless.'What determines a person's character aren't the mistakes we make.  It's how we take those mistakes and turn them into lessons rather than excuses'
title: Best one yet!

author: Amazon groupie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2016
review_content: She's BAAAACK!!! I have read everything that Colleen has ever published and I thought Maybe Someday is one of her best and one of my all time favorites. But after Maybe Someday, I felt the other books she put out were mediocre at best. Ugly Love, November 9th and Never, Never (only read 2 parts couldn't force myself to buy the third part) were written to either satisfy the publisher and or keep the money flowing in. There were not bad books but I doubt I would ever reread them again and would not recommend them.I always pre-purchase her books and usually look forward to reading them but after the last 3, It Ends With Us sat in my kindle for over a month and a half before I made time to even glance at it. I was hooked from the first. Just like when I read Maybe Someday and Hopeless, I got emotionally involved in the book. I immediately finished it and reread it again - I liked it that much!  I'm not one for giving a synopsis of the book I just give a review on how I felt about the book and a general overview.  It is a romance book, but just like HOPELESS it is so much more.  I like how Hoover takes a situation that you might have never experience yourself and give you a glimpse of how it feels so that you are empathetic and not just sympathetic to the character and to her/his situation.I told a friend of mine who doesn't read romance books the storyline and the plot and she immediately was like "wow, there's a lot going on in that book".
title: She's Back!!! & "There's a lot going on in this book"

author: Rebecca Thompson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2016
review_content: ......I ordered your book for myself and two of my very best friends so we could read it together (It was my attempt at starting a book club with them since we all live in different states).  I finished the book a few days ago and I am having a hard time expressing how beautifully written it was.  I have been waiting for the book since you started writing about it's release.Here is what I know:1.  I could not breathe through the book.  I would find myself holding my breath, needing and wanting to know what happened next, yet fearful at the  same time.  Knowing what should happen, yet also knowing how most of these true life events turn out.2.  You are amazing at creating characters that your readers connect to.  You make us love them, want to know them, become them as we read.3.  I had a fear of finishing because I didn't want the disappointment of being done reading (and failing to find another book that compares).  I will  also admit there was a part of me that feared the ending.4.  You are brave and bold for writing this book, expressing your love through this book.5.  You are courageous and real.  That is what makes me love you and your books.  I connect with your books and characters.  I think many of  your readers do as well.6.  Finally, I made my daughters (ages 15 & 16) read your book.  I felt it was important for them to know the message as well.Your love for writing and your characters shine through in all of your books, but "It Ends With Us" punches you in the gut with the truth and makes you think about and feel every emotion that is brought to the pages of your book.
title: Gives you all the feels......Love, Joy,Heartache.  It was perfect.

author: Jaclyn Rosamond
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2020
review_content: No spoilers!! I read this book without reading any reviews – unusual for me. I read the blurb and it didn’t grab me. But, this book kept arriving in my emails from Amazon as a story I might like, and I took a chance on buying it. And it was so worth it! Colleen Hoover wrote an unforgettable story, full of painful truth and conflicting emotions, tenderness and tears. The story took me on an emotional roller coaster, through glued-to-my-seat rip-roaring fury to laughter, sadness and elation. Colleen tackles a tough issue with a deft hand, inspired by personal experience, portraying characters I fell in love with. Highly recommended.
title: Brilliant! A rare and unforgettable story.

author: Emma
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
review_content: I didn't like the book, the topic that writer tries to bring up is certainly important given prevalence of partner abuse, however a lot of descriptions of Ryle don't really match to reality and are very contradicting (being doctor myself), and I feel like that topic could be have researched more prior to writing about it. Overall plot seems very simple, and is full of details of their intimate life/sex which probably could have been in less abundance.It's an easy read though, you will finish it in less than two days.
title: Not worth it

author: SDuran
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2016
review_content: This book..... I don't even know where to start other than WOW.  Just wow.  This is only my second Colleen Hoover book and I have to say, it sucked me in.  The writing was done in such a way that I could see it.  I could see the characters, smell the cookies and feel the emotions.  I loved Lily (also my daughter's name, but I loved this Lily too!).  I loved the little pieces of her that made her real.  I absolutely loved that she wrote to Ellen instead of "Diary" or "Journal".  The way we got to see her first love with Atlas through the journal while she was developing a relationship with Ryle was perfect.  I got to fall in love with them both right along with her.  I could feel how torn she was when things started to go badly.  I also grew similar to Lily so being able to relate to what she was seeing and hearing was instant and so powerful.  I don't want to give anything away, it's so much better that way.  When I started this book, I only knew that it was the most personal book that Colleen Hoover had written so far, and that made it that much better to experience the story all on my own.  When I read the last line, I wanted to know more about what happens after the hug, and if they each find love.  So hopefully there will be another story with characters for us to journey with.  Even though I wanted to know more, I still had a smile (and tears!).  I still felt the ending was great.  I loved how little pieces came full circle and little details didn't slip away.Phenomenal book! Oh!  And I'm from Maine!!  <3
title: This one will stay with me

author: bex graham
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2016
review_content: If I had a superpower in this moment of time I would use it to find words to describe the absolute storm of emotions this amazing book left me with. But I'm not a superhero (though I do have seven kiddos and today I got them to clean like 2/3s of our house so I'm feeling pretty heroic) so I'm left here, tongue-tied and speechless. Physically feeling this book down to my core. My heart feels a little heavier, my mind feels pulled in a million different directions, and I'm finding it hard to even get through this day. I've texted my book sisters who have read it so we could discuss & process, I've also reached out to some of my girlfriends who aren't big readers to tell them that THIS IS THE ONE... this is the one you pick up and read cover to cover, rather you're "just not that into reading" or not. This book is the exception. I want every woman I know, and every woman I love to read these powerful, inspiring words.I went into this book blind, without reading a synopsis. Which was hard to do as much as everyone was talking about it. But I mean who needs a synopsis when you've got Colleen Hoover at the wheel. I put my heart in her hands, praying she would return it in its original condition. And holy s***, while it does feel like it has been completely put through the ringer today, it also feels fuller, stronger and ready to take on almost anything.I don't want to give anything away about this book. I want only to tell you that I finished it last night at 2am. I was up until 4am with my mind racing and heart pounding, processing everything I had just read. When I woke up this morning this first thing that I did was stick a couple of post-its to cover a couple of the more graphic scenes, then I handed to the book to my daughter (15). I can't wait to discuss it with her, I won't rest until every woman I know reads this beautiful, powerful book.Thank you for this gift Colleen. And BRA-VO!
title: ... words to describe the absolute storm of emotions this amazing book left me with

author: S. J. Knox
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2021
review_content: Wow, if you have not had the pleasure of reading one of Colleen Hoover books, do yourself a favor and get one to read. This particular book is so full of heartbreak, emotions, tears and also happiness. It's so powerful, I could not put it down and read it in one day. If you have been or are in an abusive relationship, it may trigger some emotions for you, just as a warning.  Every one of her books that I have read so far have taken me on an incredible emotional journey.
title: OMG! What a story!

author: Heather
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: This is going to be a difficult review to write without giving any spoilers. So forgive me for being vague and just trust me when I tell you to read the book. (In fact, stop reading reviews and buy the book now. You'll thank me later.) I learned so much about (enter specific noun here) from this book. I got to read this one early, so I knew to buy 3 copies to give as gifts with the recipients already in mind. This is that kind of book. You'll want to share it with EVERYONE. I can't say what I really want to say here about her wicked talent, but Colleen Hoover was able to make the characters unlike any you've read in a book before. That sounds, well, vague, but you'll get it WHEN YOU READ THE BOOK.I need to say a huge THANK YOU to the author: Thank you for writing this book. Thank you for the insight and clarity and peace you've brought to me. Colleen, I believe that this book is the reason you were given your gift of writing. The amount of people you will heal and comfort with IEWU will be astounding. Just wait and see.Now, reader, GO READ THE BOOK. :) You're welcome.
title: Astounding! Please read this book!

author: Lonestar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
review_content: To be honest, I’m a bit disappointed after finishing the book. I bought the book because of the high ratings, only to find myself feeling awkward 3 quarters into reading. It’s hard to justify female character’s being overeating and infidelities. At that point, I totally split from author and suspected both female character and author have ptsd from democratic abuse. If the female character hadn’t ended up with that guy, I might well admit I was wrong. The ending needs to be rewritten to justify female character’s action. Marry somebody else.
title: A little disappointed..

author: AlohaD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2016
review_content: I had been anticipating this book for awhile. So much so that I pre-ordered my paperback so I could have it as soon as it came out. Unfortunately, Amazon still hasn't even mailed it, so I bought the kindle copy before the book could be ruined to me by all the other people reading the book and perhaps posting spoilers.Colleen Hoover books are, to me, best to go in blindly. But have an open mind that she will pull at your heart strings and perhaps introduce you to something new or maybe even something that could be a trigger (so in that sense, maybe there should be a slight warning). Regardless, this book just made me realized that Colleen can write any thing and make you question everything. There is not only black and white. There is not only vibrant colors. There is grey and everything in between and it all combines into something you may have never opened your eyes to before."No one is exclusively bad, nor is anyone exclusively good. Some are just forced to work harder at suppressing the bad."These characters...I rooted for them. I wanted happiness for them. I wanted to closure for them. I wanted the epic love story.Naked truth? I wanted Ryle to be the man Lily needed. Naked truth? I wanted Atlas to have an epic love story. Naked truth? I believed everything happened as it should because Lily was brave and bold.This was an eye-opening book that should be shared among all the generations. Understand your worth and understand there is always beauty even when you are fighting your demons and monsters. Life isn't easy and the decisions are even harder. What someone sees from the outside isn't what the inside is about.  You know the why, now how can you fix it? See? It's all discombobulated!Colleen, I know this book had to be a difficult one to write, but the passion you have inserted into this story and the characters had to be fulfilling, yet draining. A piece of you definitely was left in these characters and it shows. This journey was filled with so much love. It's just the fifteen minutes that killed me each and every time.  :("It's not a person's actions that hurt the most. It's the love. If there was no love attached to the action, the pain would be a little easier to bear."
title: Naked truths can save. 5 Bold and Brave stars!

author: Cybill Richey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
review_content: 10 STARSThere is just not a star rating high enough to justify this book. I am suffering from the worst kind of book hangover right now. I just can’t bring myself to pick up a new one. The story has been playing in my mind for 24 hours solid like a great movie you can’t forget. I have been gutted and angry. Struggling to find the words to explain this beautiful tragedy. I knew this would blow me away but I didn’t think I would feel such melancholy after finishing. I wanted everything to work out. I wanted it all to be a bad dream. Ryle and Lilly are very complex characters. When the world implodes my mouth hung open and I just couldn’t process what I had read but I could not stop. These pages became an addiction that I couldn’t feed fast enough. I just kept saying “no, no, no..the story doesn’t go this way” but there is no other way for it to go. A moving tale of understanding, love and strength. Surviving….the story will gut you, it will push and pull you and if you are like me it will break you. Phenomenal writing from a creative mind. The best book I think I will ever read.  “Just keep swimming” this book will shock you.
title: There are just not enough stars. This one broke me, this blogger is now broken.

author: glo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2020
review_content: *possible spoilers ahead*Loved the book in the beginning, seemed like it was going to go the direction of love triangle new love vs old love. I did NOT expect it to get as heavy and abusive as it did. Toward the end of the book its obvious that Ryle is basically a villain and should be arrested but at the end of the book it seems like all is fine and everyone is happy. Just, a really weird ending and conclusion to the terrible abuse that happened prior. I think the author could have kept the topic a little lighter if she wanted the conclusion to go that way OR keep the darker stuff but have a darker ending.
title: Heavier than I thought it was going to be

author: m0rgie16
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
review_content: So let me start by saying this book was not at all what I expected. I’m not entirely sure what I expected at all. I read reviews about a love triangle and cheating. I do not like love triangles. But this to me was not a love triangle. I also read a couple reviews saying Lily cheated but there was no cheating in the book so I’m not sure what was going on with those reviews lol.I did not get as emotional as I thought I would but I literally felt my heart break several times. I am not sure how to explain the feeling I had. This book was so heartbreaking.I was for sure going to give this book 4 stars but I was waiting on the ending to see if I’ll give it 5... The ending was probably the best ending to any book I have ever read. I didn’t cry much but the last 2 chapters I cried like a baby. I had just finished texting my friend about the book saying I didn’t cry much and I started bawling lol.This was my first Colleen Hoover book and I am looking forward to reading more of her books.
title: Naked Truth!

author: Mary Davis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2017
review_content: I gave this book 3 stars because I didn't hate it. I purchased it because of its 5-star rating by so many readers. After reading about 1/3 of the story, I was becoming bored and decided to read a few reviews to see why others had found this book so wonderful. The first few reviews convinced me that I should keep reading with the promise that I would not be disappointed. Well, I finished the book and I was very disappointed. While the content is adult oriented, the writing is shallow and simplistic. What a waste of my time!
title: This is no "novel"

author: BookNerdMomo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
review_content: "I think about how sometimes, no matter how convinced you are that your life will turn out a certain way, all that certainty can be washed away with a simple change in tide."You know those books you pick up that automatically give you a feeling that makes you think 'this book is going to change my life'? That was my first thought when I started It Ends With Us. This book was so powerful and it delivered an equally powerful message. It Ends With Us will destroy you and then it will put you back together. I'm actually struggling with what I want to write for this review because I can't even figure out how to put into words how incredible this book was and how much I loved it and how much it made me cry. I also can't stress enough the fact that you want to go into this book blind and this review isn't going to go in-depth about the book at all because it would be hard to do so without spoiling major plot lines.Everyone knows how much I love Colleen Hoover, she is my favorite author. I love her writing style and everything she writes is incredible. I haven't read a single book by her that I don't love. However, It Ends With Us is probably the best thing she has ever written. It is next level and shows just how much she has grown as an author. Throughout this whole book I found myself reacting to every little thing and feeling everything the characters were feeling, which I attributed to her incredible writing.  It also just kicked Maybe Someday out of my favorite book by Colleen spot. (And I really love Maybe Someday.)"There is no such thing as bad people. We're all just people who sometimes do bad things."The plot of this book is extremely character driven. To say much of anything about any of the characters would give away pretty much the whole book. I will say that I loved Lily and that she is officially my favorite out all of Colleen's characters in all of her books. She is such a strong character and in the end I was so incredibly proud of her. I cried so much for her and for Ryle and for Atlas and even Lily's mom. I think the only characters I didn't shed one tear over was Marshall and Allysa. (Who I loved too by the way.)I'm a firm believer in there being books out there that help you understand something about yourself you never knew or things that you thought you knew about yourself but were so wrong about. That is the biggest thing I took away from this book. The naked truth that the way I think I would act in a certain situation isn't how I would probably act. It stripped away all of my preconceived notations and rebuilt them into something else.  It made me think."It stops here. With me and you. It ends with us."It Ends With Us is unforgettable, powerful, shocking, realistic, and the naked truth. It's a story of love, yes, but it's also about the consequences of our actions and making the right choice no matter how hard it is.It's the kind of book where once you pick it up you won't want to put it down for anything and once you're finished it will stick with you forever.This book is the reason why Colleen Hoover is my favorite author and I want to thank her for sharing this story with all of us. It was brave and bold.It Ends With Us is officially my favorite book of 2016.
title: This book will change your life.

author: Maria Colon (chicks4books)
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
review_content: I rated it 5 stars on Goodreads and Amazon because that is the highest it would let me."Naked truths aren't always pretty." I laughed. I cried. I saw so much truth in this book that perfectly aligns with the aforementioned line. This book deals with an issue today that is not at the forefront of any political campaign. It is one that our society does note want to talk about. I have so many emotions floating around right now and I finished the book twenty minutes ago. This book is empowering. Within the first few pages, I was already highlighting lines or passages on my Kindle. This book deserves more than 5 stars. Lily falls for Ryle. Their personalities are so different but they are drawn together. But, Ryle's past comes forward in their relationship and it is one that Lily is not sure she can handle. Lily's past presents itself, too. Ryle cannot handle that. Ultimately, Lily has to decided what is best for her present and her future. I honestly cannot say anything more because when you read this book, you feel it in your soul. You finish this book a changed person.Review by Chicks4books BlogReviewer: Hope Wanderlust
title: "Naked truths aren't always pretty."

author: TacoSparkle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2016
review_content: I rarely write a review on a first read for Colleen Hoover, unlike everyone else the first time I read it I feel nothing. I read Hopeless without ever hearing of her and loved it. I tried the Slammed Series and loved it, then I got added to the Cohorts and while it’s amazing and beautiful in there its hell.  I read Ugly Love and felt let down, Confess first time I was so p*ssy, Novemeber 9 left me staring at my paper back. I laid it down and walked off, the same with Maybe Someday. I didn’t enjoy any of them. I text my best friend who is also an avid Coho reader and super fan. I cried while texting her, “What is wrong with me? Why can’t I love her books anymore?”We’ve talked this same conversation through dozens of times after every book. I always feel so detached. I know everyone feels everything and somehow I feel nothing. I have to let the hype die down, I have to let it all sink in and then go back and read it. Then I write my reviews because I love them, I feel them. I FEEL EVERYTHING. The hype has ruined every book since I got into the group. It’s no one’s fault but it happens.  Then this book comes along and we have no clue what it’s about. I read no teasers and looked past anything talking about it. I was so excited to read and guys I FELT NOTHING. I believe now my feels is broken. I don’t know why I can’t feel it. Then again this story hits very close to home for me except I never had the good guy in my corner, and I sort of think this one hits my emotions on a level I can’t feel anymore, I turned those off many years ago and I don’t even know if a second read is going to work. Colleen is a great writer with a vivid imagination. She is funny and kind and usually normal-ish, I love her. I love her books. I just can’t seem to like them. Well on a first read anyways. NOT HER FAULT. I’m going ahead and reviewing this book as a 5 star because I know it is, not because I felt it but because all her books have been a 5 star read for me (eventually), it’s not her fault this story line feels as though it could’ve been pulled from the depths of my own personal hell. In my story even Ryle would have been a good guy. I’m glad she wrote this and so many have flourished and healed from it. People need to write fiction about reality to give hopefulness where it’s truly needed. I hope my second read will prove my review correct and even if it doesn’t I know it’s my own messed up non therapy going problem. Continue to write beautiful words Mrs. Hoover-Fred Water and I will continue to read and hope one day I can feel this euphoric feeling everyone else does. It’s a slow process so be patient with me, I’m trying.P.s. I am not bipolar or off my meds (or rocker) it’s just really hard to put into words how reading makes me feel lately. You are amazing, just incase you didn’t figure that out in all that rambling.<< OK I may be off my rocker a tad if I think in 2k reviews you’re actually reading it, but hey it only takes one time.
title: Continue to write beautiful words Mrs. Hoover-Fred Water

author: Andrea
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2017
review_content: Finally decided to read this, usually into more thriller type books and I too questioned if I was going to be into this book but by page 9 I was hooked. I was giddy like a school girl reading about the beginning of Lily and Ryle. As Atlas was introduced I wanted to get back to Ryle ASAP but that changes thoughout the book, you start rooting for both guys in different ways and you know one has to lose. Out of all the books I've read lately, none of them developed their characters as well as this book and author did. It is a roller coaster, you will probably cry at the end and it will make you think about what you would do in that situation. It will make you view past and future situations differently for people in similar shoes and maybe be more compassionate. After reading the authors note at the end you can feel the emotion and intent she put into this book. Do not read that note til the end! Great book!
title: Wished it didn't end

author: BJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2018
review_content: It was an easy read, but I personally didn't like any of the characters or the story.
title: One Star

author: Charley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2017
review_content: I went into this novel with an open mind and a blank slate. I had no idea what the story was supposed to be about. I didn't even read the book description. The only thing I knew is that I love how Colleen Hoover puts words to paper.These characters hit very close to home for me. My mother was abused for years and also took control of her children's futures. She has endured and sacrificed so much to make my life better. I am thankful for her courage and for the point of view that this novel shares. I hope that people see (through Lily's world) that life is not always black and white. I hope that this reaches other individuals as touches their hearts as it has touched mine.Thank you Colleen and your mother for sharing your story.
title: This touched my heart...

author: Keyanna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: Readers are always looking for a book that is better than the last one. A book that will take them on a journey they've never been. A book that will absolutely change their life. For me, that search is over. For me, it ends with THIS.I am writing this review with tears streaming down my face and I am not afraid to let them fall. I am writing this review with a heart full of empathy and full of hope. I am writing this review a changed person. This book has changed me.This book is brave and bold. It is beauty and it is pain. I have read a lot of books in my life. More than I could ever try to count. But I can tell you right now at 4:04 in the morning on August 3rd, that this is the most beautiful book I have ever read in my entire life. I will not give away a single detail. You MUST go in blind and experience this yourself.If you do anything today, this week, this month, this year, all of your life, read this book. It will rock your world. It will be the shore you've been swimming to, the anchor you need to keep you grounded. And you will never forget it.
title: I Want To Be Colleen Hoover When I Grow Up

author: Noelia Gutierrez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020
review_content: Spoilers.....,I really liked this book. I was so happy Lily found Ryle. He was so cool...i loved his character.really feel in  love with his character.  I thought that he was a great book boyfriend. But then the incident happened and it broke my heart.  I though like Lily that it was just one time but then it happened again and i wanted her to divorce him and i was so sad that he wasn't the character i thought he was.  But i mean atlas was perfect from the beginning and he was throughout..he was great and patient and loving and protective.
title: Loved it

author: Elle G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
review_content: This book hit me like a ton of bricks. Its deep, it’s dark, it’s emotional. It has moments that will make readers laugh and it has moments that will make readers sob with everything in their being. I have never felt so touched by a book. I have never felt such an intimate and raw connection with characters. And I have never had a book come close to touching every inch of my soul. It Ends With Us is a story about bravery. It’s a book about being strong when you have nothing to keep you from collapsing. And, it’s the type of book you will never forget. I started reading in hopes that I would find that one book that would change my world. And Colleen Hoover, you did that with this one. With that being said, I am so glad my husband wasn’t home when I finished this book because I had a moment. A moment where my heart broke for everyone in the story and I had one of the ugliest cries ever. Jeez. This is just a must read and I hope that EVERYONE out in the world will read this book.I am not going to go into this review wit details about the plot because honestly, it will do no justice to this captivating story. But I will say this- if you’re looking for a book where the characters will enter your life and never leave your heart than you have to read this book. Colleen Hoover brought these characters to life and I have never felt like I actually lived through everything with the characters like I did when reading this one. I also cannot say enough good things about this because it is simply that beautiful. However, I will say that there will be moments when you absolutely HATE everyone in the story. Then you will have moments where you can’t possibly see them NOT being together. When this happens, just keep reading.This is by far my favorite book of 2016 and book 2 on my list of favorite books ever. Why? Because of the depth and the realness of it all. So do me a favor. If you haven’t read it? Buy it. And make sure you buy a paperback copy because you will want to always have this book close to your heart.Colleen Hoover, I congratulate you. I have no other words because of how much awe I am in over this book. You are the reason I pick up books in the first place, because I am always searching for something epic and have found it in this one.
title: :: 6 + Pretty Little Stars ::

author: Ashley Cestra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2017
review_content: I went into this story with pretenses. I was looking for an ugly read, one that ripped my soul in half. While I think I'm the minority here, It Ends With Us was not one of these stories. Yes, this story focuses on a sensitive topic in our society, but that's just it. Domestic violence happens. It is real. It is shameful. It is hurtful. Colleen Hoover took something that gets swept under the rug for a lot of people.. wrote about the very thing that affected her life personally.  Whether it be to bring awareness, or to just get her voice out there, she did it. She used specific details, and brought an honesty to her words that you don't "see" everyday. I can understand why so many readers are getting distraught over these story and are heart broken over what Colleen's family went through, and a beautiful story it was. No I didn't cry and no I wouldn't recommend this to someone who wants an ugly cry read, I but I do hold this story near and dear to my heart.
title: Not ugly cry but deff had the feels

author: LindsB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2019
review_content: I don’t even know where to begin. This book was raw, heartbreaking, but incredible.This is a story of love, heartbreak, and incredible strength. I wish I could explain it more but I don’t want to spoil any of it.Colleen Hoover did an amazing job with this novel. She tackled a very sensitive topic with such grace. I implore you to read It Ends With Us, you will either relate to the characters or gain better understanding for those that have gone through or are going through the situations described in the book.
title: Wow

author: Sheva
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020
review_content: At the risk of saying too much, I’m going to keep it at a minimum. Like other reviewers, I do recommend that you go into this book blind. However, I do want to say some small things.You have to appreciate Colleen Hoover’s writing style in that she makes a love story about more than just love. If you think of your average romance novel, the climax of the story is when the couple finally gets together, but this isn’t an average story by far. It’s a journey more than anything, it’s lifelike and introspective, it’s a process and you don’t really see where it’s headed at all times, until you do.I would recommend this story for anyone, anyone at all. It doesn’t exactly fit into the confines of one thing or another, and the psychological views it perpetuates and helps someone understand are just...incredible. In the past 6 hours, I’ve read 2 Colleen Hoover novels from start to finish, and I’m officially obsessed.
title: A Love Journey

author: connie greenwood
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: It Ends With Us . I had to think about it before I wrote my review actually it's been hard to not think about it. Th book was really good I felt like I was immersed in the book like I could see, feel what was happening as I read. I'm not going to spoil it because it's important that you go in blind. There is nothing that disappointed me about this book. With the sensitive subject matter it was beautifully written. It was thought provoking hence a week later it's still on my mind. It's empowering. And the ending perfect.I have yet to walk away from reading one of Colleen Hoovers book with out learning some vauluable lesson that I can apply to my life. Honestly a friend hooked me up with her books a year ago. I feel like I have really grown and become a better person. So like I said if you have heart pick up this book and read it. And if you haven't read her other books yet, what are you waiting for. All I have left to say is thank you to the author 💜
title: If you have a heart beat read this book💜

author: Erica N.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2018
review_content: This is one of my absolute favorite books. I laughed, I bawled, I fell in love and hated. I went in having no idea what to expect and it blew me away. I started reading it and immediately was hooked. I could not put it down. The less you know about the book, the better. Just know it will change you! I even wanted to go home from my boyfriends house because all I could think of was continuing to read this book!Side note: I gave this to a friend who has not picked up a book since she had to in high school. She finished the whole book in 2 days. Now she reads all the time!
title: READ THIS BOOK! SERIOUSLY...

author: debra elsner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2016
review_content: What can I say about this book? Naked Truth: it was the most emotional, gut wrenching, loving book I have ever  read.  The last couple of years there have been many books that dealt with abuse and rapes, which brings awareness to subjects that are usually swept under the carpet.  This story is a must read.  Her writing is better than ever, each word sending emotion into your soul.  The subject is so heavy that sometims it's hard to read, yet full of hope and second chances.  I wanted to hate Ryle, but even though his actions caused the devastation in his and Lily's relationship, I felt really bad for him.  Everyone in this book has demons from their past that built their characters.  We always ask "why doesn't she leave him?"  Sometimes it's love that keeps them together.  But once a certain line is crossed, you must think of yourself and how it would affect everyone in your life.  I want to really thank Colleen for writing the most beautiful book and bringing Lily, Ryle and Atlas.  (I loved  him!)  "Just keep swimming"!!!!
title: A must read for everyone!

author: GeminiNT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2016
review_content: I have to admit I didn't trust all the five star ratings. I was under the impression people loved this author with a devotion that stripped them of the ability to give her anything less. Don't get me wrong, I'm a huge fan as well, but not blindly so. I felt I should open with that so no one would doubt the veracity of my five stars. That this book was all that and more to me. This book, I devoured in one day. This book, broke my heart many times...I still feel it rattling in my chest as I write this. This book...I wanted this to end different. I wanted it to end how it did. I wanted everything to be erased, yet nothing to change. The naked truth aspect rang familiar to her last book, but that was just about all I could critique.
