This book brought to life the notion that you could love and hate a person all in the same breath. Ryle was that for me. I wanted it to be different. Atlas...It couldn't be any other way. Torn between what I thought I wanted from this book and what I was loathed to let go of.Damn, this one will stay for a while.
title: Yes!

author: adriana espada
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2016
review_content: 4.75Wow what an amazing journey!I loved this book, I really really loved and hate this book (there were some scenes, that i just could not think were happening.It ends with us, takes you to this roller coaster were you love, hate, and want to kill some characters, yes, it ended the way I wanted it to end, but it still hurt the journey the main character had to take.I want to reread this book some day in the future, I think it's one of those books that deserves to be reread it, it changed the way I used to see somethings. And I'd always love this book for that, and more reasons.I gave it 4.75 because there were two or three scenes that were to much for me, but don't get me wrong, I think this book is my fave book of the year, if not the second.This is my first Colleen Hoover's book, I can tell you, it won't be my last.Sorry if i have grammar mistakes, my native language is Spanish.

author: NBarthule
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: It took 4 hours for me to complete this book and for my heart to be obliterated. 4 hours where I felt completely exposed, bare and naked. 4 hours to travel back in time to someone I used to be.It took 2 hours for my heart to finally slow down and get back to a normal beat.It took another hour for my brain to catch up to my heart and allow me to finally fall asleep.It took 30 seconds for me to realize I'm not the girl I was 11 years ago.It took me .03 seconds to remember that the arms wrapped around me, holding me tightly, were of someone that I love. Someone that comforted me. Someone that took care of me and loved me, exactly as I was. Who didn't pressure me, who didn't try to change me, who rarely ever raised his voice. That person snuggled gently against me was the person that saved my life, without even knowing that he did.This book. Oh this book. What can I say about it without giving everything away? This book.. you need to go in blindly. You need to see the rawness, the bareness of this book. It's real. It's ugly. It's truth.Keep the Kleenex close. You will thank me later.
title: I want to be you when I grow up

author: Storm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2016
review_content: This is my third taste of Colleen's books. I know, you're probably wondering what rock I've been hiding under. But hey, better late than never, right?  I was sucked into the story, and I had a feeling the reason we were drawn so much into the past was because it would blow up in our faces. One night I figured I'd read a little after an exhausting day. I was at the halfway point and that one scene happens BOOM. The game changes on me. This was BIG. I KNEW this was big. Forget the sleep. Forget focus. I needed to finish the rest of this book in one night.So I did.And I cried. My stomach clenched with tears because holy wow, what a book. The blurb gives you no indication of the emotional turmoil about to slap you had in the face.  And then when I finished the book and read the authors's note, I cried some more. GAH!This story may be hard to read, but it is a story that obviously needed to be told. It's raw, beautiful, heart breaking and so much more. My only wish is that we had a little more with that ending.
title: Left me in tears!

author: Mama C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2016
review_content: Tough book!!! I have not stopped thinking about this book for a whole week.  Very hard topic and skillfully executed.  Colleen Hoover is an author I kind of love and hate.  I love how she makes me think and feel and I hate how she makes me think and feel, too.  Her books are hard yet they stick with you in the best way possible.I have never reread a Colleen Hoover book because once is enough in the best way...this one maybe the exception.  There are many life lessons in this book.This book explores limits in relationships.  How much can a relationship with all the passion, love, friendship and connection you could only of dream  of take when your partner is 99% amazing and 1% dark and twisted.
title: Limits

author: Brook
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
review_content: If you are looking for a classic and simple romantic read, this is not that book. While this book is sweet and compelling, and definitely made me long for a nice loving relationship, it has many unexpected twists and turns. If you are like me and enjoy reading books with different plots, then this book is for you! I loved this book, and could not put it down. It made me laugh, love, cry, and hate. It took me through all the stages of grief and heartbreak. It, at times, is graphic, but it adds the realism and truth behind the emotions. I highly recommend it. Enjoy the read.
title: Not a simple book

author: JacintheBooks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: While I won't say this is my favorite book by Colleen Hoover, it is nonetheless a five-star read!  This is a departure from her books in that the main characters take a different path to love.  I really don't know how to review this without giving spoilers.  I will clear up some fears  I first had going in.  There is no cheating (which I don't really like in books) and no over angsty love triangle (which can really kill a book for me). Otherwise, I will say that Colleen Hoover has written a beautifully poignant story of the harsh truths in love and life.  There are parts of ourselves we never learn about until love comes along.  Those parts can show us the depths of our souls.  I love Colleen Hoover and will remain a faithful fan forever.
title: Can't Go Wrong with Colleen Hoover

author: Ashley M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: I don't even know what to say without spoiling anything in the book, so I won't say anything at all. Sorry CoHo! I suck at reviewing this book, but I did really love it! I especially loved your author's note :) It was wonderful, and I cried.  Everyone needs to read this book. I feel as though Colleen opened her heart and gave us a glimpse into her life. We all have some semblance of what she and her family went through, reading this book. It was so personal. I love that she let us see a side of herself that we, as readers never have before. Thank you, Colleen, for sharing a little piece of yourself with so many. (Thanks go to your mother as well for raising such strong, creatively beautiful daughters).
title: So much more than just a book

author: Marlena Salinas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: It's not everyday I read a book cover to cover on release day, this is one of those books. This book hit every spectrum in the scale of emotions for me. The highs left me soaring and with the lows I could literally feel my heart cracking into pieces. It was deeply honest and it spoke unequivocally to the human capacity for love, boundaries and repetitive cycles of growth, forgiveness and acceptance. In the final pages when the titles namesake words were spoken I sobbed happy, sad, angry, satisfying tears for every single one of the characters. Many praises and thanks to Colleen Hoover for sharing this deeply personal story...the multifaceted truth in these words was unlike anything I've ever read before, it's gonna stay with me a while for sure. 5 incomparable stars!
title: The most honest book I've read maybe ever!

author: Hongzeff World Domination Industries
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: Just finished IT ENDS WITH US by Colleen Hoover.I have so much to say but I can't because I still need to process everything that I have just read. All I'm going to say right now, is that you need to read it. Don't read the reviews beforehand, don't go searching for the plot. Go into it completely blind.I think it's actually important for everyone to read it....Male or female...young and old. Oh, what a different world it could be if everyone did.There's a reason why books are so important and vital in the lives of humans small and big, young and old. It's a great way to learn, escape and entertain ones mind and soul and better themselves in the process. It also opens your eyes and minds to see things the way you've never had before.It's crazy how some writers can create characters that you find yourself so emotionally invested in like they are real people...so you go on the journey with them...crying, laughing, screaming, raging, loving and fighting and at the end, you're just exhausted. Wiped out.That's how I feel right now with this book. I don't know how else to explain it.YOU MUST READ THIS BOOK.
title: This should be a must read for everyone who breathes...

author: A Miller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
review_content: Sometimes you enjoy a book. Sometimes you love a book. And sometimes a book will leave you speechless. This is the latter.I could not put this book down! I love Colleen Hoover’s writing style and the way she brings the “letters” into this story. The backstory on main character, Lily, is very detailed and raw. It feels like you truly know her. The details she adds to each chapter are so perfect and well thought out. A great read that makes you happy and sad and makes you want to read on and on. I didn’t want it to end. But I love how it did!I would give It Ends With Us more than 5 stars if I could. Get this on your “must read” list now!Check out more of my reviews on Instagram @TheMom.Who.Reads
title: I didn’t want it to end. But I love how it did!

author: Jenna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2017
review_content: Colleen, you have turned into one of my favorite authors. You actually write books with creative story lines. I haven't read a book in months because I was getting so frustrated with the trash that is all over the place. Every book you write keeps me up until the child free hours of the night because I can't put the book down. Or just one more chapter! This book was different right away from others and I didn't know what to think. No fear! It was so good and brought all the feels. Way to be! I definitely LOL a few times too! Keep doing what you are doing! And bring on more good reads!
title: Another winner!

author: Marcie J. Koons
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: (Lord please let me be able to put full sentences together right now..) I literally just finished the last page of this book and I am in complete shock. I have never smiled so much, cried so much, been angry and sad and completely thrown in a book before. I liked this authors page on Facebook and decided to order it two days after it came out. I quickly read the "about the book" blurb and though, "people are in awe of this I've got to read it" and I'm not kidding people. Buy this. Read it. Devour it. It is heart breaking, and wonderful. The characters are beautiful. You feel so close to some and think you know others well. Colleen Hoover is beautifully descriptive, and animated. She makes you feel like you are right there, and makes your emotional go wild! Please please please if you're on the edge take the plunge and purchase this book! It is down right amazing!
title: I'm in shock

author: Missy Moore
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2016
review_content: Naked Truth- If you need warned about triggers in a book or sensitive material don’t read good books.  A great book breaks you into a million pieces and puts you back together.  It takes an amazing author to have that much control over their readers.  COHO has done it again! Colleen, I hated you at various parts of this book but that is because you made me feel every single thing that Lily felt.In all of COHO’s books I have loved little sayings and they have stuck with me.  For It Ends With Us that saying is naked truth.  Naked truth is where there is no sugar coating to it.  It just is what it is good or bad.  That is exactly what this book is.  It is a subject that we have all heard and read about but it is not sugar coated.  It’s flat out handed to us in an amazing book that unputdownable!
title: READ! It may change your life!!

author: Allison
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2016
review_content: I have to say so far it is the best book I've read this year! And I'm picking about so many things. I had tears in my eyes so many times while reading this book. The way the story is carried forward is very smooth and entertaining. You will not get tired of reading Lily's journal when she was a teenager. And you will certainly not be bored by the love stories in the book. Yes, there are not only one of them.But most importantly, I think this book inspired me to think so many things I've never thought before, for example, domestic violence, a topic that is so common and unique at the same time. Common because many women are suffering from it, unique because it's rarely spoken about even by the victims. The story of Lily and her mother shed a light on this hot issue and the way the author put it on paper is amazing. I'll never expect how Colleen ended the story and I definitely love it!A book recommended for young women and girls of all ages. A very important lesson about respect and self-respect, relationship and family that everyone should be able to enjoy and learn from it.
title: I have to say so far it is the best book I've read this year

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: Colleen's best book yet. I say this because you know damn well there is gonna be an even better one because her books are like potato chips... The first one is good, the next one... Better but soon enough your eating the whole bag. That's how I feel when I read her books, interested, enthused and in the end always full.It ends with us was jaw dropping, deep. I can't find the words to explain it... They don't make sense and I think that's a fair review- it's unbelievable. Being 27 weeks pregnant I may have been more emotional than most... But this hit home with me towards the end. I could never imagine my husband being ryle or Lilly's father- and believe me I am happy that he isn't, but I am happy Colleen shared this book with me as a reader because I have a new found respect for abused victims - not that I didn't before (but being put in Lilly's shoes you are forced to understand her struggle).Colleen please for the sake of all of our sanity continue to write atlas and Lilly's story.... Make this pregnant woman happy :)Oh, and thanks for breaking my heart 100 times over... Damn you!
title: Pregnant and emotional and I just got hoovered

author: C. T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2016
review_content: Wow, just wow, Colleen!I am a product of two people who broke the cycle of abuse.  I am so grateful to my parents for the hard choices they made to make sure we had a better childhood.  I unfortunately fell for the wrong kind of man who didn't love me like he should as a young adult, but I fought hard to get out of it and survived.  I'm now happily married with kids to an awesome Husband and Father.  I'm so glad that I realized I deserved better at the young age of 20.  I didn't have any support, but knew that my future self and children needed better.This book brings back a lot of old feelings and fears for me.  I thought the characters were so developed that I too, like many people, wished that Ryle would end up being the Husband he wanted to be... but I'm so grateful that Colleen stayed strong to what is right.  I think it will help many people who may be in a similar situation.  5 stars for the writing, the characters, the story line and the ending!  Cheers!
title: I am so grateful to my parents for the hard choices they made to make sure we had a better childhood. I unfortunately fell for t

author: megnk1
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: This fascinating story swept me away. It sends such a strong message to empower women around the globe. It shows a different side, with incredible insight, to what so many people face today. Told in a way that only Colleen Hoover could it has a unique plot line, unforgettable character quirks and humour, with (of course) lots of bring-you-to-your-knees emotion."Life is a funny thing. We only get so many years to live it, so we have to do everything we can to make sure those years are as full as they can be. We shouldn't waste time on things that might happen someday, or maybe even never."Lily has some excruciatingly tough decisions to make in this emotional roller coaster of a journey and I'm so glad I went along for the ride.
title: Powerful & Inspirational

author: Deborah Lammel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2016
review_content: I downloaded this book when it first was published , however, after reading the reviews and listening to my daughter who had read it , I knew I had to be in the right place and the right mind to take it on. Today was that day , I knew the ending was sad but I wouldn't let anyone tell me about it. I started reading and I fell in love with them all . I laughed a lot and then the tears came . The story is amazing , as are the characters. This book and the feelings it makes me feel ,,will stay with me along time .. I have been a big fan of Colleen Hoover's books. I started reading them over a year ago . She has been and remains one of my favorite story tellers  Thank you for this book , I cannot recommend it highly enough .
title: One of the most wonderful books I have ever read

author: renee jamison-hardman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2016
review_content: It is so hard to review this book and not spoil all the greatness that it is. Colleen's work is some of my favorite to read and this book took the freaking cake for me. The characters and the story line were superb. If you are a avid reader like myself you have read just about every story line out there. This book and the writing of this book just took me places and made me feel emotions that were buried deep in my past. After reading one of Colleen's books your always left with some saying or objects that sticks with you forever (like in her past works: carving pumpkins, butterfly you, garden gnomes, LOL, Griffin Peterson). You will take so much with you after reading this story...it leaves it mark and I highly recommend you pick up a copy.
title: Hands down her best yet.

author: Taylor Huseth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2016
review_content: WOW. I was speechless when I finished this book. People talk about book hangovers and I've had a few before but this one took a while to process and be able to move on from. Not only were my emotions rocked throughout this whole book but my morals were rocked as well! After reading some of Colleen's comments on how she wanted people to read and feel about this book, she achieved it with me. I felt everything she wanted a reader to feel and it totally shook me to my core. I have and will recommend this book to everyone I know, I believe this book needs to be read by all women and even men! I've loved all of Colleen's books but if someone told me to choose my number one favorite, this would be it!
title: Emotional and moral roller coaster!

author: Andrea
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2020
review_content: My happy place nowadays is burying myself in books to escape reality for a brief moment. I like immersing myself in a character’s journey, as it gives me the company I need at that time. What I wasn’t expecting to feel with this book was a literal lump in my throat... multiple times, as I read through the development of Lily’s story. The emotions were so raw, the feelings so real that I could feel them happening to me. I could physically feel the pain Lily felt and could empathize with her choices like they were my own. In other words, reading this book, if only for a moment, made me feel empowered. Made me feel alive.
title: A lump in my throat

author: Melissa Sherrill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2016
review_content: Seriously people, Colleen Hoover has done it again! It Ends With Us is a must read for both women and men. It dives into situations that really need to be explored and written about more.IEWU follows Lily and Ryle. I never saw the ending coming and was shocked, in a good way. It's deep, real and takes you on an emotional roller coaster ride. I was all over the place with this one. In true "Colleen Hoover" fashion I cried, laughed, was happy, sad, angry, hurt, shocked and relieved and not necessarily in that order. I proudly pulled an all nighter to finish this. I can't explain how moving Ms Hoover's writing is. She is very talented and has certainly proved it again. I can't say enough about IEWU. It was very personal to Ms Hoover and it shows. This book was nothing but amazing.I highly recommend this book to everyone. It's well worth it and will leave you wanting to read more of Colleen's work.
title: It's a Must Read!!

author: Healthy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2018
review_content: I tend to be wary of books that have such good ratings, but this one was truly remarkable. As someone who has worked in the mental health field, I have often wondered why women stay in abusive relationships. However, this book perfectly demonstrates how a cycle of abuse can start and why it continues. The author does a beautiful job of building empathy in the reader and builds a very visceral reaction while going through certain parts of the book. The book is done in a very unique way with journal entries from a previous time period and current perspectives. Together they create an eloquent story that I believe everyone women should read who has ever wondered “why does that women stay in that relationship?”.
title: ... tend to be wary of books that have such good ratings, but this one was truly remarkable

author: RRigdon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2016
review_content: I have loved all of Colleen's books, but "It Ends With Us" was a great learning experience in book form.  I had a very loving upbringing and was lucky enough to find my own Atlas in my loving husband.  I hate to say it, but I was one of those people that did wonder why anyone would stay in an abusive relationship. Why didn't they think more of themselves and get out.  Colleen weaved this story so well that you felt everything that Lily was feeling and living through. So you could glimpse what women are feeling in their own situations. How strong they really have to be to make the hard right decision.  Job well done Colleen!!  This is your best book yet!!  As always, I am looking forward to your next book!!
title: A great learning experience in book form

author: ANJasper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2016
review_content: This book. My heart is just so full and I finished reading It Ends With Us more than a week ago. I don't even know where to start with the things this book did to me. It Ends With Us is by far Colleen Hoover's best moment. The words in these pages will change lives. They changed mine.I cried.I laughed.I cheered.I cried, again.I swooned.I cringed.I cried, again.I wiped my eyes and smiled.Lily's story resonated deep within me. She was uniquely herself but also every woman. This is so much more than a romance novel. This is a life book. A book everyone needs to read. It will break you. It will heal you. It will make you want to call your mom and hug your best friend. It will make you think of first love and all the dreams you had before the real world jaded you. It will make you want more. More for yourself. More for the people you hold most dear. And for me, that is the best thing about it.
title: Colleen's best work

author: Kacey Schmitt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2021
review_content: This book threw me for a loop. The hardest part about reading this book was how much I related to it. Colleen Hoover has a way of grabbing your heartstrings and I wouldn't want it any other way. After finishing this book, I saw how she involved her own story into this one. I recommended it to my deaf book club and I can't wait to see what they think. I would 100% suggest reading it!
title: The Cover is 100% Right

author: Anonymous
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020
review_content: I'm ashamed to even say that I haven't picked up a Colleen Hoover book before this. Wow, was this just something else. The blurb hints at a "love triangle" but it's so much more than that and the moment you realize it, it just sucks you in even more. I finished this book in two sittings, only because I had to work in between those two times. Honestly, it was hard to even put it down that one time.Highly recommend. Won't be disappointed. Love my girl Lily. I'll be purchasing more Colleen Hoover books from now on!
title: A read you won't regret!

author: DeeDiDee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: This was my first Colleen Hoover novel. I read it in one sitting and endured one punch after another to the gut and to the heart. While I found the plot predictable, the characters were magnificently complex, and the writing was so grittily raw, honest, and beautiful, that it elevated the storyine to another level. I had to take pauses throughout the reading to collect myself because despite the fact that the writing wasn't overly graphic, it pulled me from my comfort zone. I constantly reevaluated how I felt about the characters, how I felt about myself, and how I felt about others. At the end of a book, the true measure of it's worth is not in how different the story was (after all, there are really only a few stories out there) but in the telling of it and how it impacted you. If there was a bag of frozen peas in my kitchen right now, I'd be holding them on my bruised heart.
title: Punched Me in the Chest

author: Lisa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016
review_content: I agree with what other reviews have said and suggest going into this book blind.  I did read a few reviews in the hopes of getting some information but the end result was no one was really giving anything away.  And I think that made this book all the more amazing.  I loved this book.  It was hard to read in some areas but overall I feel that this is a book everyone should read.  The writing was truly amazing.  This is only my 3rd Colleen Hoover book to read but it definitely won't be my last.  I think I might become obsessed with her a bit.This story is a hard one to read, so I can only imagine how difficult it was for Colleen to write.  But you can tell that this story truly comes from her heart and soul.  I do wish there was more Atlas in the present time though but in the end I can totally understand and appreciate the way she ended this novel.  I just suggest everyone buy this book and love it.
title: The best book I have read...EVER

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019
review_content: Living through this myself I don't believe I have seen it dealt with any better. I have talked to younger girls who have asked my advise, for me it's always the same. They never change. And of those that go back like I did for sixteen years, it never does. It took me three years to get my divorce.  Thanks for this story. I have a few friends that need to read it
title: So much truth

author: Coloradoan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016
review_content: I cannot believe the amount of love and adoration I have for this author, until she shamelessly gives another peak into her fantastic brain.  I cannot handle how Hopeless this author makes me to even start another book after her last one.  I am Losing Hope that she will ever write a bad book.  This Girl cannot handle how Slammed I feel with her books.  Maybe Someday she will write a bad book, Maybe Not, maybe that day will be on a cold November 9, but I Never Never see that happening.  Finding Colleen Hoover's book was like Finding Cinderella, the shoe fits perfectly and I feel like I have hit the Point of Retreat every time I dive into one of her books.  Seriously It Ends With Us is perfection.
title: I just Ugly Cried through this book, I Confess.

author: J.S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2017
review_content: Colleen Hoover is my favorite author. Anyone who knows me knows this. I love everything she does including this story.This is not an easy story to read and I know it couldn't have been easy to write. This is a story that deals with some heavy issues but Colleen as always handles it in the most beautiful way. I cried, literally sobbed. I rarely have a book that effects me that way. I read this book last year and I still think about it daily. While it's not the happiest story, it is one of hope and the book ended in the best way it could. I applaud Colleen for her amazing work! Wow!**Please be sure to read the authors note at the end. It'll bring a whole new meaning to the story.*Also loved the Ellen diary :)
title: Will make you cry and then cry some more. So beautifully done!

author: Gretchen de la O
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2016
review_content: I just devoured "It Ends With Us" by Colleen Hoover. It was heartbreakingly beautiful, simply delicate, and epically life changing.This story touched my heart deeply, I ached for those moments where the world would open up and swallow me.And yet, as an outsider in despicable moments of other people's lives, this book cast a glowing light on how compassion and understanding can heal those we love.I'm not free from judgment, None of us are, but cracking open that part of who I am helped me relate to what people are thinking in the darkest moments of their lives, and why they do what they do.This book showed me that people can and will eventually find a way to heal their hearts--that what you see isn't always what you get. Life isn't as black and white as you conceive it should be. It reinforced my belief that there is a potentiality within each and everyone of us that empowers our choices in who we choose to be.Thank you, Colleen, for sharing all the vulnerable parts of who we are and giving the world a book that will heal so many people's hearts and lives!5 Stars, CoHo!
title: 5 Big O Stars

author: Rai
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2019
review_content: Absolutely one of the BEST books I've read. The reader will feel this story in their soul. There is no way to put down this book once you've reached the midpoint. You will read so much, so fast because the story is so engrossing. I'm both anxious and hesitant to read a second book from this author for fear that a second read will pale in comparison to this page-turner.
title: Finished the last 50 pages in just a few hours

author: Sue Roberts
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2017
review_content: I'm not good at review's I love Colleen Hoover books my daughter Joleen reads so many books she remembers the names of the characters she really gets into books and inspires me to read.That being said when I asked her what she's read lately that's good her response was any Colleen Hoover books she said their all good and she's the best.Well she's absolutely right.Colleen writes with such a flow and humor and when you can LOL or cry to me their is no words that can say how great a author is than that.By far she has not disappointed me with any book I've read and a shout out to Joleen Roberts,  Colleen's biggest fan 😉My daughter knows her author's and she's right Colleen Hoover is the best.
title: Absolutely amazing

author: Karen G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2016
review_content: I put books down for awhile as my husband and I made our way across the country from San Diego, CA to Clinton, MA in a move that would bring us closer to my kids as they started families of their own.  I just didn't have time to let myself escape into fiction and that made me sad.Luckily, Colleen Hoover's book It Ends With Us was the first book I picked up after my self imposed sabbatical of non-reading for over a year.Colleen never disappoints.  Her writing seems effortless.  I never stumble when reading her books and find myself "shhhhh'ing" anyone who tries to speak to me while I'm reading.  This was a hard book to read in that the characters were so likeable, you don't want anyone to "lose".  Sacrifices must be made and in the end....it's how it has to be.Well done (again) Colleen.  I applaud you for writing so much from the heart.  I never get tired reading your books.
title: Another stellar achievement!

author: Robin Byers
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2016
review_content: I discovered Colleen Hoover 2 years ago and after my first read, became a huge fan. Everything she writes is unique and always delivers such an emotional punch. It is to the point that I pre-order any book of hers without knowing a single element of it. I am always positive she will deliver. I went into It Ends With Us completely blind. I didn't read a thing about it prior and when the book arrived in my hot little hands, I wouldn't even read the back cover. I am telling you, it is best to go into this book that way. I will say, it was a slightly different story than I'm used to from Colleen but I love her even more after this book. I will not give any spoilers. It is unfair to do so. What I will say is that this book has caused me to revaluate my life on so many levels. Everyone always talks about the "feels." Colleen delivering them is a given. This book gave so much more than that. I will be a better person for reading this book. I will do more, contribute more, be stronger, be confident, be more tolerable and hopefully help others to do the same. I will echo the quote on the front cover from Kami Garcia (I couldn't avoid reading that ;) ) and say that "everyone with a heartbeat should read this book." The world needs us to, truly.
title: I AM STILL RECOVERING FROM THIS BOOK 3 WEEKS LATER

author: Jenn Barwick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2019
review_content: I am one to devour a new book within hours, then be sad once it's over. Then, after some time the story line, plot, character names, pivotting moments are just kind of lost. All of that is impossible with this book. Put all your thoughts on this author, the cover, the name, ect anything that has made you not want to read this book and try it! I promise it will make an impact. It will embed words into your brain and heart. Make us want to be better people, check on loved ones, and have the bad chain end with us. 😘
title: Lasting impression

author: piercka1
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2016
review_content: In typical Colleen Hoover style this book left me with a book hangover.  I never thought I could feel so much for the so called "bad person" in a novel.  I wont say anything more than that because I always do spoiler free reviews and I don't want to give away the storyline.  But what I can say is that I liked each and every character in this book and felt so many emotions while reading their individual stories.I also thought that Colleen's personal story admission added so much to the end of this book.  I admire her for telling her readers her very personal story.  This just made me love Colleen even more (If that was possible.)
title: Another awesome Colleen Hoover book

author: Brittany
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2016
review_content: Wow. This book hit me right in the feels. I was rooting for Lily to end up with Atlas, but I was also kind of rooting for her to end up with Ryle. I really fell in love with them both. That may sound strange because usually it's one or the other not both, but Colleen Hoover really shows the love each of these heroes has for this woman and vice versa. I know what happened is never okay, but it definitely shows a whole new perspective to situations such as what happened in this book.If you're confused about what I've said up above I suggest you make the right decision and just read the book. It's worth it. The characters are flawed, real, and all around amazing. They all have a past that shapes them into who they are now. Reading this story was amazing because you could put yourself right there. The characters were so real.
title: She did it again folks! Buy the book now!

author: Kasey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: This book is totally different! Nothing I would have thought she would write. I loved it! This is the very first time I have read the parts at the end of a book. And I am so glad I did. It pulled all the emotions out of me. This book struck a chord in me that will stay with me for years to come.  I will continue to whisper to myself. Just keep swimming. Just keep swimming. Thank you Colleen for braving this story and showing us how truly amazing you and your family are. Your mother is such a strong amazing woman. I have met both of you once and I continue to look up to you and am amazed at everything you have done.  Thank you for this book. You continue to outshine every author I read. Amazing story, amazing feels.
title: Wow!

author: JN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2021
review_content: Oh god..My heart and my emotions changed so many times with this book.I’ve laughed, I’ve been angry, and I have cried at 1:00am because I couldn’t put the book down. This is a must read. You will not be able to put it down..Fair warning though — if you are like me and have been in an abusive relationship, be cautious.I didn’t know and my feelings are a little jacked up right now. I’m definitely emotional but it’s okay. It opened my eyes to a new perspective.This is a new favorite.
title: Oh Wow..

author: Nicole
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2016
review_content: I loved this book.This story -- it got to me. While I've never experienced the situations in the book, I can't tell you how profoundly the book touched me. The various viewpoints gave several differing viewpoints that really gave me an understanding of the situation that I never had before. I posted this book as a recommendation to all my friends on Facebook and Twitter and would suggest it to everyone - man or woman. This book contains very adult material, it's not for the weak at heart. Bring some tissues, be ready to be happy, mad, angry, you name it.I never know what to expect when I pick up a Colleen Hoover novel, and this one did not disappoint. I won't give too much away about the plot twists, but they take your breath away. I picked up the book and stayed up until midnight to finish it, weeping.Read it! You will not be disappointed.
title: Possibly one of the best books I've ever read, ever.

author: Lisa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
review_content: I could not put this book down. I was looking for a good romantic novel. This was not at all the book was I was expecting but I was not disappointed! This had lots of romance but not the love story ending expected. The twists had me addicted! I finished it in a day. Such an emotional story. Your heart will feel head over in heels in love and devastating heartbreak with Lily. The ending will leave you empowered.  A great read!!Loved this book!
title: YOU WON’T BE ABLE TO PUT IT DOWN!! SO GOOD!

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
review_content: Having read all of Colleen Hoover's books, I did the same I always do and just started reading without knowledge of the premise of this book. I didn't want any bias other than me knowing I will love it because, duh! It's by Colleen Hoover. I don't know how she does it but every book is better than the last. I keep telling people that's my favorite book then she writes a new one and surprise I have a new favorite.  Well this book didn't let me down.  I fell in love with all the characters, even when I didn't want to.  She made it so you couldn't help routing for the guy you weren't supposed to.  Wanting the heroine to forgive him when you know she shouldn't.  She made you question why you felt this way.  That not everything is black and white.  That there is good and evil in all of us. Maybe we are all just people who sometimes do bad things.  Don't get me wrong, there is true evil in the world, but my hope is that there is more good. Thank you Colleen Hoover.
title: Speechless

author: Brenda Reynolds
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2016
review_content: I have been brought to tears by so many novels I've lost count.  This novel however, brought the kind of tears that only real, truly real life can bring.  Colleen wrote from the heart, from life and reality.  With the exception of a follow-up story, (Maybe...It Begins with Us) I wouldn't change one word, not one single solitary word.  The characters were very well written, thought out and evoke real connections with them.  I went through a half box of kleenex, so be prepared.  Colleen Hoover is known for her emotional writing and she brought all of that to this story and then some.  If I could give her ten stars for this novel, she earned it.
title: A Story Not to Miss

author: The Late Night Reader
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: I thought this book was amazing.  It was the first Colleen Hoover book i've read, coming across a review for it on Vilma's Book Blog.  I loved the development of Lilly and Ryle's relationship, finding myself fully involved in their story as the book progressed.  The book is not a light subject but i felt Colleen wrote it amazingly well.  This book had me on a roller coaster of emotion, i found myself anxious at times when Lilly and Ryle's relationship was at its worst and laughing when Lilly and Alyssa were together.  I loved the 'naked truth' theme throughout the book, reminding me of my own relationships and something similar we do.I agree with other reviewers that I wish we had more Atlas in the book outside of the journal entries -- but loved the book either way!!  Can't wait to read more from Colleen!
title: Naked Truth?  Amazing

author: Erin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2021
review_content: This. Book. I read it in less than a day. Once I picked it up, I couldn’t put it down. I laughed, I cried, I curled my toes, I yelled, I cursed, I sobbed, and ultimately, I adored. This book takes you on the best roller coaster of emotions. I SOOOO wanna be Lily when I grow up! Her character pulls you in from the first page. I honestly do not think I could relate to a character more. This book quickly became at least Top 5 favorite books of all time, if not favorite my favorite. It’s just THAT good!!*****TRIGGER WARNING & SPOILER*****If you’ve been through domestic violence, and it’s hard for you to read, be aware it’s emotional & hard to read at times.
title: Beautifully heartbreaking.

author: Breezyleaf
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2021
review_content: Such a master crafter with words, I first read this book when it was released years ago. For some reason the story kept coming back to me in pieces, and I decided to read it again. That’s what Colleen’s characters do to you, reading through tears begging for things to go one way, knowing they will go another. Some cycles are harder to break but often those are the most critical.
title: Oh Colleen!

author: B.B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2016
review_content: Five hours. It takes five hours to change a life.As many did, I went in blind. While I understand how there are some readers who this doesn't work for, I feel that it's an important part of the process.This book, it's a process.It is love. It is hate. It is heartbreak. It is fear. It is redemption.In five hours, my life has been changed. The conflict I feel is concerning, even to myself. The conflict I feel is everything it was meant to be.I read a snippet from a review on release day. It said that CoHo was meant to write this book, that it was her purpose in life. I agree, but more than that, this book just gave purpose to so many women who need it, and perhaps didn't yet know they needed it. ♥️
title: "Writing this book was her purpose in this life."

author: LRB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
review_content: This book, well, what can I say but Colleen Hoover hit it out of the park. Lily, oh Lily, girl, you are strong. Fierce. Not putting up with anything. Until you did.  From Ryle. And jeez, Ryle, why, why, why?!?! This is not your typical happy frou-frou love story. It’s a little heartbreaking, but, oh so well done.
title: It ends with us

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2016
review_content: Colleen you have done it again.Everything you write turns to gold.I want you to know I fell in love with Ryle and Lily and I really wanted it to work out,but life and other things sometimes gets in the way.I .there is no way to know what Lily was feeling but you gave us a look into her life and my heart goes out to her and anyone else that goes through what she did.There was a light at the end of the tunnel if she just keeps swimming,and that she did,in amazing man named Atlas, when he told they could stop swimming because they finally reached the shore. If anyone else wants to reach the shore grab a copy of this book and see for yourself because nobody tells it like college .My greatest heartfelt thanks for bringing this story to life I thank you,and May God bless you in every way.
title: Heartfelt

author: Melissa Hensley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2016
review_content: Wow........just wow! I have to say "It Ends With Us" is the most emotional tornado of a story I have ever read! I have A LOT of personal comparison in this book. And I will say as a victim (child and adult) and as dispatcher and seeing so much domestic violence calls, especially those that involve children, I would even sincerely suggest this story to victims and as something the victims advocate could suggest to mothers and young girls who feel stuck in a domestic violent relationship or even those who don't understand how to support the victim, even the aggresser. It was heart breaking all around, yet empowering! I love this book and Colleen for sharing a part of this world close to her heart and giving everyone a look into the window of domestic abuse, love, and family. Even those of us with personal experience could benefit from looking in. "Thank you!" 😪😊💔❤  These things are never black and white and this story goes to show that!!!!
title: Wow!!!! Looking through!!!! Nothing is black and white!!!

author: Cliente de Kindle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2016
review_content: I was a little bit afraid of reading this book.I follow Colleen on Facebook and noticed the highly recommended comments from people who read the ARC copies and how much they liked it and said it was by  far Colleen's best book. So I was worried that maybe it was not going to meet all the expectations. I read it today and I can say that I was wrong. This is not the classic love story you will expect with the "normal" happy ending. I think this story was very well written, very Colleen! I love that no matter what the story is about, she always adds some funny dialogs. All the characters are amazing. There was a point where I hated Colleen because of what she did to Ryle, because she described this character so well that you ended up loving him! The point of this book in my opinion is that! how hard is for a person who loves so much another one, to take such a big decision! How easy it is from us reading the book to love the characters and not understanding Lily's point. That's what happens in real life with this kind of conflicts, how easy it's to judge without knowing and without feeling what the people involve feels. How difficult it's to understand love! That's why I loved this book so much. Thank you Colleen for taking the courage of sharing this story that definitely comes from your heart. Thank you for making us think about so many people who are currently in this position. You are really brave as well as your mom. And I love that even being this story so personal, you were able to use you amazing skills to write to share it so perfectly!!!
title: Thank you Colleen!!

author: Sfamily
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2018
review_content: I always had favorite books. Books that made me laugh, made me cry, made my heart skips beats, made me antsy and scared.This however was the first book that shook my world. How real it was written, how similar it was to a relationship I had endured and Thankfully got out of.This book shook me to the core. I informed my husband I needed to have a reset and I went and laid in bed for about twenty minutes in a blanket burrito .I suggest this to everyone! I absolutely love it.
title: When you need to cope so you wrap up in a blanket burrito

author: Elena
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2016
review_content: I really disliked how much I loved this book. It's so heartbreakingly raw.You could feel Lily's pain cut you and all you could do was watch it bleed.I'm not going to post a summary since there 500 other reviews and I'm sure they have the plot there.Anything less than 5 stars would be a lie. Even if it didn't always go where I wanted or it didn't have enough of the character I loved.I love the flashbacks to her childhood. How that helped us see what shaped her as a grownup.This one is for all of us who at one point or another said we wanted to be nothing like our parents.At then end the only question I asked myself was, what's your limit?
title: What's your limit?

author: Hcquarles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2017
review_content: This book was picked as the Romance Book of the Year by Goodreads and I decided it was a must read.  I was not prepared for it - I didn't read the blurbs. This book is about domestic violence and how we cope with it.  It presents a different view - some what like Emily Giffin's different take on an extra marital affair in Heart of the Matter.  I started this Christmas day and couldn't put it down
title: I very much liked the love story and characters.  It started slow but once I got going I sat up all night reading it.  It had some really realistic moments and some humor.  I would recommend it but not for someone who has a personal experience with violence.
verified: It presents a different view - some what like Emily Giffin's different take on an extra marital affair ...

author: Erica Alyson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2016
review_content: I don't even know where to start. Colleen Hoover is my favorite author so when she has a book I just buy it. I don't read the back I just read it. I didn't know what to expect with this book. What I got was so much more than I could have even known was coming. This book gave me so many emotions from the first page. I was hooked immediately. I was in love with the characters all of them past and present. I was shocked at the turn this book came but it was so raw and true and it was portrayed perfectly. It is life for some people and it is hard to cope with but it happens. This book couldn't have been easy to write but it was perfect. I loved it the ending all of it. I applaud her for taking on this subject and doing so perfectly. I think this is some of Colleen's best writing. But I say that at the end of all of her books!
title: Another fantastic book by Colleen Hoover

author: Brandy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2021
review_content: I'm not saying that this is a bad book by any means. But i'm not sure what i expected, but i don't think it lived up to the TikTok trend. I think people blew it out considering what the plot, climax, it's close to other books I've read. I did enjoy it, i just think that it was hyped up so much for what it was.
title: Well...

author: Kelly PeaseKindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2016
review_content: Ok, I don't usually pay but a couple of dollars for my books online... after reading great reviews for this book I said ok.... it better be worth it... well it's so totally worth it... Colleen, whatever rewards authors get for writing books you better be getting one for this book. Outstanding story, I'm sorry for the homeless boy with a heart of gold. I had a friend whose husband shot her and they're two kids one day, so Domestic violence hits close to home.. I pray that doesn't ever happen to anyone else. So glad that Ryle was selfless enough to be the man he is.. I think this book will stick with me for a long time.  Thank you Colleen, and thank you to your mom, she's a brave women.
title: Worth it

author: Felicia Chris Skvarna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2016
review_content: I haven't picked up a book in 5 years... 5 YEARS!!!! I read this book cover to cover in 27 hours! That may be a new record for me. It was so good. It was like a drug. I had to force myself to put it down and force myself to walk away and not pick it up. It shook me to my core and made me feel things I wanted to forget yet somehow wanted to feel again. I stopped reading at a point because I wasn't ready for it to end. I didn't want the story to be over. It's been 2 days and I'm still reeling from the whirlwind of this story. Colleen Hoover is a visionary and to write this story it takes knowing the feelings that are in it and that's the beauty of it. It's so human. I can't rave enough about it and everyone should get it and bite their fingernails down to nubs and lose sleep over this book because it's worth it!
title: This book ruined my 5 year no reading streak..

author: Ron Brown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2017
review_content: Texas writer Colleen Hoover is one of the few authors that I read consistently. I’ve read all of her books and I’ll read any she puts out. However, Hoover openly admits that her books aren’t meant to be deep or meaningful; they’re simply entertaining. That is, until she wrote New York Times bestseller It Ends With Us.Hoover advises readers to go into the novel blind and with as little information about the plot as possible. I took her advice and am grateful that I did because It Ends With Us is shocking and heartbreaking in the best way possible. That being said, all I’ll say about the storyline is that it’s told through the first person perspective of a headstrong young woman, Lily Bloom, who falls in love with a charming and mysterious neurosurgeon named Ryle.From the very first page, the novel is captivating and intense in typical Colleen Hoover fashion. It starts out flirty and a little provocative and I thought I had this book all figured out early on. But about half way through—note that this is not to say that the first half is just fluff—the story takes a dark and twisted turn that I was not expecting.From there, I was forced to stay up until the early hours of the morning to finish the novel. I cried, laughed, got angry, cried some more. This book made me question my own beliefs and made me see through an entirely different perspective than the one I’d been looking through for most my life, something that isn’t easy to do and something that is the hallmark of a great novel.I should mention that this book is not for the young or faint of heart. It is painfully honest and real and features adult themes and mature subject matter. However, if you’re up for it, It Ends With Us is a story full of well-developed characters, a riveting plot that avoids clichés, and commanding, clever writing. This story is deeply personal to the author and it swiftly became my favorite Hoover novel. If someday I can tell a story half as good—and important—as this one, I’ll be very happy.
title: I took her advice and am grateful that I did because It Ends With Us is shocking and heartbreaking in the best way possible

author: Erica
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2016
review_content: I liked this because I got a taste of YA Colleen Hoover mixed with her contemporary. I hope there's more YA from her sometime in the future. She writes it so well. I had a love/hate relationship with the storyline. Which means it was great, I just didn't like it when it made me sad. And I got really sad a few times!!Overall, it was really cool to experience this from Lily's eyes. I felt her pain in this situation and was really proud of her (and sad for her). I'm honestly not sure how I would have handled it if I was in her position and that threw me for a loop. You just never know until you walk in someone else's shoes.
title: Too realistic but so good

author: Ginab
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
review_content: Such a heart wrenching book. It helps to understand a bit why women stay and also why they leave. It helps to be more empathic towards what goes through in an abusive relationship. Whether physical or emotional, psychological abuse, it’s all terrible.Nonetheless, a beautiful story that keeps you wanting to read more and understand better.
title: A beautiful and heartbreaking story.

author: Melissa Correa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2016
review_content: I say the same thing everytime I read a Colleen Hoover book: She never disappoints. Never. But here's the thing, This is the first time I have read a book of hers, and have been completely speechless when I was done. How does she do it? Is she a real life person? Sometime I have to question it. I don't know how she is able to write something so wonderful, and so beautiful. I really had anxiety through out the entire book. I think I went through every emotion reading this book. Never has this happen to me, ever. I am grateful for this book. It's a big issue that this world goes through, and we all have no clue exactly what goes on behind those doors. There has been so many times where I have questioned people, second guessed their decisions. I really had no clue. Thank you Colleen for opening my eyes. Thank you for your words, inspiration, dedication and thank you for reliving those heart aches, so that you could possibly save a life one day from your writing. Thank You. A job well done!
title: Holy Hell that was AMAZING
